152.content:
This story take place in Unova during the event of B2&W2.

This is no good, you just got shrunk by the legendary pokemon itself Mew. Plus it seems to challenge you find it, but how you suppose to find Mew at your new size? Is this truly a game of Hide & seek or a some kind of trap? Regardless Mew is already gone and you don't know where is she...

You can't believe what Mew has done to you. She shrunk you down to 1 or 2 inches and leaves you like this. This is the worst thing that just happen to you! And what worse is also you have no pokemon partner! That's right, you're a 12 years old pokemon trainer who still have not caught a single pokemon and have no partner. There no way you will be able to find Mew at your new size and plus any wild pokemons will be very dangerous to you! They're all going to be like dynamaxed! Good thing you're not too far from Aspertia city, otherwise you'll have too survive from the wild. So, with no other option you decide to trying find help as possible as you head towards the city...

Meanwhile in Aspertia city, Bianca the 16 years old trainer who work as professor Juniper's assistance has just give the Unova starters to two new pokemon trainers Hugh and Nate/Rosa (You decide in the next chapter) walk down from the stairs chatting with the protagonist. The protagonist wondering about the last remain pokemon and Bianca replies "Don't worry, I'm sure we'll find a trainer eventually or otherwise I will take good care of it. Anyway, I have to head back to professor Juniper's lab so take care of your pokemon and good luck for your journey, bye!" she waves at the protagonist as they wave back. However, at the moment she ran, she end up to trip by klutz and falls on the ground as the protagonist ran over to help her to get up and the poke ball that contain the last starter is sending fly out of the box...

Back to you, you made in town without problem but now "Oh my Arceus..." the city is so huge! How are you getting attention of someone at your tiny size? You could easily get stepped and even end up to... *Funeral coffin dancing meme video* No! You'll survive and find a way to return at your normal size. But you wonder if peoples will believe that you got shrunk by Mew? Well, you do have the proof with your selfie picture with Mew but it also shrunk with you and it would be impossible for the normal sized person to see the picture not even a magnifying glass will help because your pokenav is kinda at the size of speck!

Then your thought get interrupted by a large poke ball who is twice bigger than you landing right infront of you cause you to fall on your butt on the ground. "What the..." this is all you could say before the poke ball suddenly open front your eyes as the pokemon come out.

Still sitting on the ground, what you see is jaw drop. Infront you, there a like dynamaxed ______ standing there confused.

*Note this pokemon will becomes your first partner, but you must following the logic by what pokemon that Hugh and the protagonist have pick early. Example:

You with Snivy = Protagonist with Tepig & Hugh with Oshawott.

You with Tepig = Protagonist with Oshawott & Hugh with Snivy.

You with Oshawott = Protagonist with Snivy & Hugh with Tepig.
152.title: The day where you get your first "giant" pokemon

choices: You told Snivy to bring you home. You'll figure out what to do there
You told Snivy to go deeper into the forest. Time to go after Mew!
Searching for the Pokeball, Bianca eventually found you and Snivy
1521.content:
"Sni?" the grass-type you recognized as a Snivy muttered softly, looking around for whoever called her out of her Pokeball. However, she saw no one, which was weird.

Snivy, along with other two Pokemon, had been used to sit around in Professor Juniper's lab, awaiting for a trainer to come pick their first Pokemon; if she was called out, then that must mean that she was picked.

Needless to say, the grass-type was vaguely excited about meeting her new trainer. Problem was, she couldn't find them.

As for you, you just sat there, eyes wide open and not making a motion; in front of you, the large Snivy didn't appear to have noticed, and you weren't sure whether that was a good or bad thing. You could see her massive, scaly stomach extending far above, where her head was turning left and right as the behemoth apparently looked for something.

In the end, you decided not to draw attention towards you and to shy away as quietly as possible, lest the Snivy ended up mistaking you for a snack and treating you as such.

Slowly, you got back on your feet and began backing up. However, the motion caused the grass to rustle.

"Snivy?" the large Pokemon called as she turned her head and looked down, finally spotting something in the grass. Or better, she spotted someone.

"S-Snivy?" she stuttered, leaning down on her slim legs, getting onto her belly to better look at you, who were frozen by fear, which only amplified as you found yourself face to eye with the green and yellow giant.

However, it seemed the Pokemon had no interest in causing you harm; instead, it looked like she was studying you...

Snivy felt confused.

She was supposed to meet a trainer, that was why she had heard from Professor Juniper as well as her assistant Bianca, yet all she found was what appeared to be an incredibly small human...

Tilting her head slightly, giving a soft cry of her name, Snivy came to the conclusion that her trainer... must have been you.

It made sense. You must have been the one picking her, releasing you from her Pokeball.

Upon realizing this, the Pokemon shot you a haughty look.

"Snivy." she said, sounding... disappointed?

"P-Please don't eat me!" you blurted out once you regained enough courage to speak.

"Sni? Vy." the Pokemon replied, shaking her head with a sigh. How had she even ended up with you?

Then again, you were her trainer now, so she supposed she had to stick with you... though it really looked like you were the one who needed to stick with someone right now.

You watched as the giantess rose slightly, muttering her own name a couple times, before reaching out a paw.

"Snivy." she said, urging you to climb on with her free hand.

"Uh... thanks?" you uncertainly said, surprised by this turn of events. Instead of eating you, it looked like the Snivy was actually lending you a hand... quite literally in fact.

As you climbed on top of the paw, the giant Pokemon rose it back up as she herself rose to her feet and stood still, contemplating you.

You just stared back at the Pokemon, unsure what you should have said. What was she even going to do to you?

Regardless, you had to try and get her to help you out, maybe by asking her to bring you to someone or something like that.

You didn't know if she was going to listen or if she was even going to understand you, but... it was worth a shot.

"H-Hey," you stuttered, still a bit afraid,
"Look, I know that this may seem confusing and, trust me, it is, but I really, really need your help right now..."

Snivy tilted her head.

"You see, I met a, uh... Pokemon that did this to me earlier, that made me shrink to this size, and I need to find a way to get it back. So, can you help me?"

To your surprise, the Snivy appeared to understand what you said, and the surprise became greater when you saw her nodding her head, signaling that she agreed to help.

"Y-You're... going to help me out?" you wondered aloud.

"Vy." the grass-type replied affirmatively, nodding her head once more.

Well... this was a relief, you guessed.

Yet...

"Wait a sec, why are you helping me though?" you asked. Snivy were supposed to be pretty cold Pokemon, from what you knew, but this one was willing to help you out even though she had just met you.

In response, the giantess gave a perplexed cry, then pointed to the ground; turning around, you saw the Pokeball she popped out of earlier.

"Huh...?" you said, trying to figure out what that meant; and, when the Snivy then pointed to you, it helped you realized that...

"... You think I'm your trainer?" you muttered under your breath, looking back at the green giantess, who nodded her head,
"Snivy."

You put a hand to your head, pensive.

This had all been one major mistake... but one you could work with, because you really had no other choice; if this Snivy believed you were her trainer, you could convince her to do as you said, as long as you watched the way you said it: Snivy and their evolutions were extremely prideful creatures.

"Um, okay Snivy, first off..." you trailed off, causing 'your' Pokemon to tilt her head.

You couldn't deny that the idea of actually having a Pokemon thrilled you, but you couldn't think about that right now, even though you really had no idea what to do now.

Should you go after Mew? Return home to sort things out? Find help from someone?

Your head started aching, and you distractedly looked down, spotting Snivy's Pokeball again.

Right, you supposed you shouldn't just leave that laying around.

"Uh, Snivy, can you pick that Pokeball for me, please?" you asked as nicely as you could.

The Pokemon nodded, then bent to pick the Pokeball, which she offered to you; it was about twice your size, making it impossible for you to carry, but pressing the button in the middle should do the trick.

In fact, once you did, the Pokeball shrank to the size of a soccer ball and fell next to you on Snivy's verdant palm.

"Okay..." you said, picking the sphere up, before looking back at the giantess, who was waiting orders from you.

Still unsure about what you should have done, you began pondering your next course of action.
1521.title: Mistake meeting

choices: Travel with Rosa, hoping to find Mew during the journey
Going with Bianca to Professor Juniper's lab
15213.content:
You can't believe how lucky you got there, getting your first pokemon partner shortly after been shrunk by Mew. However, your happy time has sooner turns down when you realize something...

The poke ball just arrives from nowhere and almost landing right on you. Then Snivy pops out from it and thinks you're her trainer.

You begin to feel that pokemon already belong to someone else and keep that pokemon may be a bad idea even if you wanted to. But stealing pokemon is no good...

So, the best option is helping the pokemon to find it real owner, maybe the person will repay you by helped you to return at your normal size...

Looking at the big poke ball that you hold with your both arms, it a little heavy for your size but you manage to carried this. You sigh, you hate breaking the new but you have to.

Feeling guilty, you begin to explained to your pokemon that you would love to keep it. "Um... well... listen, Snivy..." you says as she pays attention "...I-I'm going to be honest... I don't know if-"

"Ha! There you are, Snivy!"

You suddenly get interrupted by a feminine person who comes from behind Snivy.

"Vy?" she turns her attention toward the call, holding you with her poke ball in her hands. And you saw a teenage blonde girl wearing a orange jacket, green jeans, green hat with a white bow and wearing glasses approached you and Snivy.

"(She must been it owner.)" you think and you get really nervous as the giantess arrives and towering you. Facing toward a small pokemon like Snivy is already make you feel smaller, but facing a normal sized human make you feel even more smaller and you don't want to imagined how large pokemons are going to be like.

"I almost thought losing you after I trip. At least you're seem to be alright." Bianca says as Snivy blinks and looks at you, then realizes that you're not one of the trainer who is waiting for her.

Biance crouch down toward Snivy still not noticed what she's holding and brings her hand for the poke ball. "Anyway, lets return you in your poke ball an-" before she could finish, Snivy suddenly tosses you and her poke ball into Bianca's hand, the grass snake look piss off as she crosses her arms.

Bianca does notice her attitude, before she could asked what wrong with her. She felt something moving on her palm, she looks down and saw a person helding the poke ball in hand. Bianca takes a close look adjusting her glasses for make sure if she's not dreaming.

"Um... H-hi there..." you say awkwardly as her green eyes wided. "Wh-WHAT!" she scream as she almost falls on the floor as you hold yourself on her palm from her reaction.

"Bianca!" another person that sound like a pre-teen girl arrives with a pig who follow her behind. "Have you found it?"

"Yes, Rosa but..." she replies and shows the tiny person at her as Rosa's surprised by what she see in front her eyes.

"Are you okay? Why are you so small?" one of the girl asked.

A few moments later, you have explained what happened. About you met Mew, it playing with you, you taken a selfie with this pokemon and at the end Mew shrinks you down and leave you in that way, unless you find it. And then the part you meet Snivy and here we are...

"...and that's what happened." you finished your story. The girls seem found it hard to believe that you meet the legendary pokemon Mew, but judging by your size...

"I swear, I'm telling the truth and I did have a proof but..." you look at your pokenav where you have the picture but it shrunk with you and there no way they could see the picture at your normal size.

"It's okay, I believe you." Bianca says and Rosa believes as well. "Thank you, girls." you reply.

"By the way, my name's Bianca. I'm assistant of professor Juniper, nice to meet you." she introduces herself to you.

"I'm Rosa, pokemon trainer and this is my partner, Tepig!" she picks up her pokemon to show you as he greets you with a cry "Tepig!"

"My name is (Your name) and I'm a pokemon trainer too but... I kinda don't have a pokemon, yet..." you awkwardly introduce yourself.

"Wait, you don't have a pokemon." Rosa says and you nodded. Poor you, Rosa and Bianca feel really bad for you. Even Snivy who still out of her poke ball has listening the conversation. First she was still angry at you but until she heard that you have no pokemon, she begins to felt bad for you.

Deep thought, Snivy believes it would been a good idea to become your first pokemon. Maybe having a tiny trainer would not be that bad at all. Then a vile come out from Snivy's shoulder and reach for you.

At the moment you feel something wrapped around your body, drag you off from Bianca's hand and bring you to Snivy's body. "Snivy? What are you doing?" the girls watch.

Snivy doesn't replies as she brings you close her and presses you against her chest giving you a big hug. "S-snivy!?" you cried in embarrassing as she patted you head gently.

The girls giggle as they admire its cute. The Snivy looks at Bianca and tries something as she pointed at herself and then at you. Not too long before they get the message.

"So, you want be his pokemon, right?" she asks and Snivy nods.

"That's a good idea! I'm sure professor Juniper will be okay with it. So what do you think?" Bianca asks you.

Before your answer, you look up at the giant Snivy who smiled down at you. Then you smile back, wide your arms and hug her back as you say "I have no objection."

"Its decided, Snivy is yours now."

*Pokemon received music*
You have received Snivy!

"(Huh? Did I just heard a music?...)" you look around "(Nah! Must be my imagination.)"

"Alright, I got my first pokemon but it still doesn't solves the problem of my size. Now what?" you say

"Oh I know, you could come with us! Tepig and I will help you to find Mew and convince it to return you at normal size. Beside it'll be fun having more companions on our journey right, Tepig?" Rosa suggests as Tepig agreed.

"Or... I could take you to professor Juniper. I'm sure she and Fennel will find a way to fix you." Bianca says

Well... It seems not be bad their ideals. You always wanted to begin your pokemon journey as a trainer and become champion but at your new size... it'll been much harder. But at least, you'll have another trainer by your side. But if you go with Bianca to Juniper's lab, it maybe the best option but it'll probably going to be boring to wait, but at least you could probably play with your Snivy will during the wait.

You look up at your new partner Snivy who seems to have no objection of your decision. So, you decide to...
15213.title: Meeting Bianca and Rosa

choices: Meeting Hugh (Maybe).
Teamwork!
Nothing Happens.
Call from the Prof.
Rosa with the capture.
152131.content:
You decided to go on an adventure with Rosa and Tepig. The main reason was that it wasn't guaranteed that the professors could fix you, while Mew promised it would grow you back if you found it, meaning that going out would give better odds of growing then just staying still at a lab. Another reason was sort of silly, it's just that ever since you were young you wanted to be a pokemon trainer. While this isn't exactly the situation you imagined, it would still be awesome, riding a pokemon as small as a Snivy throughout the lands.

The two girls and two pokemon stared down at you as you made your choice. "I'd like to travel with Rosa and Tepig, if you wouldn't mind having me, of course."

"Of course not! Isn't that right Tepig?"

"Te-Pig!"

Bianca sighed. "Alright, if that's your choice I won't complain. I'll still tell the professor about you so they'll be looking into it while you're keeping each other company. You should expect a call from them soon Rosa."

"Got it!"

You got the attention of your new partner Snivy by tapping on the vine that is still holding you. "Hey Snivy, are you okay with this?"

Snivy put her paw up in a gesture mimicking an army salute. "Sni-Vy!", which you took to mean yes.

After plenty of precautions from Bianca including giving you her X-Transceiver number and such Bianca went her separate way towards the lab, while you stayed on Snivy's head as Snivy walked alongside Rosa. Rosa had tried to hold you herself but Snivy vehemently refused, seemingly very attached and protective of you. You trusted Rosa but said nothing, knowing that Snivy didn't mean any harm and shouldn't be reprimanded for something so minor.

The trio of you walked through the gate and into the route outside of the town. Thankfully Snivy was a somewhat tall pokemon, as you could just barely look over the grass while on Snivy's head. You shuddered to think of how terrifying grass would be while blinded by it. You and Rosa talked through X-Transceivers, mostly to not make Rosa look crazy for talking to herself. While on your way to the next town...

A: Hugh shows up and challenges Rosa to a battle. Wether Hugh finds out about you or not is up to you.
B: You work together with Snivy to catch a pokemon, either Snivy herself throwing the ball or you dropping it on a fainted pokemon.
C: Nothing happens and you successfully make it to the next town!
D: As promised, a call from Professor Juniper comes.
E: Rosa is the one that catches a new pokemon, which means a brand new Pokemon to introduce you to.
152131.title: Off on an adventure.

choices: Challenge Rosa to a rematch battle!
Challenge you instead Rosa to a battle!
Challenge both of you to a double battle!
1521311.content:
*Note: Normally Hugh had already have a starter that he raises it from the egg, but in this story Hugh has pick a starter from Bianca instead.

As Rosa walks toward the destination with her Tepig and your Snivy with you on her head who following her. You and Rosa contine chatting to getting known each others. Then the conversation gets interrupted by a boy with a Oshawott standing on the way.

"Hey, Rosa!" Hugh calls her as he approaches the group who turned their attention at him.

"Oh, hi! Hugh, how are you doing?"

"Fine. Oshawott and I have caught a lot pokemons. And how about you?"

"Well... we just starting our journey... and we still haven't done anything, yet." Rosa puts one of her hand behind her head.

Meanwhile, you listen the conversation from the two giants trainers who towering you, while your Snivy is distracted by a certain sea otter pokemon who keep staring at her.

As Snivy turns her attention at Oshawott, his eyes begin to gleaming with a wide smile and blushing. Oshawott waves at Snivy in excitement as she rolls her eyes, letting out a sigh and wave back at him.

Among of the three starters, Snivy was the only female in the trio. Her relation with Tepig is neutral, but with Oshawott... its another story. Oshawott really likes Snivy and he even trying to flirt with her. Well... Snivy doesn't really hate Oshawott, but its just she's sometime annoyed by that otter when he tries to impressed her.

As Oshawott approaches Snivy, he pauses when he notices there something on her head or more like someone.

"Wott.. Osha-Oshawott?" *"Um... Snivy, you have an human on your head?"*

Snivy simply giggle, bring one of her vines, pull you off of her head, bring you to her paws and hold you close to her chest.

"Snivy vy sni-Vy, snivy vy vy sni." *"So you finally notice it, Oshawott. This is (Your name) and he's my trainer."*

Not sure what is going on with the two pokemons but the fact your Snivy is showing you to Oshawott. You decide to introduce yourself to him.

"Um... Hi, my name is (Your name)... and I'm her trainer. Nice to meet you, Oshawott!" you greet at the giant sea otter.

Oshawott was stunned with jawdropped, he cannot believed what he just see, an tiny male human in the hands of Snivy. In same time Oshawott felt kinda... jealous. He wishes he could be in your place, been held by Snivy as a giantess would be... *dreaming*.

Back to Rosa & Hugh, Hugh were about to asking a rematch. But until he notices Snivy standing next to Rosa.

"Wait.... is that Snivy?" that caught your attention and Snivy's as well. "What is it doing here? I thought Bianca had take it back to Juniper. Don't tell me that you convince her to give it to you?"

Rosa giggles "Not really, she's not mine. Snivy got her own trainer!"

"Really?" Hugh looks around but there no one else. "But where is the trainer? I don't it anywhere."

Rosa giggles again and replies "He's right there." she pointed at Snivy "Take a close look."

"Huh?" Hugh does what Rosa says as he crouch down in front Snivy. The snake pokemon who stared at him sighes and raise you up to give him a good view on you as you awkwardly wave your arm at him. Hugh's red eyes wided and...

"WHAT THE F-" that could be heard from the towns.

After a moment of explanation about what happened, Hugh finds it hard to believed that you met the legendary pokemon Mew & think that you must be shrunk by the Team Plasma which he hates them because they stole the Purrloin of his little sister and he will do everything to get it back.

"I'm telling you the truth, I also have a proof! I had taken a selfie with Mew and the picture is in my pokenav. But it shrunk with me and I don't think you could see this at your normal size."

"Unless if you could send the picture to my X-Transceiver" Hugh says

You pause for a moment and slap yourself on your head. Why you don't think about it.

"Hold on, I will try to send it to Rosa's" you say since you know her number. You hope it'll working and success Rosa receives the picture.

Rosa looks in her X-Transceiver, Hugh takes a look as well and they could clearly the picture of you with Mew sitting on your laps. Both were amazed by the fact you truly met Mew.

"So, do you believe me now?" you ask

"Y-yeah..." Hugh replies "But is professor Juniper aware about this?"

"Well... We haven't receive a call from her, yet. But she should call us soon." Rosa explain

"I see..." Hugh "Now then, how about we have a pokemon battle?"

"Huh?" you, Rosa and even the pokemons were surprised by his suggestion.

A: As Hugh were say, he still want to take a rematch against Rosa. So, you and Snivy watch the match between Rosa and Hugh.

B: Hugh decides to challenge you instead Rosa. For your first battle, its your Snivy vs his Oshawott. You may have a chance to win, because Snivy has advantage against water. Unless if Oshawott got a lot stronger than you could expected.

C: Hugh decides to challenging both of you and Rosa in a double battle and he introduces his second pokemon.
1521311.title: Meeting Hugh & Oshawott

choices: You were able to make it to the next city without trouble
Some Pokemon came out on the way to the city
Rosa had an idea; she suggested that you and her had a battle
1521314.content:
As you sat on top of the head of your new Pokemon, said Pokemon walked alongside Rosa, who shot a glance down at you every now and then to check on you, albeit Snivy seemed to be handling you pretty well by herself, even though she let you carry her Pokeball by yourself.

"So... what's the next town?" you casually asked, attempting to strike up a casual conversation with Rosa.

"Floccesy Town. It'll probably take us a while, though." Rosa answered, shooting you a smile.

"Sn-snivy." Snivy chimed in. You patted her on the head,
"Are you sure you're fine walking all the way there?" you asked.

"Sni." your Pokemon replied, nodding her head slightly, careful not to throw you off.

It was a good sign, you guessed; usually, it took some work to gain a Snivy's trust, but this one seemed to have a decent amount of that in you; sadly, you couldn't say the same for Rosa, whom your Snivy won't even let touch you.

You guessed she just had to learn to trust other people aside from you.

Anyway, your attempt at striking up a conversation failed miserably, as the trip continued as silent as before.

However, that changed the moment your X-Transceiver began ringing as an unknown number appeared on the display, causing both Snivy and Rosa to stop.

"Who's that?" the latter asked.

You shrugged, then cautiously picked up the call, wondering who it was; your question was answered when the image of a brown-haired woman with green eyes appeared on the screen, wearing a smile.

"Hello! This is Professor Juniper, from Nuvema Town," the woman politely introduced herself,
"And you must be the trainer Bianca had told me about, right?"

"Um..." you hesitated, unsure how to reply,
"I think?"

"Bianca says that one of the Pokeballs she was supposed to deliver ended up getting lost, but someone found it and the Pokemon inside was fine with them being her trainer." the Professor explained,
"Would that be you?"

"Snivy."

"Yes." you answered, blushing a bit,
"I hope that's not a problem, um... Professor,"

In response, Professor Juniper smiled.

"Oh, not at all," she said, while Rose knelt beside Snivy to try and follow the conversation; Snivy just leered at the trainer and took a few steps away.

"Personally, I think that if a Pokemon chooses a specific trainer, then it's tantamount to a trainer choosing a Pokemon." the Professor continued, before waving a hand dismissively,
"Anyway, that's not what I called you for. Bianca contacted me earlier, telling me about you; she referred about a... particularity of yours, developed upon your encounter with the legendary Pokemon Mew. I was hoping you could give me some details about it."

You nodded your head.

"Wonderful. Start from the beginning, please," Professor Juniper encouraged

"Okay." you replied, feeling a bit uncomfortable,
"So, it began earlier today, when I was sleeping on the outskirts of town. I was woken up and discovered that a Mew was there with me..."

You then proceeded to explain all that had happen during the short time you spent with Mew, from her playing silly games with you to her shrinking you down to size, challenging you to find her before taking off; then, you explained your encounter with Snivy, then with Bianca and Rosa.

"And then we decided to travel together, in search of Mew." you finished, Rose doing a silly victory pose beside you.

At the end of your tale, Professor Juniper looked slightly skeptical.

"I see," she said, adopting a serious expression,
"Look, can you demonstrate what you are saying in any way? You don't need to, but I would appreciate that."

"Uh... I had a picture, but... hold on," you said. It would be much easier showing your proof to the professor, since you could simply send her the selfie you had taken with Mew. You guessed that tech was a blessing, after all.

There were a few moments of silence, during which the Professor appeared to be looking somewhere else, before she finally looked back at you with a smile.

"That is undoubtedly a Mew. Thanks for sharing," she told you.

"Is there a way to... y'know, fix me?" you asked, not bothering to hide the anxiety in your voice.

"Sni-snivy!" Snivy intervened, curious about that as well; having a doll-sized trainer was sort of cool, but she guessed that having a full-sized one meant she didn't have to take care of you all the time.

The professor looked to the side with a flustered smile.

"Well... not any that I know of," she replied, causing you to groan,
"But I can at least try to find a way, so that, even if you don't find Mew, we can at least give it a shot ourselves. Because, I'm sorry to say, I think the chances of finding that Mew again are considerably low."

"Geez..." Rosa complained,
"It's almost like you don't want us to find Mew, Professor..."

"Don't be like that, I'm sure everything is going to be just fine." Professor Juniper reassured,
"So, I'll be going now, I wish you two the best of luck. And, take good care of your Snivy, alright?"

"Of course." you replied.

The Professor offered one last smile, before she ended the conversation, leaving you back with Rosa and Snivy.

"Well, that's a relief." the former commented.

"It is, though I'm hoping to find Mew as well. It would give this journey much more sense." you replied.

"Yeah, and speaking of journey, we should probably." Rosa said playfully, getting back up,
"C'mon, on to Floccesy Town!" she said, marching forward.

Snivy looked at her with contempt, which you noticed.

"Don't be like that, at least she's eager." you chided.

"Vy." Snivy huffed with a shrug as she went to follow Rosa.

15213141.content:
As your Snivy follows Rosa with you riding on her head, sometimes Rosa founds some items on the ground such like potion, poke ball, battle item, etc. even you pokemon partner does found some, but she had no choice but gives it to Rosa. You were amazed by this man how he landing from the high cliff without getting hurt. You wonder how he do this, but regardless you don't even want to try it, it would been suicide...

As soon, the man turns towards Rosa, you recognized this man, it's Alder the champion of Unova! Well, he was the champion but now he's retired for some reason.

No pay attention at the conversation as Alder examines the teenage trainer girl as you still were amazed by meeting the former champion. Then Alder turns his attention towards your Snivy.

First, he thinks that pokemon is Rosa's partner but until... "And I guess that pokemon is y-" he pauses when he notices there something on the pokemon's head as he crouch down to take a close look.

Surprised, you realize that Alder had finally noticed you as you getting nervous. However, Snivy notices it too, quickly she snatches you from her head with one of her vines, brings you to her arms and holds you against her chest in a protective pose like if she's holding her child.

"(Darn it, Snivy!)" you muffled "(We seriously going to talk about it!)"

Rosa laughs about Snivy's action and decides to explained at about what happened for you.

Meanwhile, not too far in the bushes, a shadow figure with greenish blue eyes watches the trainers chatting with the former champion but what is really caught it attention is the tiny human who ride on Snivy's head. As Alder leads the two news trainers in the town, the mystery figure watches them headed to the town and it decides to go after them. Before it come out from it hiding spot, it suddenly glows dark purple and begin to changing form and what come out from the bushes is a youngster boy with a creepy smile expression who walks bizarrely on his two legs and heads towards the town. A gray tail is visible on his rear...

Back to you, Alder leads Rosa and you still riding on your Snivy to the college. Rosa asks Alder if he has see her friend Hugh, she almost forgot that she had two town maps, one for herself and the other for Hugh, and she must gives it to him.

Alder says he does have see a boy with his Oshawott pass by and headed to the route 20. Rosa decides to go find him.

"Thanks, I'm going find him." she look down at you and say "You come?" you nod.

"Let's go!" she ran towards the route 20 with Snivy who went after her.

"Wait!" Alder calls but too late, he was about to suggested you to stay but they already gone. Alder still have some questions to asked you but now it'll have to wait as he sighes.

While waiting for their return, Alder notices a strange boy passes in front him. He was about to get his attention when...

"Mister Alder!" a young girl calls him as he turns his attention towards the girl who approach of him. "Mister Alder, I-"

"A moment, young one..." Alder turns back and... "Huh?"

The strange boy is already out of the sight and he's nowhere to been found.

Rubbing his grin, he wonder where the boy just go? "Strange, I have a bad feel about..."

152131411.content:
You (still riding on your Snivy's head) and Rosa travel the route 20, unaware that there someone who following them in distance.

Guess Rosa haven't no choice but accepted the challenge and beside she could try to catch that Riolu if she could. With her Tepig ready, the fight begin!

With you, your Snivy walks toward the bench with you still sitting on her head, she uses her vine to pick you up and place you on the bench. Then Snivy hops on the bench, sits right next to you and listens what you have to say.

What you want to talk is about her attitude toward Rosa and you would like your Snivy gives her some respect. Because when she leers at Rosa, stepped back from her and hold you tight against her chest, you feel like a doll that the pokemon doesn't want to be taken away. And you don't want it go too far or worst. You trust Rosa as a friend and Snivy should do the same.

As you were about to tell at your Snivy about this, a shadow figure approach. "Alright, Snivy. We need talk about..." *Shadow looming above you* "...Rosa? You're back already? So, what they say?" however you notice a smirk on her expression as she's just standing in front you.

"Umm... Rosa?"

Rosa still say nothing, instead she brings her hand toward you trying to pick you up. Snivy notices that and hisses at her, but Rosa ignores her as her hand reached toward you and...

*Whip*

Snivy use Vine whip on Rosa's hand as she steps back screaming in pain. And what you heard it's not Rosa's voice but a pokemon noise and when she turns it revealed there a tail above of her rear. That make you realize that's not Rosa as the illusion wore off revealed the imposter.

"Is that... a Zorua?!"

What happen next?

A: Zorua glare at Snivy and prepare to attacked her and the pokemon battle begins!

B: As his plan failed, Zorua got a idea to trying to convince you to let him join in your journey, you're happy to let him in but Snivy in other... She's not certain to trust that fox. Plus, Rosa have the empty poke ball, so you have to wait her return. But can you really trust that pokemon?

C: Before you or your Snivy could do anything, Zorua fled. You thinking about to go after him but you get interrupt by the real Rosa who come back with a new pokemon she caughts Riolu and leads you to find Hugh. However, Zorua have not say his last word...
152131411.title: An illusion encounter

choices: ... Indifferent. Seems like she hardly cared about losing.
... Bitter. Looks like she didn't like losing...
15213143.content:
Time drew on quite slowly as Rosa and you... well, Rosa and Snivy walked along the path while you sat on the latter's head, all three of you traveling in complete silence.

It was almost kind of boring; you had imagined a journey to be much more fun that this... well, you guessed your main objective wasn't really having fun or satiating some kind of lust for adventure: your own life was on the line here...

You were snapped out of your train of thought when you felt something poking you in the side; turning around, you saw it was the paw of your Pokemon.

Turns out you were so lost in your own thoughts that you had been completely ignoring Snivy for who knew how much time.

"Hm? What's up, Snivy?" you asked; noting that she had finally gotten your attention, the Pokemon lowered her arm and pointed it forward, to where Rosa was standing without moving,
"Sni?"

"Uh, Rosa?" you called, but she didn't hear you, so you quickly searched for her X-Transceiver number on your own device; once she heard it ringing, Rosa looked at it, then back at you.

"Yeah? What's up?" she asked.

"You zoned out."

"Snivy."

Rosa blushed and giggled.

"Oh, sorry... I was thinking about something..." she admitted, before shooting you an unreadable expression, though if you had to make a guess, you'd say it was determination.

"Ehh, wha-"

"So I was thinking, why don't we have a Pokemon battle?" Rosa interrupted; her Tepig, who had been silently walking alongside his trainer the entire time, looked at her,

"Te?" he spoke, emulated by Snivy, who sounded just as curious,
"Vy?"

"A battle?" you parroted back,
"I'm not sure, I've never had an actual battle before..."

"Neither have I! But it'll help us bond with our Pokemon, with each other and it'll be tons of fun, too!" Rosa replied excitedly.

You didn't really know how to reply, so instead you looked down at Snivy.

"What do you think?" you asked, but she didn't listen, as she and Rosa's Tepig were busy talking to each other.

"Perhaps it's better if we don't battle. I mean, wouldn't want to burn you or something..." the fire-type teased with a smug look.

Snivy glared.

"Shut up." she replied with a decent amount of annoyance in her voice, before she turned to you,
"I'm fine with it."

"Um... I'm just going to assume that's a yes." you said, turning to Rosa,
"So I'm in, I guess."

Th giantess smiled and began walking away, stopping when she put some distance between you and her; while she dropped her bag, your Snivy quietly picked you off of her head and placed you on the ground.

"Snivy?" she asked you, for the first time displaying a slight glint of concern in her eyes.

"Yeah, I'll be fine, I think." you reassured.

Snivy hesitated, but then adopted a straight face again as she nodded and turned her back to you.

"Let's do this, then." she cried, noting how Rosa's Tepig was already waiting, and so was his trainer.

"Okay, are you two ready?" Rose asked; then without really waiting for an answer, she declared,
"We'll make the first move! Tepig, use Tackle!"

Immediately, Tepig sprinted towards Snivy at full speed, catching you off guard - for such a small Pokemon, he sure was fast!

You were about to give a command as well, but when you opened your mouth to, you realized something: you had no idea what moves Snivy knew, aside from Vine Whip.

"Ehh..." you hesitated as Tepig approached your Pokemon...
"Dodge!"

On the very last second, Snivy jumped out of the way, resulting in Tepig stopping his run as his opponent swiftly landed beside him.

"Okay, use Vine Whip Snivy!" you ordered, though noticing that your Pokemon was shooting you a diffident look; regardless, she did as told... but Tepig seemed completely unfazed by the attack.

"A grass-type move won't have much effect on a fire-type..." Rosa pointed out, before adding,
"But it'll be super-effective the other way around! Use Ember, Tepig!"

The red and black swine followed the order and shot a wave of hot air through his nostrils, hitting Snivy, who cried her name in pain; Rosa's assault wasn't finished.

"Tepig, use Tackle once more!"

While Snivy was off-guard, Tepig charged at her and hit her, sending her flying; then, on Rosa's command, Tepig jumped surprisingly high and struck his opponent with tackle once more; this resulted in Snivy crashing to the ground.

You sighed. You didn't expect to win your first battle, but you didn't expect to lose this fast, either!

"Snivy!" you called, running towards where you saw Snivy landing; on the other side of the field, Rosa watched, shooting an apologetic look, before looking at Tepig,
"I guess we went a little overboard there, Tepig..."

"Tepig..." the small swine agreed, though he felt a smirk crawling on his cheeks.
'Told her so...'

In the meantime, you finally reached your Pokemon and rushed up to her face.

"Snivy, are you okay?" you asked in concerned manner; you doubted a couple of Tackles had done much damage to her, but she was definitely hurt.
"C'mon girl, talk to me,"

Much to your relief, you saw Snivy opening her brown eyes

"Sn-snivy..." she moaned, before you saw her expression changing as she eyed you; she looked very...
15213143.title: Creating bonds

choices: "I think we should get to town, first."
"Well, a little practice will do us good, I guess..."
152131431.content:
The expression on Snivy's face was hardly concerned about her latest and first loss. She looked more concerned about you though, you could tell when she muttered,

"I'm fine. How about you?"

"I'm fine, don't worry." you replied, guessing what she said to you and apparently guessing right, because she nodded and began to stand up; while she did, you felt the inexplicable need to comfort her, even though she seemed to barely care about losing her first battle.
"Hey, it's fine, anyway. Life's not always about winning, y'know."

Snivy began dusting herself off, muttering her own name under her breath in response.

Then, the grass-type lowered her paw for you to climb on, which you did, before Rosa and her Tepig, who wore a teasing smile on his face, approached.

"Whew, are the two of you alright?" the giantess asked, lowering herself to examine Snivy.

In the meantime, Tepig couldn't help it.

"Did I hurt you that much, Snivy?" he said teasingly, earning a cold stare from the grass-type, who didn't even reply.

"We're fine." you answered Rosa, before sheepishly looking down,
"Though I guess I did that bad for my first battle, hehehe..."

"Not nearly as bad as you believe, but... definitely could've gone way better." Rosa said, before wearing a reassuring smile,
"But, hey, we're all inexperienced here, so don't worry much about it. You'll learn in time."

You looked at her.

"We did barely land a hit." you recalled,
"How was that 'not nearly as bad as you believe'?"

At this, your Snivy sent you a glare.

"Sni..."

"Hey, relax! I'm not saying it was your fault!" you reassured,
"I mean, I didn't even know what moves you could use back there..."

At this, Tepig began laughing and Snivy groaned, once more looking at you with the same haughty look she looked at you when you first met her earlier today.

"H-Hey, don't give me that look, I didn't even know this was going to happen at the beginning of the day!" you defended.

Rosa giggled.

"Well, we can fix that easily!" she said as she pulled out her Pokedex from her bag, before looking at Snivy,
"Now Snivy, do you mind giving me-"

Snivy hissed and stepped back, clutching you to her chest.

"Okay okay! You keep him, girl!" Rosa hastily said, before pointing her Pokedex at your Pokemon,
"Let's see... okay, Snivy knows three moves: Tackle, Leer and Vine Whip, though you already knew about that last one since you used it against Tepig."

"And it barely did a scratch on him."

Tepig adopted a smug look and began waving his paw,

"Te-piiig..."

"That's because it was a grass-type move against a fire-type, you dummy! I've already told you!" Rosa said with a laugh,
"Snivy's a grass type, so her moves will be very effective on water, ground and rock-types, while they'll barely do anything to fire, poison and flying ones."

"Oh, I get it..."

Rosa smiled.

"That's great!" she said,
"Now, let's talk about strategy- oh, wait." she said, turning to dig into her bag once more, emerging with a red bottle that looked like a spray of some sort,
"First, give this to Snivy. It'll help."

You were handed the bottle, that was easy the same size as you were, if not slightly bigger.

"Uh... thanks?" you said,
"What is this, anyway?"

"A super potion."

"Ah. Okay." you said, turning to Snivy, comically holding the bottle like you were hugging it,
"Okay Snivy, this'll help you feel better..."

Snivy nodded her head, complying, as you began spraying her.

--

Ten minutes later Rosa sat down on the edge of the route, with her Tepig happily jumping on her lap; Snivy sat down beside her, you on top of her head.

It was kind of ironic how you were basically the opposite of Rosa with her Pokemon.

"Okay, now let's talk combos," Rosa resumed from where left off,
"You saw what I did back there, yes?"

"You went all-out."

"Wrong... well, not really, but the point is: have you seen how we used Tepig's moves?" the giantess asked, not waiting for an answer,
"Tepig used Ember to blind Snivy, then he attacked while she couldn't move!"

"Ouch..." Tepig mocked, earning a growl from Snivy.

"Oh, I get it now," you replied,
"But how can I do that...?"

"Well... with the moves Snivy knows, a combination of Leer, which can lower a Pokemon's defense, and Tackle can be very effective." Rosa explained, putting a finger to her chin in a cute thinking pose,
"Or maybe, you could use Vine Whip to incapacitate your opponent, that would be very useful, too. Limiting your opponent's movements while..."

"... While Snivy attacks them..." you continued, starting to understand.

You had never really studied about Pokemon and their moves before, but you were starting to understand, which was good: you certainly couldn't take on Mew, if that was the case, with the level of experience you had now.

"... Will result in a great attack!" Rosa happily finished,
"I see you're getting the 'hang' of it, hehehe. However, you should know that those combos won't always help if the moves are ineffective against other types. Don't worry though, Snivy'll learn more moves later on."

"I knew that." you said, recalling a gym battle you witnessed to, once: the challenger used a Serperior, and it was incredibly fast, not to mention powerful - it literally blew away the gym leader's own Pokemon.

Could your Snivy become that much powerful as well? Well, with enough practice, of course...

"Now, about abilities..." Rosa continued.

--

Rosa kept explaining things for a while more, about how moves could be used with a Pokemon's abilities to create devastating consequences on an opponent.

In your case, Snivy had the ability 'Overgrow', which powered up grass-type moves whenever Snivy's health was lowered enough.

Risky, but pretty useful if you needed to turn the tables in a hard battle

You listened closely to the advice you were given and, judging from the look on her face, Snivy was too.

Eventually though, Rosa stopped talking and looked at her X-transceiver. Her eyes went wide.

"Oh, look at the time!" she said, looking up - the sun was slowly setting,
"I didn't realize it was that late! Aw man, we're going to have to spend the night in Floccesy Town..."

"That doesn't sound bad..." you pointed out.

"Yeah, but that's assuming we get there in time!" Rosa said, her Tepig jumping off as she stood up; however, the giantess then hesitated, seemingly thinking. Or better, rethinking,
"... But hey, there's probably still a bit before the sun sets. So, why don't you and Snivy practice a bit?" she suggested with a confident smile.

"... You just contradicted yourself."

"Sn-Snivy."

Rosa rolled her eyes.

"I know, I know, geez..." she said,
"But I think you should practice, for a little bit at least. Y'know, to put what I've told you to the test. I'll leave it up to you though."

Unsure, you looked down at Snivy.

"What d'you say?" you asked. The grass-type shrugged,
"Sni."

So that left the choice up to you.

You thought about it for a moment. There would be plenty of time to practice later, you guessed, but maybe you should take some time to do as Rosa suggested?
152131431.title: Battle advice

choices: You and Rosa meet the former champion Alder
It getting late, so you and Rosa spend night at pokemon center
It getting late, but you still have time for doing some practice with Snivy
1521314311.content:
You thinking deeply about practiced your Snivy just like Rosa suggested, but do it here doesn't really feel safe for your size. Because of course when Snivy sets you down on the ground it leave you vulnerable to the wild pokemons, unless if she hands you to Rosa but you knows she won't doing it unless if you order to do. So you make your decision to go to the town first.

"Let head to Floccesy Town first, it would be more safe for me from the wild pokemons." you says as Rosa understands your point.

"Okay then, let me get my bike, so we'll made to the town much faster." Rosa replies as she reaches for her bag.

"Alright... wait... your wha-" you get cut when Rosa suddenly place her bike right next to herself. Your eyes wided by the large bike before you ask...

"Wait... where your bike comes from?" you ask.

"From my bag, of course!" the giantess replies.

"How?"

"Its simple, I put my bike in my... huh?" then Rosa paused a moment when she just realized that her own bag is much smaller than her bike and don't remember how she has done that. She looks down at you, Snivy and Tepig which all the three of you were focused on her before she continues. "...well I don't know how I have done it...." she finished awardly cause all the three of you to let yourself fall on the ground.

"Anyway, lets move on." Rosa picks her fire pig up and places him in the basket of the bike which it has enough space for two small pokemons. When Rosa turns towards you and Snivy, she was about to pick your Snivy up but without warning Snivy grabs you from her head, holds you to her chest and jumps on Rosa and then jumps on the basket next to Tepig. That almost give you a heart attack by Snivy's action.

Rosa sighes as she sits on the seat and says "Alright, everyone hang on and let's go."

Rosa drives towards to the town as Snivy and Tepig hang on the basket with you hanging in Snivy's grip.

Later, after the ride, you arrive at Floccesy town at last. So what happen next?
1521314311.title: Practice have to wait

choices: Rosa declared it was time to sleep
Rosa wanted to spend time with you, since she got the chance
You suddenly received a call: Bianca wanted to check how you were doing
15213143112.content:
"Ugh, finally!" Rosa exclaimed as she stopped her bike upon reaching the destination you and her had in common: Floccesy Town.

The sun had completely set by the time you arrived, and you were exhausted; your first, disastrous Pokemon battle, as well as the events of the day in general left you almost completely deprived of energy.

Rosa looked at the two Pokemon in the basket of her bike.

"Okay everyone, get out, so I can put this away," she ordered while getting off the seat herself; Tepig jumped out, followed by Snivy, who still held you against her chest.

"Thanks, Snivy," you said once her feet touched the ground again.

"Vy." the grass-type replied, releasing you and placing you on top of her head once more.

You gave her a couple of pats, then you turned to Rosa, who was busy folding her bike, before she stored it away in her bag. Once it was done, she turned around and winked at you,

"Oh yeah, that's how I did that." she said cutely. You gave a thumbs-up.

"So, what now?" you asked, looking around,
"Should we look for a place to crash in for the night?"

"We can agree on that, but there won't be no need to search: the Pokemon Center's got rooms." Rosa explained as she walked past Snivy with Tepig trotting by her side; the giantess stopped for a moment, looked back and gestured for Snivy to follow,
"C'mon."

Though hesitantly, Snivy obeyed.

--

The trip was fairly quiet, mainly because the streets were almost deserted.

Some time later, Rosa stopped in front of a large building with a red roof, the unmistakable symbol of a Pokeball glowing lazily in the night.

At this point, Rosa looked at Snivy, uncertain.

"Um... Snivy?"

The grass-type looked at the giantess, the sudden motion of her head causing you to bounce a bit. Rosa pointed her finger to you,

"I'm sorry, but I really need you to-"

Snivy didn't even let her finish and hissed her name threateningly, easily guessing what Rosa was going to say; you did too, knowing where Rosa was going to say: it'd be weird for people if they saw a Snivy walk in with her trainer riding on her head.

"Snivy." you stepped in, causing her to look at you,
"Do as she says, give me to Rosa."

"Sni, snivy!" Snivy protested.

"Aw, come on! If she was going to try anything, she would've done it already!" you chided, deciding to take the risk and put your foot down,
"Look, I trust her, okay? Now, just give me to her, and nothing's going to happen, 'kay?"

Snivy looked at you in silence for a couple seconds, and so did Rosa; then, grumbling her own name, your Pokemon hesitantly obeyed and picked you from her head, handing you to Rosa, who smiled - this was the first time she got to hold you, something she found extremely cute.

"Thanks." she said, before looking at you,
"Um, I have to... uh..."

"Hide me, I get it." you finished. Rosa nodded, moving you closer to her bag,
"Hopefully, your Snivy won't freak out over this..." she whispered.

At the mention, you glanced back at Snivy, who was, in fact, glaring.

"It'll be fine." you reassured,
"Just for a couple minutes, okay?"

Snivy dropped the glare, though she didn't feel very reassured. She trusted her trainer, but not the other one; so, as Rosa placed you inside of her bag, Snivy swiftly leaped from the ground her shoulder: if she was going through with this, she was at least going to keep a close eye on Rosa, whom she still didn't trust with her trainer.

Said girl sighed as she headed inside, approaching the nurse, who flashed a smile,

"Hello," she greeted,
"How may I help you?"

"I'd like to heal my Pokemon," Rosa replied with a smile of her own as she picked up Tepig, digging her other hand in her bag to retrieve his Pokeball, scaring you in the process,
"And I'd also like a room for the night."

"Sure," the nurse replied while Rosa called Tepig back, placing the Pokeball on the counter; the nurse looked at Snivy,
"And your Snivy...?"

"She's fine." Rosa replied, knowing full well that the grass-type wasn't going to move from her shoulder until you were brought out again.

The nurse didn't insist, but took Tepig's Pokeball.

Two minutes later, she returned with the same Pokeball and a key.

"Here you go, I hope you enjoy your stay." the nurse said.

"Thanks!" Rosa said cheerfully, grabbing the key and her Pokeball, heading to the room she was assigned to, releasing a completely healed Tepig in the meantime.

"Don't you want to be healed too, Snivy?" Rosa asked gently, getting no reply: Snivy was staring at her bag intently.

Rosa rolled her eyes, suddenly looking forward to pulling you out again.

--

When you were finally pulled out from Rosa's bag, you were in a completely different environment; you were in a small, simply furnished room.

"Nice place." you commented from the middle of Rosa's palm as she dropped her bag to the ground, causing Snivy to jump down as well, startled; Rosa's hat followed the bag.

"Yup." she barely had the time to answer, right before a certain grass-type jumped up, attempting to grab you; instinctively, Rosa stepped back.

"Snivy! Seriously, quit that!" you scolded,
"Nothing is going to happen! Just trust me!"

Snivy immediately stopped, though she looked very upset.

"Perhaps that was a bit too harsh." Rosa commented, kicking off her shoes.

You sighed.

"I know, but jeez..."

Rosa smiled and walked to the bed, followed by your Snivy; she wasn't going to oppose, she decided, since it seemed to bother her trainer, but until she wasn't sure Rosa could be trusted, she wasn't going to risk.

Soon after, Rosa was sitting on the bed with Snivy and Tepig on each side of her and you sitting atop her palm.

"Man, I'm beat..." you moaned, stretching,
"So, what now? Do we just call it a day?" you addressed Rosa.
15213143112.title: Night in the Pokemon Center

choices: Bulbasaur (Male)
Charmander (Female)
Squirtle (Male)
152131431123.content:
Suddenly your X-transceiver ringing from your pocket as you reach for it to answer the call. Who it could be?

Then you saw the familiar girl "Hello, (Y/N)!" she says.

"Oh, hello, Bianca!" you reply.

As you're still sitting on Rosa's palm, Rosa raises her hand up, brings you close to her face and tries to get a good look at your minuscule X-transceiver.

However, for Bianca, in the screen of her own X-transceiver, she could see the background behind you is dominated by a giant face and when she saws a giant eye. She screaming as she almost fall on the floor or dropped her device.

"Bianca! Are you alright?" you asked.

"R-rosa?! Is that really you?... Please don't scare me like that!" Bianca says.

"Sorry!" Rosa say in her normal volume but as you were close to Rosa's face, her voice booms at your X-transceiver cause to let out a hyper voice move from Bianca's X-transceiver that alert the neighbors and wild pokemons from her side.

"Not too loud!" Bianca says as Rosa quickly covers her mouth.

Then Rosa just got a idea. "Hold a moment..." she whispered as she places you on the bed next to your Snivy, then goes up, grab her X-transceiver and head towards the bathroom. Leaving you with the two pokemons on the bed.

"Jeez... That was scary..." Bianca says to you.

"Well... You know how I feel..." you reply.

Just then Rosa joins in the call.

"Sorry for caused trouble..." Rosa says

"Its alright, Rosa." Bianca replies "Anyway, how are you going on your journey?"

"We're doing fine, for now..."

You and Rosa tell Bianca about what happened on your first day as a trainer. There's not much to says beside getting know each other, having your first pokemon battle and learning information about your Snivy. And then here we are, at the pokemon center in Floccesy town. Still having not catching a new pokemon.

"...I see. By the way, you don't really have to hide yourself. Professor Juniper has already contacted the pokemon centers about your status. The nurses Joys must already be aware about a trainer that got shrunk by Mew." Bianca explained.

"Really?!" you and Rosa says in same time as Bianca nodded.
You groaned about how pointess that was to hide.

"And about fixing your size... no much info for now, but I believe we'll find a way to fix you eventually." she continues.

"Well, thanks for the info..." you say.

"Oh! Before we go, I have a little gift to give you, (Y/N)." Bianca says

"And what is it?" you say.

"Due of your tiny size, I was thinking about to give a second pokemon partner." Bianca says.

"Really!" you say even Rosa, Snivy and Tepig were surprised by heard it.

"Yes, but its not Oshawott, instead its one of the starter from Kanto: Bulbasaur, Charmander or Squirtle. Actually, that was for Juniper's research, but as I was worry about you, I decide to send one of them to you. Don't worry, I have the permission of professor." Bianca explained. "So which one you want? I will send you the pokemon right at way."

You can't believe that you receive a Kanto starter pokemon, even Rosa's Tepig seems to be exciting to your new member, as for Snivy... well... you only hope she'll get along.

So which Kanto starter pokemon you pick?
152131431123.title: Bianca call + gift

choices: Shy act
Naughty boy act
He just remains stunned for a while
1521314311231.content:
You know you already have a grass type starter but you really like Bubalsaur and it also your favorite Kanto starter since you were a little child. Beside, it have poison type as secondary anyway...

"I choose Bulbalsaur." you say as Bianca simply nod.

"Another grass pokemon? You like grass type, don't you?" Rosa comments about your choice.

"Alright, I will send him right away, nurse Joy will comes to deliver him to you." Bianca explained "Oh! I almost forgot, Bulbarsaur have hidden ability called Chlorophyll, his speed is doubled when the weather is sunny."

"Really? Cool! Thanks for the info, Bianca!" you reply.

"You're welcome. Anyway, take care of Bulbarsaur and good luck on your journey and you too, Rosa. Bye!" then Bianca hang up.

As you hang up you X-transceiver, Rosa comes back from the bathroom and sit down on bed carefully for not bouncing you high. Snivy was almost about to grabs you and doing her overprotective on you but at the end she didn't instead she allows Rosa to picks you up for once. Because she know that it bother you and you trust Rosa as friend, however Snivy still don't fully trust Rosa yet, so she keeps a eye on you.

A few moments later, someone knocks at the door as nurse Joy enters in the room with a poke ball in her hand which that contain Bulbarsaur. Before nurse Joy could say something, she stops sooner when she saws a tiny boy sitting on Rosa's palm who wave at her nervously.

"Oh, you're must be the young boy that professor Juniper has talking about." Joy says and surprisedly she remains calm.

"Y-yeah. Sorry for be hiding from you, we don't know that you are aware about my situation." you say.

"It's okay, anyway, I received a pokemon at deliver from Juniper's assistant and I guess it's for you, right?" she smiles as you nod.

Then Rosa puts you down on the bed, goes up and takes the poke ball from nurse Joy for you.

"So, ready to let him out?" Rosa asks you and you reply yes. Tepig seems to be very excited to meet your Bulbarsaur while Snivy's still neutral.

Rosa throws the poke ball on the bed where you, Snivy and Tepig are on and Bulbarsaur comes out from his poke ball and appeared right in front you.

As Bulbarsaur opens his eyes, the first thing he saws is an tiny human standing in front him cause him to look confused. "Saur?"

As for you, you kinda getting nervous to facing toward a giant Bulbarsaur, but you give yourself the courage to speak.

"H-hi Bulbarsaur, I'm your trainer..." that cause at your new partner to jawdrop and widen his eyes as you continued "Look, I know it's weird but I got shrunk by a certain psychic pokemon and I need help to find that pokemon who did that to me for it returns me to my normal size. Would you be my pokemon and helping me?"

Bulbarsaur has listening your explanation, after a moment he smiles and nodded at you. To say he accepts you to be his trainer.

"Great! Welcome to the team, Bulbarsaur! By the way, my name is (Your name) and this is Snivy, my first partner." you point at Snivy as Bulbarsaur looks at her who simply wave at him. Then Bulbarsaur paused when he saws Snivy and look at he with affection.

*Note: Bulbarsaur falls in love with Snivy. How he will act?
1521314311231.title: Two grass type starters

choices: Oh great, now they're fighting over you.
You thought one overprotective Pokemon was bad...
Tackled to the ground.
Seen as worthless by a weak starter Pokemon.
Oh great, a god complex.
1521314311232.content:
You decide to choose Charmander for one simple reason. When it evolved, it could fly, and every mans dream was to fly through the air on a Pokemon. You let Bianca know, which she simply nodded to.


"Alright, I'll send it over to the Pokecenter and It'll be there in the morning. Just ask Nurse Joy about the gift from me, and she'll have it out for you in a jiffy. Well, I think I've taken enough of your time and Snivy looks ready to jump you as soon as this call is over, and I'd hate to delay her any longer. Sleep well, I hear the Charmander is an affectionate little lady, so you'll need all your energy to keep up with her."

With that, the Transceiver blinked off and, true to Bianca's words, Snivy jumped to grab you instantly. Since Rosa wasn't there to stop her this time, she successfully managed to catch you in her arms then jump up on top of a shelf that Rosa couldn't reach. Thankfully, you still had the X-Transceiver in hand, so you informed Rosa of the situation. She sighed, but ultimately accepted that Snivy probably was starving for contact with you after being forced away for so long, so she just accepted it.

Snivy curled around you in a tight loving grip, not letting anyone touch her trainer. In a weird way this made you relax there more. Eventually, Snivy fell asleep and you followed her in sleeping.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------------

When the sunlight from the morning shone upon you, you woke up, having had this sleeping schedule since you were young. Snivy was still sleeping, so you rubbed her awake, and she blearily lifted her head and said, "Snivy, Snivy?", which you took to mean good morning. Snivy lifted you back up and jumped back down from the shelf, which was alot scarier then going up. Thankfully, Snivy had near perfect grip and balance, and landed softly on the empty bed.

'Wait, empty bed? Then where's Rosa?' You thought to yourself. Not a moment later though, Rosa came into the room holding a pokeball in her hand, with Tepig's pokeball still on her waist, which could only mean one thing.

"Is that Charmander?" You asked her, although the answer was fairly obvious. Rosa responded with a simple "Yep", before opening the pokeball and releasing your new friend to the world. The Pokemon that came out was surprisingly not the standard orange color, but instead a golden yellow color, which was the shiny form of Charmander, a significantly rare genetic difference of around 1 in 6000.

When Charmander came out, she looked around for her trainer, first, she looked up at Rosa and asked with a simple "Charmander?. When Rosa shook her head, Charmander looked around for anyone else that could be a trainer. When she noticed you, she...

(A: Sprinted over and swiped you from Snivy's grasp, angering her greatly, causing the two of them to constantly fight over you.)
(B: Talked to Snivy and learned about you. They eventually came to an understanding that they were the only two allowed to watch over you alone.)
(C: Tackled both you and Snivy to the ground in one fell swoop. It seems the part about being affectionate was slightly underplayed.)
(D: Refused you as her trainer, telling Snivy that you were worthless, causing a rift between Charmander and both Snivy and You.)
(E: Acted High and mighty, demanding you do all sorts of things for her, as she was shiny.)
1521314311232.title: Double the Female Starters.

choices: Stay with Rosa
Split with your Pokemon
15213143112322.content:
As your Snivy and your newly acquired Charmander look at each other. You can’t help but be a bit worried about what might be happening. Will Charmander like you, you surely hope so. You like her... you would love it if she joined your team!

You are her trainer, so normally she would just have to accept it though. However in your case, with your size. You can’t help but worry. What if she denies you, and just sends you an ember. Burning you and then leaving.

You wait and wonder about it for a couple of seconds, until finally you got the chance to take a break. Why? Because she looked to Snivy.

“Char?” She said, her pointed claw down to you.

“Snivy.” Your Pokemon nodded her head. The two of them became closer to you, as they talked above you. You were left waiting and staring at your giant Pokemon as they talked.

“Seems like they are making decisions about you?” Rosa giggled from the side.

“Yeah, it’s kind of backwards.” You say back to her. “Although, I hope it’s good.”

You wait for a long while, until Charmander looked down to you. Her eyes on you, as she moved her hand down to you. She moved her hand and grabbed you. Now with her sharp claws, you were expecting the worst.

However, she was gentle. You can’t argue that. You were grabbed by her two arms and raised up to her face.

Nervously you chuckle. “Well, haha, I guess I am your trainer. Hope you are okay with it.”

“Char!” She chimed happily., as you think that was good.

“W-Wait a second. Are you seriously happy about this! That’s great! I promise Charmander, I will be the best trainer I can be.”

“Mander!” She cheered, just as happy as she brought you in. She must of gotten some warm hugs, cause she was giving you one right now. Holding you against her chest as she gave you a big cuddle.

“Aww...” Rosa had to say, seeing the cute moment from the side. “You got two Pokemon already, and they are big fans about you. Maybe there is something about a small trainer that Pokemon just love.”

“Hehe, maybe.” You say against the scales of the starter. Not only do you have a Charmander as well, she was also shiny. How lucky can you really be. Suddenly, you felt yourself turned around. Your back to her scales as she crossed her arms over you. “I uh... Charmander, thank you for the hug but you can let me down if you want.”

“Ch-Ar!” She said shaking her head in a no. You figured it was that, and you were not really happy about it. She happily defied you, oh uh.

“S-Snivy, a little help here?” You say to your grass Starter. However... she did the exact same.

“Sni-Vy.” She said shaking her head in a no as well. In their minds, you were there trainer who needs to be protected.. So they might as well carry you as well.

You look at them for a couple of seconds, until Rosa had to chuckle.

“W-What’s so funny?” You wonder your way to her, as she simply laughed and found it funny.

“it’s just... you aren’t really in charge of your Pokemon are you. You went from one overprotective Pokemon, to two! You got to admit, it’s a bit funny.” She said.

You looked to Rosa, before you laughed as well. “Yeah, it is pretty funny.”

“Okay, anyway now that is done! Let’s get going on the road. I’ll put you in my...” Rosa trailed off, seeing that she was not actually going to be able to do that. She planned on putting you in her bag and walking, but with these two... maybe she won’t even get you.

“Hey... can I-”

“Snivy!” Your snake said, bringing her chest close to you as well as they both defended you.

“Guess that’s not an option.” Rosa said a bit confused. “Now what?”

“I uh... I got an idea.” You say speaking up about it.

-

“Wow Charmander, you really like that doll that I bought you!” Rosa said out loud, walking her way through the Pokecenter being trailed by three starters. Only one of them being hers. Once outside, she took a breather and walked with them.

“Well that worked.” She said with a smile. “Are you gonna play doll whenever you can.”

“Uh... depends on who we find.” You say to her as she laughed.

“Well, you are as cute as one.” Rosa said down to you as she found that funny to. She was okay with calling you cute. She’s not really been one that has been on about it, calling things cute. Especially boys, but with you she said she had to.

“What’s so funny?” You questioned to her, with her just laughing for a long while.

“Oh nothing. Anyway, I hope you don’t mind. Me trying to catch a Pokemon as well?” She questioned as that was her goal. You look at her before laughing yourself. It’s been very light hearted.

“Sure, you might have to convince my Pokemon though.”

“Charmander, Snivy, can I go ahead and take him with me?” She questioned, before continuing. “You two can come with us.”

“Char!”

“Sniv!” They both laughed, as that was really good. The both of them walked with Rosa, as Tepig jumped around.

“We have been talking about my Pokemon, but how about yours? Tepig seems really excited he’s gonna get a friend.”

“Hahaha!” She laughed, “Tepig wants a friend. Your two Pokemon are too close.”

-

The both of you wait for a long while, until finally the group arrives into the nearby forest. “So, what is the Pokemon that you want/. Like what type?”

“Just a kind one.” She chuckled. She moved her way forward. “We can split up if you want?” Rosa said. “With your Pokemon you should be fine.”

What do you wanna do?
15213143112322.title: Snivy And Charmander, Your Guardians

choices: Rosa still wanted to get to Floccesy Town
Rosa and you decided to sleep in the forest
1521314312.content:
"Well, uh... a little practice will only do us good, I guess," you uncertainly said, looking down at Snivy,
"What do you say?"

"Sni." she replied with a shrug, seemingly fine with the idea.

Rosa pumped her fist in the air.

"That's the spirit!" she exclaimed excitedly, doing a little hop, before gesturing to her Tepig,
"And Tepig will help you out!"

Tepig's eyes shot open as he eyed his trainer with disbelief.

"E-Eh?" he exclaimed,
"Why do I have to play the training dummy!?"

"He doesn't seem very enthusiastic..." you pointed out.

In response, Rosa shot her Pokemon a disappointed look.

"C'mon Tepig, don't you want to help out our friends?" she asked; then, when her Pokemon turned his head, Rosa shrugged,
"Ah, well," she said, turning to you, winking,
"I guess he's scared he'll lose this one. Well, on to Floccesy Town!"

"W-Wait, what do you mean 'scared'!?" Tepig shouted, indignant.

"She means what she means," Snivy stepped in, deadpan,
"You're scared."

A cloud of smoke came out of Tepig's nose as he cried his name in determination (and annoyance).

Rosa giggled.

"Hehe, look who's up for the challenge," she said cheerfully, while you wondered what could have made Tepig change his mind so quickly.

Must have been something Snivy told him that made him so angry all of a sudden...

"Well, I guess we're up too, then," you said, though a bit worried.

"Perfect!" Rosa replied,
"You'll just battle Tepig like with a wild Pokemon while I watch. That way, Tepig can practice as well!"

"Fine by me." the fire-type swine said, eyes on Snivy, more smoke coming out of his nose,
"Bring it on!"

Snivy simply turned her back to her once-again opponent and began walking away; once she put some distance between herself and Rosa's Pokemon, she picked you from her head and let you down once more, before once more adopting that concerned look.

"Sni..." she said softly, hating having to split for you, even if for a battle; who knew what could happen to her very fragile trainer if he was left unguarded for too long!

Seeing her worried about you made you smile.

"Heh, don't worry, girl," you said, patting her scaly underbelly with a hand,
"I'll be fine."

Snivy lingered for a moment. Too much time for a certain Pokemon, who kindly reminded her of the battle,

"Hey! You comin' or not?"

Snivy sighed, then nodded her head as her face returned stoic, before she turned to face Tepig once more.

"Let's get this over with..."

"Okay Tepig... just do whatever you want!" Rosa said, remembering on the last second that she wasn't supposed to give orders.

She didn't have to repeat herself, because Tepig immediately shot a wave of hot wind towards Snivy.

"Dodge it!" you yelled; Snivy swiftly jumped to the side,
"Use Leer!"

Snivy sent a glare in her opponent's direction; Tepig stopped in his tracks.

"H-Hey, come on! Stop staring at me like that?" he protested.

"Like what?"

"Use Tackle!"

Hearing your shout, Snivy sprinted forward, so fast that it was actually hard to see her; when Tepig did, it was too late: your Snivy hit him, sending him flying back.

"Oh... that looked like it hurt..." Rosa commented, before sending you a thumbs-up,
"Great job!"

"Ow... lucky shot." Tepig whined upon getting back on all fours, glaring at Snivy,
"Now, let me show you what a real Tackle is like!"

That said, it was the swine's turn to sprint towards Snivy at full speed, too fast to dodge.

You, however, had an idea.

"Snivy, use Vine Whip and jump out of the way!" you ordered; Snivy looked at you for a split second, then did as instructed, and was surprised to discover it actually worked: Tepig kept going without having hit her, who was already in the air; you didn't hesitate.

"Now, latch onto Tepig and use Tackle!"

Snivy sent her vines to wrap around the belly of her opponent and used them to drag herself down, tackling the fire-type to the ground before hastily unwrapping him and jumping back, leaving a dizzy Tepig on the ground.

"Ugh..."

"Ouch... snap out of it, Tepig!" Rosa shouted, before blushing and covering her mouth with a hand; then, giggling, she added,
"Sorry, sorry..."

You ignored her and, with Tepig still on the ground, you saw your chance.

"That's it, Snivy, use Tackle again!" you yelled; Snivy, once again, sprinted towards Tepig and hit him as hard as she could, knocking him back.

While it was a hard blow, it still wasn't enough.

Tepig got back on his legs and, frustrated, shot an Ember in Snivy's direction.

"Dodge!" you shouted; Snivy did, but Tepig was still shooting fire towards her, who struggled to dodge.

Eventually, one if the attacks hit her, causing Snivy to wince; by the time she recovered, Rosa's Tepig was already performing Tackle again.

"Uh..." you said, before an idea came to your mind,
"Snivy, use Vine Whip and trip him!"

A vine hit Tepig's legs, causing him to trip and tumble several times.

"Let's end this," you murmured, before yelling,
"Use Vine Whip again, Snivy!"

"Snivy." your Pokemon replied as she began whipping Tepig over and over.

"Ow, ow, ow! Stop, stop!" he cried,
"I give up! I give up!"

The barrage finally ended; Tepig wasted no time and, after shakily getting up, he ran towards Rosa, crying his own name over and over.

Ross looked at you with a smile.

"Ehm... Tepig is unable to battle... well, sort of," she said,
"This victory goes to Snivy!"

"Alright!" you praised while the green giantess walked back to you,
"Great job, girl!"

The grass-type allowed herself to smile softly while she picked you up to place you on her head.

"Snivy."

--

After healing her Pokemon, Rosa turned to you with a smile.

"Well, that was incredible! You're both fast learners! And it looks like you have an incredibly strong bond already!" she praised.

"Heh..." you chuckled awkwardly,
"Though it's gotten pretty late..."

Rosa lost her smile and looked up; the sun was long gone.

"Aw man! I didn't even notice!" the giantess whined,
"Te, tepig!"

"So, what do we do now?" you asked.

"Um..."
1521314312.title: Practice makes perfect

choices: You eventually drifted off as well
Rosa suddenly picked you up, wanting to spend some time with you
You fell asleep, but were woken up much later by... Snivy and Tepig?
15213143122.content:
Rosa let out a sigh, before giggling.

"Well, I suppose we'll just have to camp here for the night," she said, before pouting,
"Too bad, though."

"It's not a bad idea." you replied, watching Rosa place her bag down, opening it to dig inside, letting out a,
"Hm-mh"

Finally, the giantess emerged from within her bag with a large tent.

"I don't suppose you have a tent of your own," she addressed you, letting a smirk crawl across her face,
"Meaning we're going to share..."

Immediately, you blushed.

"A-Ack, Rosa-!"

"Don't be shy now. I'm fairly sure you don't wanna sleep out here, and you don't take up much room anyway," she said, starting to unroll her tent,
"So lemme just pitch this. It'll take only a moment, promise~." she sang cheerfully, vaguely thrilled by the idea of sharing a tent.

You, on the other hand, were embarrassed by it, and Snivy was completely indifferent... as long as Rosa kept her hands off of you, anyway.

--

"Aaand, done!" Rosa said once she was finished with the tent, before turning to you, opening it with a hand, gesturing for Snivy to enter with the other.

The grass-type however seemed reluctant and stood in place.

Rosa pouted.

"Ah, c'mon..." she said, followed by Tepig,
"Teee..."
