"Do as she says, Snivy," you whispered, patting on the head of the Pokemon, who obediently began walking towards the tent, followed by Rosa and her own Pokemon as she entered.

Once inside, Rosa began stretching, kicking off her shoes in the meantime, remaining in her pink socks.

"Ahh! What a day!" she exclaimed.

"Tell me about it." you muttered, your mind instinctively going back to Mew,
"Hey, Rosa?"

"Hm?"

"D'you think... we'll find Mew, eventually? I mean, it probably makes little difference to you, b-"

"What do you mean, dude?" Rosa interrupted, looking offended,
"I want to help you! As for Mew, she can't hide forever, right?"

You thought for a moment.

"I'm actually fairly sure she can," you said dejectedly,
"How do you explain she remained uncaught so far?"

Rosa's expression fell as well as she realized she had no reply for that.

"Um... ehh... w-well, you should look on the bright side!"

"And what would that be?"

The moment those words left your mouth, Snivy let out an indignant cry and poked you twice in the side to remind you that she was still there.

"Ah, yes... sorry, Snivy, hehe..." you apologized while your Pokemon crossed her arms,
"Sni."

"And then there's me, of course!" Rosa continued, earning a glare from Snivy that caused the giantess to rise her hands,
"Hey, don't give me that look, I wanna help, too!"

Snivy just grumbled her own name in response.

"... What I mean is, this could be much worse, y'know," Rosa addressed you again, crossing her legs and placing her hands on her knees,
"You could be alone, for example. Think of what would have happened if Snivy hadn't found you."

You did as told: if Snivy never popped out of that Pokeball, Bianca would probably have never found you, and you would be stuck on your own, to fend for yourself against pretty much anything; now, you had a partner, a companion who was willing to keep an eye on the two of you, and Professor Juniper who was conveniently working to find a way to restore your size.

"... You do have a point." you conceded, looking back at Rosa, who smiled.

"I knew you'd see it my way." she said, before drawing her bag closer to her,
"Now, who's hungry? I didn't pack much food, as I thought we'd be in Town by now, but hey, at that size, pretty much anything can be a whole meal to you."

At the mention of food, the apparently hungry Tepig skipped towards his trainer and waited for her to pull out dinner, tail wagging in anticipation as he cried his name over and over, asking for his belly to be filled; Snivy rolled her eyes.

You chuckled to yourself.

"Then I guess we can put that into the 'being tiny pros list'." you replied.

Rosa too giggled.

--

Dinner was fairly quiet.

While eating, you had a chance to look around, discovering that what Rosa had said before was true: the only thing occupying most of the space was Rosa herself; you and the two relatively small Pokemon didn't take much room, either, so that left enough space for the four of you to sleep comfortably in one place, though the thought was still somewhat embarrassing.

After dinner, Snivy let out a yawn.

"You tired, girl?" you asked, figuring that after the two battles she had with Tepig, she must have been exhausted.

"Sni." she answered, before looking in Rosa's direction warily; then, without warning, Snivy gripped you and removed you from her head, placing you onto the floor before coiling her entire body around you,
"Sni-vy." she spoke to Rosa, warning her of consequences if the trainer happened to even try to touch you.

You sighed.

"Sorry..." you said to Rosa, looking around: green walls surrounded you, making it impossible to escape unless you climbed Snivy.

Rosa laughed.

"Don't worry." she said,
"Your Snivy seems to like you a lot."

"Too much." you replied, before pointing out,
"Tepig too seems to think highly of you."

At the mention, Tepig jumped onto his trainer's lap with a happy cry of his name, the got comfortable and laid down much like a Lillipup would.

"D'aw..." Rosa cooed, beginning to pet the fire-type, who closed his eyes in relaxation.

A while later, both he and your Snivy fell asleep, one on Rosa's lap and the other coiled around you, acting as a fence.

A bit unsure what to do, you decided to catch some sleep well and sat with your back against Snivy's body, by her scaly stomach, judging from the sounds that came from within.

"Well... 'night, then." you said to Rosa, closing your eyes.

The giantess just smiled, finding the scene adorable.
15213143122.title: Camping with Rosa

choices: You're the first to been woke up...
You found yourself in the arms of your giant Snivy
You found youself resting against Rosa's chest while she's holding you!
152131431221.content:
While you felt in sleep, resting against your giant Snivy's body, by her scaly stomach. Rosa watches the scene, she can't help but find it adorable as she takes her pokenav and take a picture of you sleeping in the center of the coil of your Snivy.

A few moments later... After Rosa finished to change herself in pijama (good thing you deeply sleep), she takes one more time to look at you. Rosa really urge to holding you and cuddling your tiny form against her, but Snivy won't let her touch you due of her over protective for her trainer. She sighes, wondering if Snivy will eventually trusting her and allowing her to hold you for once. Unless if you tell at your Snivy to hand you to her...

Then Rosa lay on her sleeping bag before she close her eyes, something got her attention on the floor, the poke ball of Snivy drag on the floor next to your pokemon. Rosa picks it up without waking you or Snivy, first she looks at the poke ball she holds then at your sleeping Snivy, then at you and then back at poke ball. Suddenly a light bulb on appeared above Rosa's head as she makes a smirk while her cheeks blushing as she just got a idea in her mind. With the poke ball she holds, she could put your Snivy back into her poke ball. So she could finally spending time and having fun with you alone.

But for now, she decides to doing her plan tomorrow, because it late and she's tired, so she went to sleep as well...

Rosa can't wait for tomorrow to get her chance to having fun with you as she can't help but imagined herself with her tiny friend sitting on her shoulder and even taking a selfie with you on her shoulder as well...

The next morning...

A: You wake up still on the floor in middle of your giant partner pokemon Snivy coiled around of you. You are the first person to be woke up.

B: You wake up and found youserf resting in the arms of your giant Snivy who walk around the tent in the outside. Snivy was the first to be woke up and decides to take some freshing air and of course she keeps you under your protection.

C: You wake up and found youself resting against a giant comfortable pillow but you sooner found that's not a pillow. You're been holding by your giantess friend Rosa against her chest and Snivy and Tepig are nowhere to be found in the tent as you realize that Rosa has put both of the pokemon back into their poke ball! Now it's just you and Rosa alone...
152131431221.title: Good night

choices: Snivy has run away with you! It seems that meeting was the last straw.
You're still in Snivy's grasp in the morning, Snivy still asleep.
A Pokemon has snuck into the tent and woken up Snivy.
Mew appears and gives you a hint to her location, and its in Unova!
Something Else?
152131431222.content:
You stayed lying on Snivy's scaly stomach for a good half hour trying to sleep, but couldn't. The events of the day were flying through your mind over and over, keeping you from reaching dreamland. Meeting the mythical pokemon Mew, then Mew shrinking you for its idea of a game. Meeting your new partner and going on an adventure.

Speaking of Snivy, she may be protective of you, but that's only a good thing in this situation, where nearly everything is a risk to your life, you only wished she wouldn't be so against Rosa as well. As you were thinking this, you felt two pillars of flesh surround you, and instinctively started struggling. After a second or so, you realized why you shouldn't really be struggling because the only person in the tent with you was Rosa.

You let yourself calm down and the fingers eventually deposit you on an open hand. Rosa then calls you with her X-Transceiver to overcome the sound barrier between the two of you. You pick up and say, "Hey Rosa, what's up?"

Rosa responded. "Nothing much, just wanted to talk without Snivy constantly glaring at me."

"Sorry about that, by the way. Snivy means well."

"No, it's no problem. It's pretty much a good thing you have such a protective partner to watch over you at your size. I've heard stories about starter pokemon being really disobedient to trainers, and at your size, a bad starter could've resulted in you being eaten before Bianca ever found you."

You sighed. "Yeah, I'm really grateful Snivy is how she is. I just wish she could tone it down around you."

Rosa laughed unintentionally, so she couldn't keep the volume down. Snivy and Tepig immediately woke up, which lead to Snivy realizing you were missing. Snivy looked around frantically, before spotting you on Rosa's hand. Her vines shot out at you at light speed and grabbed you from your perch and pulled you back into the scaly body of Snivy.

"He's mine! He's my trainer! Leave him alone!"

All you and Rosa heard, however, was, "Snivy Sni! Snivy Snivy Vy! Snivy!"

Snivy resumed the same position as before, but this time made sure to keep her arms around you and her vines covering the gap above you. It seems Snivy is really pulling out all the stops for this one, and not even Rosa could sneak you out of there undetected. Thankfully, your X-Transceiver was still in your hands, so you hear Rosa say, "Good Night", before hearing the call cut out.

After that talk with Rosa, your mind is cleared a lot more, so you're able to sleep soundly almost instantly. When you wake up...
152131431222.title: Midnight talk.

choices: Rosa believed your dream to be actually a message from Mew
Rosa was a bit skeptical and thought yours was only a dream
1521314312224.content:
Your eyes opened after you experienced a dream you couldn't recall at the moment.

The instant you woke up, you realized that you were no longer where you fell asleep, with your faithful grass-type coiled around you as a protection, but you were... floating in some kind of dark space.

Wondering where you were and how you got here, you began looking around, but the scenario was the same everywhere you looked.

"H-Hello?" you called out, hoping to grab someone's attention. Who knew, perhaps Snivy had rolled over in her sleep, trapping you under her? It didn't feel like it. Quite the contrary in fact, your body felt completely weightless, almost like it was submerged in water,
"Is anyone here?"

No reply.

You did hear a noise though, and it sounded like... giggling? It was very muffled, so you weren't very sure about that, but it did sound pretty much like someone was trying to stifle a laugh.

"H-Hello?" you repeated.

You still got no reply, but suddenly you felt something touching you from behind; turning around, you saw nothing and no one.

You began feeling very nervous. Just where on Earth were you?

While you were trying to figure that out, something gripped your arms, forcing them up.

"H-Hey!" you shouted, trying to break free from the invisible grip. But no matter how hard you tried, you couldn't free yourself, and whoever or whatever was holding you soon grew bored with just keeping you still, because you then started trashing around, moving much like a doll in the hands of an hyperactive kid.

"Hey, quit that!" you cried once more, and whoever held you in such precarious position seemed to listen, because, with a giggle, you were let go of.

"Ack... who's there!?" you cried, trying to sound as intimidating as you could; the results were probably hilarious to anyone listening.

Another giggle made your ears ring, before your mysterious 'companion' finally decided to reveal themselves.

All of a sudden in fact, the familiar figure of a Pokemon appeared; it was...

"M-M..."

"Mew!" the pink cat-like legendary, the very one that got you in this mess, cried in a carefree manner, playfully waving a paw in your direction.

You were startled by the sudden appearance. Then, you remembered the situation you were in.

"H-Hey, you!" you cried, realizing this was your opportunity to get your size back.

The legendary pointed her sapphire eyes on you.

"Mew?"

"Aw, cut the 'mew mew' crap, I know you can talk to me!"

The pink Pokemon sighed.

"Alright, alright, fine." she said, perfectly understandable now. She did pout a bit though,
"Jeez, there's no need to be so rude."

You growled in response.

Unimpressed, Mew grinned.

"So, I'm confident that you're enjoying your first day as a tiny," she spoke, spinning in mid-air and striking a pose,
"I know I'm enjoying our, heh, 'little' game so far. I just can't wait 'till you find me!"

Your frustration waned as perplexity replaced it.

"W... What does that mean? You're here in front of me, I found you! So change me back!" you protested.

Mew waved a stubby finger.

"Nope. You haven't found me yet; I came to you... well, not really. You'll understand later." she replied, before grinning once more,
"And besides, what kind of game would it be if it lasted so little? Nope! I wanna enjoy it!"

"... I don't get how can you think this is a game." you dryly said.

Mew shrugged.

"Say whatever you like," she said, her tail starting to cool around you, forcing your legs together; the same tail drew you closer to Mew and rose you to her face,
"But if you want to win the game, you know what to do, right?"

You didn't reply.

"You've also made some friends, haven't you?" Mew continued, smirking.

"Have you been spying on me?"

"I've been keeping an eye on you, so to say. I've actually kept track of you, just to make sure you didn't end up in someone's stomach. But then, I sensed a friendly presence around you, so it's all good!... I mean, I assume, since you're still alive."

"No thanks to you!" you retorted, causing the legendary to roll her eyes.

"Whatever."

Mew's tail began unwrapping from around your legs.

"Well, see you soon... or maybe not." she said, turning to seemingly leave.

You panicked.

"Wait! If you're not here, then... where the heck are you!? How can you be here if you aren't!?"

Mew turned her head, wearing a pensive expression.

"... I can't answer to either of those questions," she replied, before smiling,
"Buuut, I can give you a hint! I haven't left the region. I'm hiding in some forest..."

Her words told you pretty much nothing.

"But Unova's full of 'em!"

"Exactly! That gotta make the game more interesting, don't you think? Anyway, I'll give you more hints in the future, but I miiight get bored and leave if you're too slow, y'know..." Mew said.

Your eyes shot open. You didn't want to chase a Mew around for who knew how long!

You were about to point that out, but the legendary anticipated you.

"Bye!"

"W-Wait, Mew!" you yelled, but in vain: Mew suddenly vanished from sight.

The next moment, your eyes shot open, and you found yourself back within the protective arms of your Snivy.

After breathing in and out heavily for a minute, you sighed.

Yours was only a dream... or was it?

--

"It's a bit strange, don't you think?" Rosa asked much later, when you had already told her your 'dream'.

Currently, the giantess was busily brushing her hair, while you were sitting atop Snivy's head as usual, Tepig sitting next to the grass-type while awaiting for his trainer.

"True." you replied; due the closeness with the brown-haired girl, you didn't need your X-Transceiver to communicate.
"But I don't think that was a dream. I think that really was Mew, giving me some advice. She even gave me a hint, though it's pretty... vague."

"Let's hear it." Rosa spoke, intrigued.

"She hasn't left Unova, but she mentioned she's in some forest." you said, before looking down, discovering both Snivy and Tepig staring up at you, looking skeptical.

"But Unova's full of 'em!"

"That's what I said. Mew also said she might leave if I'm not fast enough..." you said dejectedly, before looking back to the giantess,
"What do you think, Rosa?"

The giantess stopped brushing her hair for a moment.

"Hmm..."
1521314312224.title: Helpful dream?

choices: Just Bianca herself
Nate, along with his partner Snivy who help Bianca to find the poke ball
Rosa, along with her partner Snivy who help Bianca to find the poke ball
1523.content:
"Osha!... wott?..." the pokemon says as you recognized it know as Oshawott. The blue sea otter is making some kind of greeting pose, but he saw no one around of his presence.

Oshawott looks around tried to find his trainer, turned his head left and right, then look behind and only found his poke ball where he just pop out from it on the floor. Looking back forward, unaware there a tiny human in front him, Oshawott is getting confused as he scratches his head while thinking.

He remembers that he, along with the two other starters, are going to be delivered the new trainers. That's what he has heard from professor Juniper. If he's out of his poke ball the that mean he has be picked and letting him out, but where is his trainer?

As for you, you just sat there with eyes open wide and not making motion. In front you there a gigantic Oshawott who towering you as he's standing there and he seems to look for something.

You still can't believed how small you are compared to the blue otter, even his own scalchop is bigger than you! As you slowly get up on your feets, you begin to wonder if you should try to get his attention, maybe he can help you, but you're not really sure about that.

Well... at least, you know that Oshawott is not a wild pokemon due he just pop out from that poke ball, but still it's a pokemon and you don't know it will help you or not. Speaking about the poke ball, you wonder where that poke ball comes from or who belong to?

Regardless, you decide to take the risk, taking a deep breath, you begin to call the giant pokemon in front you.

"H-hey! Down here!" you yell as the giant Oshawott turns his attention.

"Osha?" Oshawott looks down and notices a tiny person on the ground in front him waving it arms at him.

First, Oshawott paused at for a moment as he staring at you at his full height. As for you, you stop waving at him, now you got his attention, there no turning back. You get really nervous after that, you always find Oshawotts cute, but now at your new size, see one as a giant, it's very intimidate.

After few seconds, Oshawott finally reacts as he reaches down to picks you up with his both hands (Or paws I must say.) and went back to his full height. As Oshawott holds you, he moves you to his eyes level and begin to study you.

While you being held by the both paws on your both sides, you begin to regret for try getting help from a pokemon. Because may never know what he's going to do with you as you just frozen in fear.

As for Oshawott, he's really surprised by what he just see, a incredible small human before his eyes. He never expected that humans could be so small. Then that make him a realization, if this human was standing in front him, does it means... Of course! That make sense, you must be one who call him from his poke ball. Which that mean you are his trainer of course!

However, Oshawott notices that you shivery in fear as he realized you look scared. Not sure why, but he tries to comfort you as he pats you with one of his paws with a smile on his face.

Not sure if Oshawott is friendly or not. You sigh in relief when you realize he doesn't want to harm you. So you still unsure if he will listened to you, but you give a try.

"L-look Oshawott... I know it weird but I meet a some psychic pokemon and it shrinks me down to this size and I need help, would you help me?"

Oshawott was surprised to heard it. Guess that explained why you are so small. Then again, you're his trainer so it his duty to help you as he nods at you.

"You will?" you ask.

"Oshawott." he nods again.

You smile and say "Thank you, Oshawott! You're so nice." that make him blushes, but then you realize something. Why Oshawott would help a stranger like you? You just met him. So went to ask but you get interrupted by someone calls.

"Oshawott!" a voice calls from behind Oshawott.

"Osha?" Oshawott turns behind with you in his hands as you see a person approached.

"(That must be his trainer...)" that what you think and the person is...
1523.title: Big sea otter boy, Oshawott!

choices: You go towards the hot springs
You wait until she got out
You go inside her bag
153.content:
Suddenly, Mew floated back to where you are standing. You breath a sigh of relief and expected to be back to normal again. However, it wasn't what you were expecting as your surroundings are quickly changing. Once that's over, you soon found yourself in a brand-new location.

Instead of a grassy field, you are standing on a rocky mountain path that is incredibly hot; you are even sweating right now. You soon realized that Mew must've teleported you here, but why? From the looks of it, this appears to be on a large mountain with a steam air around it.

"Mew, why did you bring me here?" You asked.

"In order to experience an amazing moment of your life."

With that, she teleported away.

You are confused at what she meant by that as you highly doubt you will even experience anything good in the middle of a large volcano. With nothing left to do, you decided to go down and try to find some way to get back to normal.

As you travelled down, you began to notice something familiar about this place. While you never visited here before, you did read a book about a large volcano a long time ago. This volcano is known as Mt Chimney and is very tall; about 5000 feet tall to be exact! Kinda think of it, you did see the vast landscape of Hoenn at last. You immediately discovered that this IS Mt Chimney and because of it's great size, you can see nearly everything around the region. Honestly if you were at your original size, you would love to sit here and just take a look at sights from the mountain; you can even see your hometown of Petalburg City from up here. Is this what Mew wanted you to experience? You guess that must be the case, but it didn't really make any sense on why she shrank you for it.

After sightseeing for a while, you go back to your journey downwards. You couldn't stand here any longer due to the heat and going lower will make everything less hot for you to survive. You travel across the rocky terrain that makes up the mountainous route and realized that the more you travel down, the less warmer it gets. However, you suddenly felt something hot nearby and it almost feels like warm liquid coming from below. You slowly walk to the cliff and look down. You see a small lake that looks like a hot spring, but there's something there that really surprised you.

Resting on the hot springs is a girl but it's not just any girl, it's someone you think you recognized. She has long red hair that is tied in a ponytail, making it look spiky. The only thing she's wearing is a black bikini. Yep, this is none other than Flannery, the fire gym leader of Lavaridge Town. The reason you know her is because you once saw a battle between her and a trainer on TV once and ever since you saw her, you thought she was very hot like the fire Pokemon she uses, but in a good way. You also really wanted to see and get closer to her.

Wait a minute...

You finally realized what Mew meant by getting an amazing moment. The reason she shrank you and got you here was so you could get close to Flannery in secret. You could just take advantage of this new size and go see her up close without her even knowing your existence.

You look at her and was about to go down until you see a beach towel right next to the springs. It looks like she might be going to there to dry herself and relax under the sun. You thought of waiting for her to do so and go exploring across her body. Next to the towel, you can see a bag that may belong to her and began to think about going inside to explore around her clothes.

What do you do?
153.title: Way Too Hot

choices: It was Liza, meditating
It was Tate, Reading a book
It was both, and they were talking to each other
154.content:
How could you let this happen! You feel like a bit of an idiot, knowing how you didn’t take this as serious as you really should. Mew was a legendary, not only that but one of the most powerful ones. You know you thought it was just a cute playful Pokemon, but in retrospect that was stupid.

Now you paid the price, you were what... two inches tall at the moment. Maybe even less than that.

Looking over the ocean in front of you, you try to think about what you can do. The Mew flew that way, so no way you were gonna cross it. Although you do have a water Pokemon.

You were a Pokemon Trainer, with Pokemon. Here in the Hoenn Region, you started your journey a while ago. Now with six badges and ready for your seventh.

Hence is why you were at Mossdeep City. Ready to challenge the psychic twins Tate and Liza.

Your Pokemon, were even brought around to counter them. You only had two on you, as the rest were in your PC. A female Banette as well as a Male Crawdaunt. Both use to punish their types when you challenge them.

Well, that is pretty much not the plan at the moment. Then again, that was not the worst thing in the world.

Those two, they were psychics right? Maybe they can use their powers to help you! Granted, that was quite a leap but it was better than the alternative. Your Crawdaunt is not a fast Pokemon, at all. So chasing Mew was not an option.

Your Banette was fast, and could levitate. Let’s just say though... you would much rather be a bigger size than deal with that mischievous Pokemon.

So... the twins seem to be your best option. Looking back into the city from the shore, you swallow and you then move in.

-

It took, a real long while for you to actually get to the gym. You were so small, and everyone risked stepping on you. So it was understandable why you were having trouble.

That didn’t matter though, as you were by yourself right now at the front of the gym.

How do you get in there? The doors were giant and much too big for you to actually make your way in.

You try to figure out a way, even pushing your way into the door. You were far too weak though, so that was not an option.

“Well... better then nothing.” You say as you reach for your Pokeball. “Crawdaunt, come on out!”

Luckily, your Pokeball shrunk with you, but not the Pokemon. You crab was giant! Towering over you like a monster.

“Craw?” it said, looking it’s way around. Needless to say, it was expecting a battle, not to be outside.

“Hey, Crawdaunt down here!” You shout up to him for a long while. He listened, and looked down. His giant face close to you, as he was shocked about it.

“Craw!!!” He said as he brought his claw down. Your eyes wide open as you jump back.

“Woah! Don’t pick me up!” You say to your giant Pokemon as thankfully he listened. “Great, look I need you to open this door. Please.”

Your Pokemon, like most (Not Banette) is loyal, so he listens. Waddling his way over and... breaking the door with one Crab Hammer.

“O-Okay, I guess that works. Um... come back before you get found and blamed.” You say to the Pokemon as you return him. Although you were weak and powerless, at least you have your two strong Pokemon. Granted you were pretty sure you weren’t going to bring out Banette.

Every since you got her as a Shuppet across on the mainland, she has been trouble. Pranks, Scares and Mischief was her game. When she evolved into Banette, she even found a way to get into more mischief. A variant of Curse was her favourite.

Pretty much, she links your body’s feeling to hers, as she then starts to either hurt herself, to hurt you, or tickle herself to tickle you.

Somehow, she turned the ticklish option into the worse of the two.

Regardless, as you move over towards the door, that was now opened. You walk among the shattered glass, getting in as you look around. Now where were you going to go? You have never been to this place before, so you might as well guess.

You see a hallway not so far away, so you logically take it. Taking long steps as you move forward and in.

The hallway was big, but empty which left you confused. Guess there was not much people in this Gym. You have no idea why, but since it lowered your chance of actually getting stepped on, you were not going to question it.

So you just kept moving as you arrived at something that interested you. A giant door to the side, with the title.

‘Twins Room’

Yep, this was where you were going to find them. You could hear shifting inside, so at least one of them had to be in. How are you going to get in their this time.

Well Crawdaunt can break his way in and... oh no, wait. The door was slightly open.

Well that made things much simpler, so you simply move your way. Getting right between the door and the wall as you step in.

These two shared the same room, and apparently it wasn’t split into two. In fact it seemed to be shared, as their beds were right next to each other in the middle of the room. A large desk on one side, a closet as well as drawers on the other side. The room didn’t look like it was catered to a boy or a girl, or either. It just seemed like an average room.

However, the room wasn’t the thing you were interested in. Instead it was the giant twins that you were looking for.

You looked and saw that ______________
154.title: You Are Mossdeep In Trouble

choices: Yes, she lets you go
No, cause she wants you to stay with her
No, she forces you to stay with her!
No, she wants a gym battle (Pokemon)
No, she wants a gym battle (You vs Liza!)
1541.content:
You looked and saw it was one of the two twin gym leaders! The girl one, Liza you think her name is. You could not be happier about how this turned out, you need to go and get her attention right now!

She was meditating on the ground right now, her legs crossed her and her feet bare. You need to get her attention simple as that. You don’t know much about psychics, but you know they have powers. Powers that might be able to help you.

After all it was a psychic Pokemon that shrunk you, maybe a psychic person can help you.

You get real closed to the giant sitting girl, looking how intimidating she was. Not only that, but a bit pretty. For her age at least.

She seemed to be deep in thought, so you were wondering how you were going to get her attention. You don’t want to shock her, you want her to remain calm and not to jump to conclusions.

Looking around for a bit, you found how you are gonna get this giant girls attention. You move around, getting real close to her foot as you feel it for a couple of seconds.

Then you push, rubbing it as you try to make sure she feels it. You push as hard as you can, really putting your back into it. All in front of you was her giant clean sole, which could probably easily step on you. So it was a good thing you were getting her attention now, rather than later.

For Liza, she was awaken out of her meditation, feeling something against her foot. While she was focusing er power, she still noticed it. Which was good, as she looked down at her sole, seeing you! Not seeing you as a doll, or a small Pokemon, but as a human.

Her eyebrows lifted looking at you, a little bit shocked about it but not enough to actually throw her off. How did this happen? Why is a small boy rubbing her feet? You looked older than her, and if she looks hard she can see two small Pokeball’s on your belt. Pausing for a couple of seconds she looks at you as she speaks.

“Uh... can I help you?” You jump and jerk at her sudden talks, almost tripping back. Something she found adorable, and was the reason why Liza wore a smile on her face as you look up at her.

“Oh good, you found me. Wasn’t as hard as I thought.” You say with a smile, as this could not be better. You move around as she still had her legs crossed, going before her as you tidy yourself up. You look up to her towering form as you begin to talk.

“Right, hi... Liza! Big fan first off. I’m a Pokemon trainer, who is actually here to challenge you and your brother funnily enough.” You say to her as she listened. Still it was intimidating in front of her. “Anyway...”

“Hehehe, go on.” She said giving you motivation to keep on talking.

“Well, I was planning on facing you and your brother, and then I went to sleep. Then a Mew showed up!”

“A Mew?” She questioned, surprised at that bit. “Is that why you are small?”

“Yeah, I played around with the Mew... and it shrunk me. My own fault really. So, the Mew wanted me to chase it, but considering that... I can’t this size. I came to you!”

And now she has pieced it together. That’s why you were here, because you thought that Liza with her psychic powers could help. Sadly, she could not. Moving her hand to her back she looked sheepishly at you.

“Sorry, I know why you are here then and i’ve never have grown something with my powers, not even affect something’s size. Sorry.”

“Great.” You say in a deadpanned expression. “Guess I should of expected it. It was a long shot.”

“What is your name by the way?” She questioned down to you as you realise you haven’t told her yet. You reply and she smiles. Moving her giant body around. She wasn’t aware of the effect this was going to have on you. Moving her giant body and laying down on her stomach, bringing her face closer to you as she rests her two knuckles under her chin. Her feet kicking around as she smiles at you. “Nice name, so... if I were going to guess, Mew would be the only way you could grow big. I doubt any other psychic Pokemon could overpower Mew’s.” She said logically. “Although if you find a Pokemon that knows Growth, and they somehow use it on you. You could have Mew’s shrink on you, but you could use the growth as well to counter it!”

Your eyes went wide. “L-Liza you are a genius!” You say happy. That could be a good strategy you could use.

“Although that is also farfetched. Growth is an internal move, and it doesn’t use the way it’s described. It can’t just magically Dynamax. So I guess Mew is still your bet.” She said looking over. Only now realising she just kind of stepped on your dreams. “Oh uh... sorry. Think about it like this way, there is a lot more fun things to do with your size than normal! You could eat food so much bigger than you, a bottle of water would last you a day. Um... you can have a giant king’s size bed regardless of what you are actually on. You never have to wait in lines, you could move through under the feet. Am I helping?” The caring girl questioned.

“Just a little. Well, thanks for hearing me out Liza. Guess, I got to go find Mew.”

“By yourself?” She questioned as you turned around.

“Don’t worry. I got strong Pokemon, they were probably going to beat you and your brother if i’m being honest. Anyway, goodbye Liza!” You say waving. Is this the end?
1541.title: Liza Meditating

choices: You accepted the offer
You declined
Suddenly, the door opened and Tate came in
15412.content:
"Wait!"

You halted in your own tracks and turned around upon hearing the young gym leader yelling.

Once she was back in your line of sight, you noted her hastily moving herself to rise to her feet before getting up, rising to her full height, which was quite impressive for a kid her age.

"Hm, yeah?" you asked while she walked closer to you, stopping when you were standing mere inches from her bare toes; you had to look up for several seconds in order to be able to look at her face.
"What is it, Liza?"

In response, Liza looked elsewhere; you noted a blush suddenly appearing on her cheeks as she began fidgeting her fingers nervously.

"He-"

"I can't let you leave!" she suddenly blurted out, before realizing what she had said, clearing her throat and resuming in a less nervous tone,
"I mean, you shouldn't leave."

"What? Why?"

Liza placed her hands behind her back and adopted a solemn expression that you best described as adorable.

"Because, trainer, it would be very dangerous for someone your size to challenge the world by yourself." Liza explained,
"I think it would be very unwise of you to do so."

She did have a point, you guessed, but that didn't change the fact that you needed to find Mew.

"Oh." you said, before offering a smile,
"I appreciate that but, y'know, I'm not on my own. I have my Pokemon with me. They're to thank if I even got in here... though now I guess it was a bit pointless."

Liza pouted.

"Don't say that!" she chided, before realizing she had shouted and placing a hand over her mouth, blushing; then, timidly, she resumed,
"Excuse me... but I still think you won't be completely safe. Even if you did find Mew, I doubt you could defeat it in battle since it's one of the mightiest legendaries... and it's also sooo cute!"

As Liza adopted dreamy eyes while thinking of Mew, you pondered her words and discovered that they made perfect sense: your Pokemon may have been strong enough to take on Liza and Tate and maybe win, but were they strong enough to take on a legendary?

Although...

"She didn't mention that." you pointed out,
"She told me to go find her, not fight her."

Liza finally stopped daydreaming about finding a Mew herself and finally turned back to you.

"Oh, it's a gir... wait. Hehehe, sorry," the young giantess giggled, realizing she had lost the main track of her thoughts; she focused back on you and once more adopted a serious expression,
"Maybe it's like you say, trainer, but there's still no telling if Mew is going to give you back your size even if you manage to find her." Liza pointed out.

You looked at her for a few seconds, wondering just what she was trying to say.

Then, with a shrug, you said,

"Perhaps. But what other choice do I have?"

Liza looked away.

"Oh, you know, you could always..." she mumbled the last part so lowly that not even you could hear her, not that there was anybody else to listen.

"Um... what was that?"

Liza's face flushed bright red once more.

"I said..." she said, closing her eyes,
"That maybe you could stay... with me."

Silence fell between you and the giantess; you kept your gaze glued to her while she once again looked away, blushing.

Eventually, you broke the silence.

"... Why?" you asked,
"Why would you want me to stay you?"

In response, Liza finally turned to you.

"Well, you know, I wish to, um, assist you," she kindly replied, bending to place her hand palm-up in front of you; getting the hint, you climbed on as she rose up, lifting her palm as well.
"You know, I can't help you with your size, at least for now, but I can take care of you!"

Liza was sure she had concealed it well, but she was actually thrilled by the idea of taking care of a small person.

"Um... that's very kind of you, but... you're a gym leader, no?" you pointed out. She nodded,
"If I stayed, I'd be stuck in this city, and I need to find Mew. I don't think you would be able to leave this gym, and therefore I wouldn't be able to go and seek for Mew..."

Liza bit her lip - you had a solid point.

"... We'll think of something," she replied after a long hesitation. Then, she shot a smile that was intended to be reassuring,
"I could always try to make my Pokemon to learn some Psychic move that might help you grow... or I could even learn it myself... or maybe Tate's psychic powers and mine could be strong enough to actually grow you. I'm sure we'll come up with something, eventually..."

After that, Liza fell silent and you fell into thought.

The offer you were given was admittedly pretty good and surely the best you had since it was also the sole one; on one hand, the gym leader was right, staying would be much safer than just traveling aimlessly until you found Mew.

On the other hand, you had Pokemon, and were fairly sure that, with them, your chances of survival were as good as anyone's... as long as your Banette didn't come up with something mischievous that implied with your new size... yeah, you guessed Banette was was going to sit in her Pokeball for a while.

Shaking your head, you focused back on Liza's offer and pondered it for a few more minutes.

"Have you made your choice, then?" the giantess spoke.

You looked back at her.
15412.title: Liza's offer

choices: You lose
Have you seen how one sided this is! Of course you lose!
15415.content:
As you turn around, planning on leaving and moving onto another tactic, something else happened. Something that you were not really expecting, a giant foot came in your way. You jumped around and jumped back, a bit freaked out as you looked up to Liza.


“Uh... what’s happening?” You question her as she smiled.

“Well,” She said with a certain level of giddiness in her voice. “You came here for a Gym Battle, so I think it’s only fair you get one!” She said this, and you were confused.

“Uh... it’s great and all, but I did not really want to.... I have more pressing things to worry about at the moment.” You say to her, finding your rules. “So... let me just figure this out, get my height back and we can do it later.”

“Nope!” She said stomping her foot down once again, getting you to panic. “We are having one right now, it’s the Gym Leader rule. once you enter a Gym, you can’t lose until the battle is over.”

“That’s not a real rule.”

“It is, trust me i’m a Gym Leader.” She said with a smile down to you.

You didn’t want to do this, but it was not like you were gonna convince this giant girl otherwise.

“Sure, fine whatever. My Pokemon won’t hear my commands and I won’t be able to see the battle at all, but no it’s fine. Just carry me over to the battlefield.” You said not that enthusiastic about it.

“Hehehe, actually this will be just as good.” She says to you, taking you over and placing you down in the middle. She placed you down into the middle of the room as you see her trying to move stuff under the bed creating more floor space.

“Here, isn’t it a little...”

“You were gonna say small weren’t you?” She questioned with a laugh.

“Well, if you want to ruin your room. Fine, i’ve go-”

“We aren’t gonna need them!” Liza said, quickly moving over and getting onto her knee. She got onto her knee and she grabbed your belt.

“H-Hey! Please don’t do that!” You say trying to swat her giant controlling finger away from you. No matter how much you tried though, you lost your belt and your Pokemon. “Those are mine!”

“You can get them back if you win.” She said playfully, putting it on the top shelf. You were so confused about it, and you were not really sure how you were going to do it.

“I’ve got no Pokemon!” You say back to her as she just rolls her eyes around.

“I won’t use mine either. It will be Gym Leader, versus Challenger!” She said happily and with a smile.

“What?”

“Come on, this is a once in a lifetime event, I never get to be bigger than my challenger! You are gonna be the most fun challenge!” She said with a laugh and a giggle. You just look to the towering little girl, unsure of what she was truly doing?

“Why?”

“Cause I want to, and you can’t escape until you go.” She said as you realise the true danger you were in. If she was not going to let you go unless you do this, you can do nothing about it. You pause and look at her for a couple of seconds before accepting it.

“F-Fine. I’ll do this but you got to let me leave afterwards! You have got to!” You say to her as she smiled down to you.

“Oh, you are just so cute,” She said bringing her finger down to you and patting you on the nose. Her finger being big enough to push on your face. “Yep, don’t worry you can leave!”

“Good be-”

“If you beat me that is.” She said as you look at the giant psychic twin.

“W-What?”

“If you can’t, i’m gonna go around and keep you! I want to keep you, and make you mine. So that’s on line. You win, you get the badge and you can leave, if you don’t I get you!”

You were so left confused about this, cause it did not make any sense to you. You have no idea why she would do this, but the stakes have never been higher. Should you just say no, should you just reject her idea? Walk away. What’s the worst she can do if you do that?”

Putting the theory to the test, you get moving and prepare to leave. However her giant bare foot comes down onto you!

“Hehehe, trying to escape are we. You got to play, or I might just step in the wrong place.”

“D-Did you just threaten to kill me!” You panic at her, as she giggles.

“A threat is nothing wrong, plus I doubt I would actually kill you. Anyway, so you are playing?”

“Guess since I don’t have a choice!” You shout to her as she smiled.

Happily Liza stepped over you as she closed the door. Despite her interest changing 18 degrees, she was still talking the same way before. Does she not see what she is doing to you, She is forcing you into a game you don’t want to play with vicious threats and if you lose, you are hers forever.

“Okay, so the game is simple.” Liza said standing opposite of you. Just seeing her so big, it was pretty clear the advantage she had over this. Hopefully she picks something you can actually win. “It’s gonna be a battle, you against me!”

Okay, clearly this girl is too smart for that. Did she just say you against her.

“Liza, there is no way I can actually win that!”

“Hehehe, I know that’s the beauty of it and... the match will officially commence!” She shouted and just like that, it was on. The match was afoot and it was time to fight.

Your eyes wide open, as you brain tries to attack you with things you can do, but what can you do!?
15415.title: Liza's Unfair Gym Battle

155.content: Thought to myself, I have upgraded membership, may as well add in some slots so more people can add.
155.title: More Slots

choices: You began moving to get back to Twinleaf Town
Suddenly, two people came by (Dawn and Prof. Rowan)
Drawn by your emotions, a Pokemon suddenly emerged from the Lake...
1551.content:
You were left undisturbed, staring at the sky in the direction Mew took off for a long time, your mind processing what just happened: Mew, a supposedly sweet and playful Pokemon, had shrunk you down to size and left you in the middle of nowhere.

Well, that wasn't exactly correct.

You were currently by the lake shore of Lake Verity, where you had been napping until Mew showed up and did... this. So now, you were basically stuck in the wild, shrunk and alone; even if Twinleaf Town was near, you weren't even sure you could reach by night at this size, and that was assuming you didn't get lost in the forest of grass!

Realization dawned on you.

You were no longer a human being, but an insect barely bigger than a speck of dust on the Sinnoh region.

Panic began settling in as you felt your legs shaking, forcing you to sit down to think of a way out of this; okay, being this tiny would seem admittedly somewhat cool, but the perspective of what could happen to you while you were like this... scared you. A lot.

You sat there for a long while, trying to calm the beating of your heart while also trying to calm yourself.

There had to be something you could do, you just had to keep calm; slowly, very slowly, your heart stopped rattling your chest and your breathing became steady.

What you had to do was pretty clear: you had to find Mew. There was one major problem though: you had no idea where Mew went or if you could even get out by this patch of grass by the lake.

Daunted, you turned to face the same lake, trying to think.

But, as much as you tried to focus, you couldn't find a solution that didn't involve finding Mew, a task that was currently impossible since you had no Pokemon or help whatsoever right now; the only thing you had was your PokeKron, which you used to take a picture of the mischievous legendary.

Mew.

You briefly wondered if the pink Pokemon was happily waiting for you, to make your move maybe watching you from somewhere nearby, in a twisted game of hide and seek. Or perhaps she had already forgotten you moments after she took off, really leaving you to fend for yourself in a world of giants.

Once more, fear rose in you, nearly causing you to hyperventilate.

You had to get out of here. You had to find help. You had to avoid ending in the stomach of a Pokemon or on the bottom of someone's shoe.

As you began realizing the true danger of the situation you were in, you felt tempted to cower back down and cry; the world around you began looking much scarier all of a sudden, starting with the 'trees' around you that were starting to tower over you menacingly.

It was all too much to bear.

So, you sat down, hidden as well as you could in the grass, and didn't move.

--

You sat for a very long time.

At first, you tried to convince yourself that this was all a dream, just a dream, a dream you could get out of by simply waking up, a feeble illusion caused by your subconscious, a mirage... but, with how much you tried, you couldn't wake up, and you eventually had to accept that you were living in hard reality.

Upon realizing that, you sank back into thought, but your brain was a maze, and you were stuck in the middle of it with the solution to this situation at the end.

Eventually, you managed to get a headache without having found a way to improve your situation.

Enough, enough! You had to stop thinking and start moving, or else you were going to stay here forever!

You got on your feet and, without thinking anymore, you began running. You at least had to get out of this patch of grass, then... you decided cross that bridge when you came to it.

It took you a while, but eventually managed to emerge from the forest of leafless trees; luckily, there were no Pokemon around.

Small victories, you guessed as you began pondering your next course of action.

Of course, getting back to Twinleaf Town seemed the best thing to do right now, also because you really saw no other option.

You bitterly realized that, had you had a Pokemon, they'd help you out... and maybe you wouldn't even be in this mess to begin with!

You shook your head, knowing you didn't have the time for regrets.

It was decided: you had to get back to the town!
1551.title: Lost at the Lake

choices: "Alright, human, I'll help you find Mew."
"I'm sorry, human, but I cannot help you."
"Forget that. I think I'm gonna keep you!"
15513.content:
Freshly motivated, you began taking a few steps, thinking that your chances to get help would be way higher the moment you set foot in Twinleaf Town.

What you would do next, you didn't know, but you tried to elaborate a plan as you moved. Get help from one of your neighbors, perhaps? And then maybe ask them to bring you to Prof. Rowan's lab, since you doubted any of them would be willing to chase Mew down... and that was supposing the believed you.

However, little did you know that you weren't going to return anytime soon.

As you ran through the lake shore to leave, you heard the unmistakable sound of splashing water behind you, like something had fallen into the lake; instinctively, you froze in your tracks, knowing better: some Pokemon was probably coming out, and if they saw you, you were going to be in trouble.

Shaking in fear, you turned to face a potentially hungry titan... but there was none.

Oddly enough though, there was what appeared to be a sphere of water hovering above the lake, right in the middle of it.

Now, your mind was telling you to turn around again and get lost; but curiosity got the best of you.

"... Huh?"

--

At the bottom of Lake Verity, a Pokemon slept peacefully.

However, its sleep was disturbed as it sensed something, extremely near to its location.

Emotions... especially strong emotions, intense fear being the strongest it could feel.

Then, a new emotion emerged - resignation, followed by a sudden surge of determination.

Such an odd mix of strong emotions made it so that they couldn't be ignored any longer.

It was time to see who was the source.

So, completely, awakened from its slumber, the Pokemon began to rise from the depths of the lake it resided it.

And finally, light.

--

You watched in disbelief as the sphere of water lingered above the lake for a few moments more, like a soap bubble, and just like one it popped, splashing droplets of water everywhere; a Pokemon took the place of the sphere of water, you noted.

Your jaw nearly dropped as you stared at the titanic being that was now fluttering above the lake, stirring and yawning.

It had a relatively small body and small feet, long slender arms and a pink head. Also, it had two identical tails, each with a gem, and there was a third, red gem in the middle of its forehead; eventually, the creature opened its eyes, allowing you to see their shade of gold.

There was no mistaking it, this was another legendary! This Pokemon was the Being of Emotion, Mesprit!

You couldn't believe your luck (or misfortune), meeting two legendaries, the rarest creatures of the world, in one day!

You watched in silence as the titan looked around, seemingly searching for something... or someone.

And that someone, you realized when the gaze of the Pokemon landed on you, was you!

Again, you felt the need to run, and the urge only grew stronger as you saw the legendary fluttering in your direction, reaching you in a matter of seconds; you found yourself face to face with Mesprit, right before it extended its paws to grab you. You turned around and ran in the opposite direction, only for a tail twice as big as you to land in front of you, blocking your escape and causing you to turn once more and run... right into Mesprit's awaiting hands, which closed around you as the legendary flew up at a decent height.

You were utterly terrified, but the titan seemingly had no bad intentions. In fact, it was merely examining you; eventually, it let a smile spread on its face.

And then, it spoke to you.

"Curious." it said in perfect human language, sounding distinctly feminine,
"Human travelers aren't rare, but they usually don't usually possess such a... peculiar size."

You were fairly sure you heard the giant - giantess, you decided - giggling after her little speech.

You were so bewildered to forget your fear. However, Mesprit didn't.

"If I may ask, human, why are you so afraid? I do not wish to harm you."

The question caught you off guard. Mostly because you didn't expect a Pokemon to ask you why you were afraid instead of simply tossing you in their mouth and swallow.

"... Huh?"

"I asked-"

"N-No, I heard you," you interrupted, still hardly believing you were talking to a Pokemon,
"It's... well, everything. I'm so small I could be killed by everything... though I'm very, very grateful that you don't want to hurt me!" you hastily added the last line, making Mesprit giggle.

"That makes sense." she replied,
"But how did a human become so small?"

At the question, your mind went back to Mew, and you were reminded of what you were supposed to be doing right now instead of chatting with another legendary about it.

"The subject seems to be causing you a great amount of distress." Mesprit noted, amused.
"Perhaps I can fix that."

In an instant, you became perfectly calm. It was as if fear, worry, distress and every other negative emotion you were feeling simply disappeared.

"I believe you can now speak, yes?" Mesprit calmly wondered.

"Yes." you replied without hesitation, a bit stoically even.

You began telling your tale, at the end of which Mesprit looked intrigued.

"Mew, you say?" she spoke, intrigued. What was Mew even doing in the Sinnoh region?

"Yes. She told me to find her."

Mesprit sighed.

"That... does sound like something Mew would do." she said.

"I can only hope she'll give me back my size then," you continued, before adding,
"Can you help me?"

Normally, you'd be a little more intimidated while asking such thing to a Pokemon who was said to possess an immense strength and who was literally holding your life in her very hands, but being temporarily deprived of fear made you a lot bolder as a consequence.

Mesprit's eyes shone at the request.

"Help... you...?" she parroted back, pondering the request you made for a little while; then, she replied,
15513.title: The Being of Emotion

choices: “We’re going to wait one day.”
“We’re going to wait a week.”
“You better hold on tight!”
155131.content:
"Alright, human, I'll help you find Mew." Mesprit answered finally.

"Really?" You ask, surprisingly not very excited about her response. "Thank you so- wait. Mesprit can you... stop using your powers or whatever? I don't like not being able to express emotions."

"Hm? Oh right, I forgot I was calming you. You should be fine now." The legendary answered, not doing anything that visibly caused change.

"Okay, good!" You shout, checking to make sure you could properly emote again. "I-uh, thank you for helping me!" You stutter out an embarrassed thanks. "I would've been in so much trouble if you weren't helping me."

"Yes, I imagine that you quite would be." The legendary responded bluntly, a mischievous gleam washing over her eyes. "You wouldn't wind up eaten, around here at least, most Pokémon here are herbivorous. But outside of my domain you would be in quiet a precarious situation. I imagine a lot of Pokémon would love having a little human. Especially one as cute as you..."

"Um... you think so?" You laugh nervously. Mesprit was looking at you with a rather protective gaze, the golden eyes really enhancing the affect.

"Oh yes, there's something quite cute about you. I mean... look at you! You're so small you fit snuggly in my hands! It's so easy to..."

Mesprit slowly brought you closer to her face. You were unable to protest, enraptured by the giantess' golden eyes. The legendary wasn't suppressing your emotions, just not letting you express them. This drastic shift in personality was frightening you, but you had no way to express that... or resist what she was doing.

Mesprit hands slowly crept you closer and closer to her face. Unable to move you gaze, instead you could only listen to the sounds around you. Your mind racing with a sense of fear, you believe your hear the sound of the legendary's mouth opening. Had she-!

"Cuddle you." Mesprit finished her sentence, pressing you gently against her cheek. The giantess giggled as you were released from her gaze and you looked away, blushing.

"You scared me... ahaha.: You attempt to nervously laugh the situation off.

"Oh I'm sorry. I truly meant that I didn't mean you any harm, but I couldn't stop myself from having a bit of fun at your expense. It's always to tempting to pass on the opportunity to mess with humans."Mesprit laughed.

"But I'm still sorry. Perhaps making you think I was going to eat you was a bit too much. No more pranks, I promise."

"Please, keep that promise." You respond, still a little shaky.

Done with her fun, Mesprit moved you away from her cheek and gently patted your head with one hand.

"So... why are you going to help me, Mesprit? You're not going to ask for a favor after all this, are you?"

"Ha! No, nothing silly like that. I just want to help you is all. It's important for Pokémon as powerful as me to set an example that all living things should cooperate." Mesprit reasoned with a warm smile.

Wow. You never thought you'd hear a legendary say something so cool.

"Plus it gives a reason to mess with Mew."

Uh... what?

"Uh, what?" You parrot your immediate thought back to the legendary.

Still holding you in her hands, Mesprit turned around and began floating back to her lake.

"I'm going to be honest with you for a minute, human. I'm not the biggest fan of Mew."

Okay, this could be interesting.

"She gets to float around, all over the world and do whatever she wants. She can even pull stunts like this on innocent mortals like you. She thinks she can be carefree just because she's a legendary."

You had no reason to disagree with that statement now.

"Now that's not a bad thing, and she does some genuinely helpful things but... ugh!" At the sound of her annoyed groan, the waters of Mesprit's lake roared to life and catapulted into the air. You didn't react at all, but only because Mesprit momentarily kept you calm. Soon you free to sweat nervously at the display.

"While she's free to do whatever she wants, I have to stay at this lake and help preserve the cosmic balance of space and time! I'm part of a system that helps keep the entire world in balance, and I even guard a peaceful lake domain in my spare time. But who gets all the attention? Mew!"

The water around you began to stir again.

"For some reason, people absolutely love her. I get, she's kind of cute, but I'm cute too! But I barely get my name whispered and Mew is part of a conversation every day."

Now the waters were practically raging.

"Uh... Mesprit."

"But now's my chance to show her up. She though she could just prank you in my domain and leave? Ha! I'm going to help you find her, make her turn you back to normal and show her that she isn't as cool as she thinks."

"Mesprit!" You shouted as some water splashed against you.

"She probably doesn't even realize it, but her little prank on you is a challenge to me! And! It! Is! On!"

The water around Mesprit erupted into a geyser and sprayed the area around the lake with water. You seemed to be shielded from getting wet and you also managed to avoid getting scarred! You were actually just astounded that Mesprit had indulged such... interesting information to you.

As quickly as it erupted out, all of the water in the lake quickly gathered back in and the surface became completely still once more.

"Um........ cool?" You honestly weren't sure how you should have responded to all of that.

"Well, sorry you had to see that." Mesprit laughed, completely back to her previous calm persona.

"So are we going after Mew?"

"Heck yeah." Mesprit answered adorably. "But, just a head's up..."
155131.title: Mesprit Accepts Mew’s Challenge

choices: "How about we get to know each other better?"
"Let's play a game!"
"I suggest you get some rest, human."
1551311.content:
"We're going to wait one day," Mesprit informed while hovering back down to her lake after floating far above the water during her little outburst,
"Then, we'll give Mew chase."

"Wait, why?" you questioned, unable to hide how eager you were to regain your former size,
"Why not go after her now?"

In response, Mesprit smirked.

"Because, human, it wouldn't be as challenging if we went after Mew now," she explained, donning an unreadable expression. Determination? Annoyance? You couldn't tell, but you surely didn't like where this was going.
"Let her have a headstart, it'll only make things more interesting."

"That's..." you paused, then sighed,
"... What about helping me?"

Mesprit's smirk shrank into a gentle smile as those golden eyes of hers sparkled calmly.

"Don't worry, human. Helping you will remain my priority," she reassured, bringing a hand to your head, starting to stroke gently,
"But, might as well have some fun if I'm really going through with this, since I don't get to leave this lake very often."

You sighed, having to admit that there was a point in what she was saying. Plus, if the legendary decided so, there was probably little you could do about it.

"Alright." you said dejectedly.

Mesprit tilted her head slightly as she sensed your discomfort.

"You seem resigned," she pointed out, smiling playfully,
"Want me to rid you of that?"

"No!" you blurted out as soon as she made the offer; then, thinking hastily, you formulated a more proper response,
"I mean, no, thank you... Mesprit."

You no idea if it was alright to call the friendly legendary by name, but she didn't show any signs of being offended or even slightly upset. In fact, she was still smiling.

"Hehe, I'm just kidding," she admitted, moving you closer to her face, once more beginning to cuddle you,
"I can't help it, it's just so easy to mess with you!... Sorry."

You sighed, figuring you were going to have to get used to this, especially Mesprit was going to be your protector for a prolonged amount of this.

Hopefully, it wasn't going to take that long to find Mew.

"So..." you asked, freeing one of your arms and pushing against Mesprit's cheek to regain some space, so you could at least speak,
"... What now?"

The legendary freed you.

"Well, I don't know you, but I've been asleep for a looong time, and I'm starving!" she announced, before looking at you, asking in a much gentler tone,
"And you?"

You felt your stomach growling at the mention of food. With everything that's been going on, you had completely forgotten that you hadn't eaten anything in a while now.

"Um... yeah. I am sorta hungry." you admitted, causing Mesprit to smile.
"Then let's go get snacks." she said.

You couldn't stop yourself from asking,

"What do you even eat?"

Mesprit looked away and grumbled,

"Berries."

You couldn't not notice that she sounded deeply unsatisfied with that statement. What a change from the cheerful Mesprit you met not even an hour ago!... Well, not so much of a change when compared to the outburst from before, you mused.

"You... don't seem very happy with that." you pointed out, causing the giantess legendary to look at you.

"Well, duh! D'you have any idea how frustrating it is to wake up from long periods of slumber with nothing to eat but berries?" she asked you; you didn't, but from her reaction, you imagined it was pretty bad.

Mesprit sighed, then giggled as she felt a certain amount of anxiety emanating from you.

"Sorry you had to see that, human." she apologized, much like earlier.

"It's okay." you replied. Then, you had an idea,
"Hey, if you wanna try something different, maybe I can help. I'm not entirely sure, but I think I've got some snacks in my bag, but, well... I'm too small to get 'em."

The giantess looked at you like you like a predator would with an oblivious prey.

"... It's back on the ground."

At the mention, the legendary's eyes immediately darted to where she found you; there, abandoned, lied the bag you were talking about.

It took Mesprit about a moment to fly - at breakneck speed, much to your horror - to it, drop you on the ground and dig inside, emerging shortly later with snacks in her short paws.

She looked at you with a beaming smile.

"Let's eat!"

--

"Aw man, these were so good!" Mesprit cheered happily, turning her gaze and smile to you,
"I reeeally owe you one for that, human!"

You smiled briefly, momentarily putting your condition aside.

Mesprit was adorable. More than that, she was friendly, and willing to help you out without asking nothing in exchange... not to mention her power could probably rival Mew's.

You realized just how lucky you had been to stumble into her... even if she had delayed the 'hunt' for Mew for some... debatable reason.

"Hey, what's with the happiness all of a sudden?" the pink-headed giantess asked playfully, her tails sliding beneath your feet, forming a platform for you to stand on as she drew them closer to her.

"It's nothing, hahaha." you attempted to laugh it off, feeling vaguely embarrassed as you realized what you were thinking; that didn't escape Mesprit's infallible senses, and she quickly gained a smirk.

"Oh - you sure?" she asked playfully, poking you in the chest with a finger. Several times.

You ignored the question, pushed her finger away and answered with a question of your own,

"Mesprit," you began, retrieving your seriousness as your mind wandered back to your size-related issue,
"Do you think it'll be hard finding Mew?"

The legendary shrugged.

"Who knows." she simply replied; then, sensing that you were unsatisfied with that answer, she added,
"We will find her, human, and I will make her turn you back to normal." she reassured with determination... which oddly made her look even more adorable.

You smiled gratefully.

"Thanks." you replied, causing the giantess to smile as well.

It was rare for her to get gratitude; the Pokemon around the lake didn't even seem to notice that she was why they could all lead peaceful lives.

"So," you spoke again after a moment of silence,
"What do we do for the next twenty-four hours?"

Drawn back to reality from her upsetting line of thinking, Mesprit laughed quietly.

Then, she answered,
1551311.title: Delayed departure

choices: Mesprit wins, of course.
You somehow manage to win!
Something interrupts your game.
15513112.content:
“Let’s play a game!” Mesprit suggested, sounding surprisingly eager.

“A game? What kind of games do legendary Pokémon even play?” You asked, curious if the legendary Pokémon had something unique in mind.

Mesprit crossed her arms and gave you a funny look.

“The same games as everyone else, duh.”

“Oh, right. Ahaha…” You laughed nervously. That made sense, you supposed, you’re not sure what kind of special games you thought might exist just for legendaries.

“Cool, now let’s talk about what we’re gonna play!” Mesprit immediately got excited again. It was pretty adorable, but now you were curious about something else.

“You sound really excited about this. You know we won’t be able to do anything that exciting, right?”

Not losing her happy smile, Mesprit poked you gently in the chest again. “Says you. I haven’t gotten to play any sort of game with someone in ages.”

Your smile faltered a bit hearing that. “Really?”

Noticing your changed expression, Mesprit raised an eyebrow.

“What? Are you feeling bad for me? Don’t do that, let’s not make this complicated.” Mesprit smiled reassuringly.

Figuring that she was right, you shrugged your shoulders and smiled again. “Okay, what did you have in mind?”

Shifting around, Mesprit allowed herself to float to the ground, her stomach resting atop the grass and gently smushing it underneath her. The legendary crossed her arms and used them to rest her chin on the ground, her legs kicking excitedly behind her. Even at her massive size, she still looked adorable.

“I want to play hide and seek!” Mesprit announced.

“Not even giving me a choice, eh?” You smirked.

Mesprit smirked in return. “Well I am the big one. Plus, this is the most entertaining game we can both play. I could turn your body into putty and stretch you around instead if you want.”

Your smirk faltered a bit at the suggestion, but you laughed it off. “You can’t really do that… can you?”

Mesprit giggled. “If I really tried I probably could, but that would be a lot of effort for not much fun.”

“Well hide and seek sounds good to me, I guess. It will probably be boring for you since you’ll win so easily.”

Mesprit let her head fall to one side, her feet still happily kicking behind her. “Are you accusing me of cheating?” She asked in mock offense. “I’ll disable my psychic powers, no emotion or life force tracking.”

You hadn’t actually thought about the possibility of Mesprit cheating, but you were glad to know that she was planning to play fair.

“That’s not what I meant, though I appreciate the fair play.” You noted, earning a giggle from your caretaker. “It’s just that this open space doesn’t give me a good selection of hiding spots. Plus I’m kind of…”

Mesprit waited a bit for you to finish but then suddenly got a teasing smile.

“Oh my, is that fear I feel?”

“Ugh, I hate when you do that.”

“Sorry, it’s part of who I am. Now, will you tell me what you’re scared of? Well, nervous is probably a more accurate description. Are you nervous about being separated from me?” The legendary teased.

“No! ...Okay yes, but that’s only a part of it.” You insisted. “I don’t think any of the Pokémon around here can talk like you can. And I’d rather not have my hiding spot be in a Pokémon’s belly. I’m just a little nervous about possibly running into another Pokémon.”

“Do you think I’d let that happen?” Mesprit laughed, her eyes adapting a gentle look. “I promised you that I’d protect you and get you to Mew, correct? No harm will befall you, even if you should run into another Pokémon while I am not present.”

Mesprit moved to cuddle you once more, but you motioned for her to stop, electing a pout from the giantess.

“Hm. You will have to learn to accept my cuddling. I will spare you this time, but I will not always be so considerate.”

“Duly noted.” You answered, surprised that Mesprit listened to you this time.

“If I win this round I will be allowed one session of cuddling, for as long as I wish whenever I desire it.” Mesprit stated, making it clear this wasn’t a request.

You just laughed it off and got back to your original concern. “Alright but, like I said, this will be a pretty boring win for you. Your lake doesn’t exactly have many good spots to hide. You could probably see me from a good distance away. And I’m kind of restricted to this side of the shore.”

Understanding what you were saying, Mesprit sank into thought, her eyes drifting to the side and looking out into space. She hummed softly to herself before gasping.

“I have a good way to fix that! It should increase your chance of winning dramatically and it will ease your mind of worry about other Pokemon. Come here.” She ordered gently, waving you close with one of the paws under her chin.

“Uh, what are you going to do?”

“Just come over! This could be quicker, but I am refraining from grabbing you without your permission. For now at least.”

Appreciating her attempt to be polite, you oblige her request and walk forward, stepping off her tails as you go. You stopped when you were told to, arriving directly in front of the legendary's face. Her head, bolstered by her arms, towered over you like a massiv billboard. Even though her size was intimidating, she still radiated a feeling of gentleness and-

“Pay attention! I need you to look at the gem on my forehead.”

“On your forehead…” You mumble, slowly focusing on the large gem she spoke of.

“So what no-”

“Just focus on the gem.” Mesprit said sweetly and condescendingly.

Deciding against commenting further, you did as you were told and focused on Mesprit’s gem. It was an interesting part of Mesprit. What was it there for? Was it how she used her psychic powers? Some other psychic types had a gem on their head too, but not all of them did. You wondered if there was a connection.

…

Was something supposed to be happening? You didn’t want to be impatient, but the gem hasn’t shown any sign of change and you assumed that’s why you were supposed to-

“Okay done.” Mesprit’s cheery voice rang in your head.

“Wait really? But nothing changed!” You said incredulously.

“Ohoho really? Why don’t you look at your hands then?”

You give the legendary a strange look before you do as instructed. Only to realize that you couldn’t because your hands weren’t there any more! In fact, you couldn’t see any of yourself anymore!

“Mesprit, did you-?”

“Turn you invisible? Heck yeah I did! This should make hiding a lot easier for you.”

You laughed, amazed that you had been turned completely invisible so quickly.

“Wow, this is pretty cool! But, how are you going to find me? You said that you wouldn’t use your powers to track me and I don’t see how you can find someone invisible without those.”

A smug grin spread across Mesprit’s lips. “Oh you poor thing, you would be smart not to underestimate me. Run along now, I will count to one thousand and then I will come find you. And then I will savor your fear as you dread my next cuddle attack, mwahahaha.”

Finishing her “evil” laugh the psychic covered her eyes with her paws and started counting quietly. You guessed that it was time for you to go.

The game was on.
15513112.title: Games Legendaries Play

choices: Azelf
Uxie
Reader’s Choice
155131123.content:
Mesprit’s legs continued to happily kick behind her as she covered her eyes. Though she really should have been. she hadn’t actually started counting yet. She was making sure that the little human had a head start for hiding. She was confident in her ability to find him, even while he was invisible and she was without her powers.

“You better not just try to stand still right in front of me. That definitely will not work.” Mesprit said aloud, just in case the human was planning to do just that. Fortunately she didn’t hear any kind of response or reaction, so she figured that the human had wandered far enough away now.

Unable to contain an excited giggle, Mesprit started counting towards one thousands. She was finally going to play a game with someone again! Of course, she had to make sure to count at a fair pace… but then the chase was on!

* * *

Not wanting to disappoint the apparently very excited Mesprit, you dashed through the tall grass as fast as you could. Admittedly, Mesprit turning you invisible did make you a bit more excited to play. You thought it gave you a really good shot at winning. You doubted that you could actually pull off a win, but it would at least be a little harder for Mesprit now.

Not to mention, being invisible made you feel a lot more comfortable about being alone. It would be impossible for a Pokémon to notice you like this! And, from what you remembered, the Pokémon around here already weren’t that dangerous, so it would be easy to avoid getting accidentally injured by them. A giant human would be more difficult… but you doubted anyone would randomly be wandering around now.

Confident and eager, you kept moving forward in search of a good hiding spot.

* * *

One thousand! The instant Mesprit recited the number in her head, the legendary Pokémon removed her paws from her eyes and rose off the ground. She rubbed her paws together eagerly, her eyes scanned the ground before her thoughts even told her to. An innocently excited smile was the only expression on Mesprit’s face.

“Ready or not human, here I…”

Mesprit’s paws stopped rubbing together and her eyes stopped their search. Slowly the legendary lake guardian floated back to the ground until the grass was once more smothered beneath her.

“I can’t start looking yet.” She thought glumly. “I have not finished counting properly. One thousand does not come after ninety nine. I missed one hundred through nine hundred and ninety nine."

With a whimper, Mesprit fell onto her back, closed her eyes and covered them with her paws again.

“Don’t let your excitement get the better of you again.”

* * *

After moving along for some time, you reached the area of the lake where the tree line started. Mesprit’s lake was surrounded by a large forest, with the exception of the small path that led from the lake to your hometown. And even that path had plenty of trees and vegetation around it. You figured that this was good for your game though. Even for a legendary Pokémon, it should be super hard to find a shrunken, invisible human somewhere in a large forest right? This would be a great hiding spot!

…

Did you really need to find a hiding spot? You pondered as you moved into the forest a little bit. You were completely invisible, you mused. It should be hard enough to find you based on that fact alone. Of course you weren’t going to just hide right beside Mesprit, you wouldn’t overestimate your invisibility that much. And, judging from how confident she sounded earlier, you definitely shouldn’t underestimate Mesprit.

After giving the idea some more thought, you just laughed it off. You were headed into a forest, you noted, there probably wasn’t anything in there that could be used as a hiding spot anyways; not ones that weren’t super obvious at least.

Your invisibility was the only thing that even gave you a chance, so you decided that you’d go into the forest looking for a safe place to lay low.

* * *
