“Five hundred thirty three… Five hundred thirty four… five hundred thirty- gah!” Mesprit groaned and contorted, trying to give herself a facepalm without uncovering her closed eyes.

“Why did I make it such a high number?” She wondered, irritated. “I wanted to give him ample time to hide but… this is hard!”

Truly, the situation was strange. Mesprit was a lake guardian, a part of the trio that helped keep the balance of space and time in check. Throughout her long, long life she had spent uncountable amounts of time waiting and doing nothing. Of course much of that time was spent sleeping, but she spent just as much time awake.

So why was this small amount of waiting so aggravating!?

Mesprit groaned and whimpered. “I will not be defeated by my own impatience! ...Five hundred thirty five… five hundred thirty six… five hundred thirty seven…”

* * *

A calming silence permeated the forest as you wandered through it. Or was it an unsettling silence? You decided that it was the former since plenty of sunshine was getting through the tree tops and lighting the interior. It wasn’t some scary dark forest, it was just a dim happy forest that was being watched over by the kindest legendary Pokémon you’ve ever met.

Admittedly you had only met two and the other you met shrunk you, but Mesprit was still super nice. She was even helping you find Mew, who was the one to shrink you! Of course, she was only going to do it after waiting a day but you figured she could have made you wait a lot longer.

You don’t think you could’ve ended up with someone better than Mesprit.

“Well well, what do we have here?” You instantly froze at the sound of a voice. A voice that sounded absolutely nothing like Mesprit’s.

‘What do we have here?’ Did you get discovered? But… but you were invisible! That shouldn’t be possible. The voice must be talking to themselves, you obviously haven't been seen. Noticing that there was nothing in front of you, you turn around to face behind you, just to prove yourself right.

“What’s up?” The thing immediately behind and looking at you asked.

You didn’t respond, since you fainted the moment you realized you had been found by… something.

* * *

“Nine hundred eighty two…”

This was it.

“Nine hundred eighty three…”

She was nearly done counting!

“Nine hundred eighty four…”

She was almost done.

“Nine hundred eighty five...”

And then she could play!

“Nine hundred eighty six…”

Just you wait, human!

“Nine hundred eighty seven…”

Mesprit was about to be let loose!

“Nine hundred eighty eight…”

After all this waiting you better…

“...?”

Mesprit shot up from the ground back up into the air.

“Something’s wrong.” She said to herself. Even though she had turned off her powers to make her game with the human more fun, she had just picked up a feeling of powerful energy. If it was powerful enough for her to feel when she was suppressing her own abilities, whatever she was feeling could be a huge problem.

Although she was very unhappy about it, Mesprit allowed her powers to become unrestrained, ruining all of the hard work she put into counting to one thousand. She recognized instantly that she had made the right choice though. With her powers free, she was quickly able to pinpoint where the disturbance was… and the fact that you were right by it!

“Oh, little human.” Mesprit mumbled, slightly worried. Wasting no time she started flying to where you two were. But who, or what, did she find you with when she arrived?
155131123.title: A Quickly Interrupted Game

choices: "... Good luck with that. I'll just go back to my lake."
"... I'll join you, then."
1551311231.content:
Thanks to the enormous amount of power emanated by whatever was with her human friend, Mesprit didn't take longer than ten seconds to reach his location, discovering...

"... Azelf."

The blue Pokemon that was fluttering in front of Mesprit looked up from the ground, which she had been apparently staring at; Mesprit knew better.

"Hi sis."

Mesprit floated in silence for a moment; she felt the human's presence extremely near, but for some odd reason he wasn't moving.

So, shoving her sibling aside, Mesprit located you and, focusing on you, she used her powers to render you visible once more, only to see that you were unconscious.

Concerned, Mesprit looked at her sister.

"Az," she began,
"What did you do to this human?"

"Hm?... Absolutely nothing." Azelf replied with a shrug,
"Guy just passed out when he saw me. I think he got scared." she added, before noticing Mesprit's look,
"Oh - you know him?"

The pink-headed legendary gave a small nod, hovering to the ground, gently picking your body in her hands. Then, she glanced at Azelf again.

"Sis, what are you even doing here?" she wondered.

Seeing Azelf here was... unexpected to say the least, since the Being of Willpower had a lake of her own to guard; said guardian shrugged.

"I felt that you were awake. In fact, you woke me up." she explained,
"I came because I thought something was wrong. You're welcome, by the way."

Mesprit looked offended.

"... 'You're welcome'? Sis, you just ruined my game." she chided.

Azelf perked up.

"Game? With this human? Weren't we supposed to, y'know... avoid humans?" she reminded Mesprit, who huffed.

"Oh, please. Like he could do anything to us. And go tell that to Mew, she's the one who shrunk him to this size."

"... What?" Azelf just seemed to realize how small you were compared to other humans,
"Oh, yeah, I forgot! What's the deal with his size?... Did you just mention it was Mew?"

Mesprit sighed.

"Yes..."

--

Much later, you began regaining your consciousness.

"Hey, are you feeling alright?" a concerned voice, which you identified as your newly acquired legendary friend, asked.

"... Yeah, I'm alright." you replied as your eyes opened, meeting with Mesprit's golden ones,
"What happened?" you wondered, before memories got back to you,
"... Oh yeah, I remember! Someone saw me! How's that possible?"

"Oh, you know... I sensed you were there." another voice chimed in as a creature similar to Mesprit rose out from behind her back; the only difference was that this one had a blue head, which was differently shaped. And there was a friendly smile on its face.
"Hi."

You flinched - Azelf!? It was another legendary! And... a she, too?

"A-Azelf...?" you suffered in disbelief.

Three legendaries in one day! Yours would be any trainer's dream, and you weren't even a trainer!

"Oh, he knows my name."

Mesprit sighed, then looked at you with a gentle smile.

"That is correct. Meet my sister, human,"

You looked at her, then at Azelf. 'Sister'? Legendaries had families? Sure, there was a certain similarity between the two, but...

"Y-You... you guys are related?"

Both legendaries blinked.

"Uh - yeah? I just told you that." Mesprit spoke, sensing a certain degree of confusion in you.

"We came out of the same egg. What else would that make us?" Azelf said.

"That... makes complete sense." you admitted, looking to the side, feeling awkward,
"I, uh... nice to meet you?"

"Why are you so nervous again?" Mesprit teased, causing you to shoot a frustrated look.

"... Please, stop doing that."

"I already told you, I can't!" the legendary happily replied.

You were about to reply, but were interrupted as you were grabbed from your perch and were brought to a new one on Azelf's hands; Mesprit's sister wore a cheerful smile.

"Nice to meet you, too." she said; even her golden eyes were the same as Mesprit's, to the point that they also carried that same gentle sparkle that was in your friend's own golden eyes.

"Oooh, he likes you sis!"

You snapped out of your trance and blushed furiously.

"Mesprit!"

Azelf giggled. Only for a second though, because she then adopted a more serious look.

"So, little human... Mesprit has informed me about the 'prank' Mew played on you." she told.

You were reminded of why you were here with the two legendaries right now.

"... Th-That's right! She just showed up a-and shrunk me to this size, telling me to find her!" you exclaimed.

"Ah, don't get so worked up." Mesprit chimed as one of her tails wrapped around you, pulling you from Azelf's hands to her own; again, the Being of Emotion had that determined look from before, a smile on her face,
"I already promised I'd help you find Mew twice, didn't I? I'll promise again if you wish, but you really need to stop forgetting that, hehe."

The legendary felt tempted to cuddle you again, but repressed the urge. She hadn't earned that... yet.

You got a smile of your own as you nodded. You knew she was just teasing you; you had a feeling that you weren't going to forget this experience that easily when you got back to your size.

...

If you got back to your size.

"Wait..." Azelf chimed,
"You're helping him with this?"

Mesprit shot her a glance.

"Yeah! Why else did you think I had a small human with me all this time?"

"I thought you were just taking care of him! You know, as in... keeping him?"

Mesprit got an amused smile.

"You know, sis... I'll admit that I maaaay have thought about it," she said, causing you to look at her, eyes shot open; sensing your emotions, the legendary looked down at you and winked before she continued,
"But, let Mew do whatever she wants around MY lake and get away with it? Ha! Not a chance!"

You were sure you heard the roaring of the water as Mesprit exclaimed that last line and were reminded of how she felt about Mew.

As for Azelf, she glanced in between you and her sister for a few moments, before she spoke,

"Ah, well, if that's the case..."
1551311231.title: Legendary siblings

choices: Mesprit still wants to play.
Azelf is hungry now.
Mesprit tries to make rules for Azelf.
15513112312.content:
“If that’s the case, then I’m going to stick around!” Azelf declared cheerily.

Hearing Azelf say that made you a bit excited. So far she had been just as nice as Mesprit, and she seemed just as informal as her too, so you didn’t have to change the way you were acting. It could be trouble if they started pushing each other’s buttons, but if they did, they’d leave you out of the crossfire.. right?

“Uh, you sure Azelf?” Mesprit asked cautiously. “Isn’t your lake still… majorly messed up?”

“Hm?” Azelf spaced out for a moment before smiling and nodding. “Oh, yeah, it’s still pretty bad. But I’ve got most of it put back together so it’s fine without my attention.”

“W-wait. What happened to your lake?” You interrupted the two, very confused.

Azelf’s eyes shifted from her sister to you, glowing a bit brighter when you were in their sight. “Oh, a while ago some human organization blew up my lake. It was a pretty big explosion too, almost all of the water in the lake was gone.”

You were astounded by how casually she told you that.

“It still kind of weirds me out how casual you are about that.” Mesprit spoke what you were thinking.

“Eh.” Azelf shrugged. “None of the Pokémon got hurt, though I had to protect the Pokémon in the water, but everyone got out unscathed.”

“Wh-why did humans blow up your lake?” You asked, trying not to sound too concerned about the apparently unimportant event.

“Ummm… I think the humans were called Team Galaxy or something?” The blue headed legendary scratched her chin.“They tried to catch me for some reason… they probably would have gone after you and Uxie next, Prit Prit.”

Though learning more about that Team Galaxy was much more important, you laughed at Azelf’s ridiculous nickname for Mesprit.

“I told you not to call me that Azelf!” Mesprit snapped at her sister. “Especially not around others!”

“Ah, I forgot. Sorry Mesprit.” She responded unfazed by her sibling’s yelling. “Anyways, I obviously avoided getting caught and I dealt with the humans.”

You and Mesprit waited for Azelf to explain what she meant by “dealt with”, but she just stopped telling her story after that.

You were too curious to leave the topic hanging.

“If you don’t mind me asking,” You began, “what did you do to them?”

Azelf smiled gently and used her psychic powers to take you from Mesprit’s hands back to her own. As you floated over, Mesprit briefly reached out to grab you but allowed her sister to hold you… for now.

“Well little human, you know how Mew shrunk you as a prank?”

You nodded your head.

“Well, I shrunk the humans’ whole group… as divine retribution.”

The subtle shift in the tone of Azelf’s voice made you very uncomfortable.

Mesprit, meanwhile, was unfazed. She was well aware that her sister was joking. It took a lot to stop herself from laughing when Azelf said “divine retribution”. Figuring it would be harmless, Mesprit let Azelf continue uninterrupted.

“You… you did?” You tried not to sound intimidated by the friendly legendary’s statement.

“Oh yes, I did.” Azelf confirmed. “In fact, I might have made them smaller than you.”

The giantess giggled mischievously. “Do you want to know what I did to them?”

“I… uhm.”

Mesprit’s relaxed floating stiffened and she looked at her sister skeptically. Azelf either didn’t notice or ignored her.

“Well, I did a lot of things to them. A few of them, I simply disintegrated with my psychic powers, just to make an example. Once I got them under control, I divided them into groups. The first group, I simply scattered in the wild of my domain. It didn’t take long for angry Pokémon to get revenge for me on the ones who blew up my lake. The second group, I put to sleep… and then I ate them.” She added bluntly. “Not even one at a time, that would’ve taken too long. And then, ehehe, then the last group. It had what looked liked everyone who was a top dog of the group. So I reached into them with my psychic power, grabbed their very souls and-”

“Azelf!” Mesprit shouted, finally having enough. The pink headed legendary grabbed you from her sister’s hand and held you next to her with psychic energy. Very upset with her, Mesprit flailed her arms to smack Azelf on the head, who only put up a token defense.

“Ah! Hey sis, calm down! What’s the matter?” Azelf asked as she defended herself from the onslaught.

“Your stupid made up story is what’s the matter!” Mesprit yelled, not letting up. “I just spent the last few hours trying to make the little human feel safe and not afraid of me, and you’re going to lie about killing a bunch of other humans and ripping out their souls!?”

“I was just trying to scare him! I obviously didn’t mean any of it! Who would believe any of that? I almost burst out laughing when I said ‘divine retribution’.”

“You’re a legendary, you moron! Any one who isn’t one too will believe a story like that if you tell it well enough!”

The struggle between the sisters continued for a while, with you floating behind them. Seeing Mesprit trying to smack Azelf was an entertaining sight, and you were utterly relieved to hear both Pokémon confirm Azelf’s story was fake, but it still made you feel anxious and uncomfortable. Azelf’s fake story reminded you of how powerful these legendaries could be, and the idea of either of them actually doing those things to you made you tremble.

After getting in a good hit on Azelf’s head, Mesprit shoved her sister away and huffed angrily, her paws balled up angrily at her side. Azelf turned away from Mesprit and sheepishly rubbed her head. She hadn’t been injured by Mesprit, but she figured doing this would temporarily diffuse the situation between them.

No longer concerned with her sister, Mesprit floated back to you and released you from her psychic grip. You fell gently into Mesprit’s waiting paws, which cupped you gently in their palms.

“Um… don’t worry. I’m fine.” You insisted.

“...No you’re not.” Mesprit said after a pause. “I can feel your anxiety.”

This time you weren’t embarrassed or annoyed that Mesprit could read your emotions. It would assure her that you were being honest with what you were going to say next. You really weren’t mad at Azelf, and you definitely weren’t afraid of either of the legendaries, though that admittedly didn’t help with your anxiety.

“No, Mesprit, I really am fine.” You smile at the legendary. “That’s not to say I’m not a little… anxious right now, but I’m not scared of you or Azelf or anything.”

Mesprit, not sensing any emotions that indicated you were lying, smiled. “Glad to hear it. Did you want me to get rid of your anxiousness? I could calm you down, if you wanted.”

“I think you’re doing a pretty good job of that by holding me like this.” You tried to tease.

Mesprit smirked, but blushed just a little bit. “Leave the teasing to me, you’re really bad at it.”

Having been waiting for the perfect time to insert herself into the conversation, Azelf’s head came from behind and rested awkwardly on Mesprit’s comparatively small shoulder.

“Heh-hey uh, guy.” She started with an awkward laugh. Mesprit quickly shook Azelf’s head off her shoulder, but held you in front of her. “I guess I’m really good at scaring you huh?”

“Yeah, I guess so. You’re a pretty good actor too.” You joked, getting a laugh out of Azelf.

“Pfft. That’s the best you can do for an apology?” Mesprit scoffed, unimpressed. “Pretty lame of you Az.”

“Hey, I don’t think what I did was that bad. It can be fun to be scared.”

“Yeah, maybe at night around a campfire or something.”

“You guys have campfires?” You asked, thinking that if that were true, it would be the strangest thing yet you learned about the legendaries.

“Ah yeah!” Azelf confirmed excitedly. “Whenever a human is dumb enough to leave up camping stuff in my domain I snag their marshmallows. Oh! And sometimes the chocolate and those sweet crackers. Then I invite everyone over and we make those smore things you humans do! Ah, they’re super good!”

Mesprit noticed that all traces of your anxiety had disappeared, replaced by astonishment and amusement.

“Legendary Pokémon are weirder than I have ever dreamed of.”
15513112312.title: Azelf’s Tall Tale

choices: You managed to not get found and won!
Mesprit found you!
Azelf found you!
155131123121.content:
"Yeah, whatever. Now," Mesprit said, starting to poke you with one of her tails, leading you to turn around and notice that she was smirking,
"We have unfinished business to attend to, human."

Azelf's interest was piqued, while it took you a moment to realize what Mesprit was talking about.

"Ah. I guess we do," you admitted, smiling,
"But, do we... just resume? Or should we start over?"

Mesprit sighed.

"As much as I'd like to resume, I don't think that'd be fair to you... and it wouldn't be as fun. We're starting over." she announced.

Before you could reply, the gigantic head of a certain blue legendary nestled itself in between Mesprit's own head and her hands, hiding you from her sight.

"Hey, what sort of business?" Azelf questioned, her curiosity striking Mesprit; the pink-headed sibling began to try pushing her away.

"The kind that doesn't concern you, sis." she replied, pouting slightly.

You sighed.

"C'mon, Mesprit..." you muttered. She must have really hated Azelf's prank.
"It's just a game of hide 'n seek..."

Azelf turned her head to you, her eyed sparkling with excitement.

"Cool! I'm in!" she said, only for Mesprit to finally shove her aside.

"Oh no, you aren't. This is between me and the human," she said, shooting you a grin,
"Go tell someone another one of your scary stories instead."

Azelf couldn't believe it.

"Sis, are you still mad 'bout that? It was just a joke!" she complained. Then noticing you glancing at her, Azelf smiled and winked,
"But seriously, don't ever make Big Sis angry."

"... Big Sis?" you parroted back, with Mesprit sighing heavily behind you,

"Az, I keep telling you, we came out of the same egg. We hatched the same day, at the same moment."

"Yeah, but I came out first, so that makes me the oldest, no?"

"And Uxie keeps telling you that it's stupid."

You had a feeling that, if you let these two continue, they'd go on for a long while. Still, you couldn't help but smile: these legendary, they argued just like any other siblings.

It was some sight to see two of the supposedly most powerful beings in the world acting like two little girls.

"Mesprit, let's just let her play, too," you stepped in, causing the giantess to look at you,
"The more the merrier, don't you think?"

"Well said, human!" Azelf happily chimed.

Mesprit sighed.

"I... I guess... fine." she conceded; then, leaning in so that only you could hear, she whispered,
"But if I win, it'll be two cuddling sessions."

You smirked, placing a hand on the cheek of your legendary friend.

"If you win." you said, making Mesprit smirk.

"What did I say before? Don't underestimate me... or us, I guess."

That said, Mesprit hovered down to the ground, followed by a happy Azelf; emulating her sister, Azelf laid belly-down on the ground, and you were let go of in front of Mesprit's huge face... which did not look happy.

"Sorry, human, but I'm not counting to one thousand again." she informed, earning a teasing smile from Azelf. One thousand for a game of hide and seek would seem ridiculously high even to Uxie, she mused.
"We'll count up to three hundred this time. I believe that should still be plenty of time for you to hide." Mesprit continued, regaining a smile.

"Seems reasonably high. At least, more reasonable than one thousand..." Azelf teased, only to be smacked in the head by one of Mesprit's tails.

"I guess," you said with a shrug. Five whole minutes should be enough, you mused. Still...
"Um... we'll still follow the same rules as before, right?"

Mesprit placed a hand under her head.

"Yup. Now, focus on me..."

Getting the hint, you began staring at the gem in the middle of the giantess' head; only when you heard her say 'Done!' you looked away and at yourself, discovering that there wasn't any of you left to look at.

"This is dumb." Azelf pointed out, her eyes locked on the spot where you were before disappearing from sight; the powerful psychic-type could still sense you, though.
"I can still totally sense him, and I bet my left tail that you do too, sis."

Mesprit giggled.

"In fact, just like before... no powers whatsoever, sis." she informed.

"... That makes waaay more sense. "

Once both legendaries had limited their powers, Mesprit looked at you... or, where she supposed you were, since she could no longer feel you.

"In case you're still here, human, we'll start counting," she announced, sliding her hands on her eyes, which she closed; Azelf emulated her,
"Good luck!"

There was a moment of silence, which you assumed Mesprit was giving you as a headstart; then, the legendary opened her mouth to start counting... when a thought ran through her head, making her groan.

"Ugh. I swear, if Uxie shows up and he ends up fainting again, I-I'll... I'll take her emotions!"

"Ha!" Azelf laughed.

"And yours too!"

"Hey!" Azelf protested.

You had to choke back a laugh at this.

Surely, the possibility of encountering a fourth legendary, and the entire Lake Trio, in just one day was pretty low... right? You seemed to have become some sort of magnet for legendary Pokemon today...

Sighing, you shook the thought out of your head and focused back on the duo of giantesses that was in front of you, noting that they had already started counting.

With less time than you had last time, you quickly turned around and sprinted away.

You needed a place to hide. And a pretty good one, too...
155131123121.title: Rematch against the legendaries

choices: It's time for a break.
Azelf wants another round, with new rules.
Oops, you fainted again!
1551311231212.content:
Knowing that you had two legendary Pokemon looking for you spurred you to run faster than before. You were going deeper into the forest now, but nothing seemed to change. This part of the forest seemed as peaceful and bright as any other part. A product of Mesprit’s hard work, you supposed.

Running around alone in the forest like this made you think for a moment. If Mesprit hadn’t found you after Mew shrank you, was that what you would be doing? Would you be running aimlessly through the forest, trying to chase after something much larger and faster than you? Just the idea of doing that made you shudder.

But you quickly got over it. You weren’t doing this for survival, this was all part of a game. You would rather be chasing Mew with Mesprit right now, but you were happy to play along. You had to make sure you hid well, to ensure that Mesprit enjoyed her game.

- -

“Az, you’re counting too fast.”

“What? No I’m not. I’m just counting like normal, you’re just slower than me.”

“We’re not supposed to just count to three hundred, it’s supposed to be like three hundred seconds. We’re counting time, not numbers!” Mesprit elbowed her sister.

“I don’t think that’s part of the rules.”

“It’s not always. But this is my game, so we’re playing by my rules.”

“Fine, fine, I’ll start counting in seconds.”

“...”

“...”

“Um… what number are you on? I lost track.”

“...I did too.”

Azelf snickered and laughed. “Guess we have to start over. At least we don’t have to count to one thousand.”

Mesprit didn’t respond, instead opting to smack her sister again with a tail.

- -

After running as far as into the forest as you deemed necessary, you stopped to catch your breath. Looking around, you noticed that this part of the forest looked the same as everything else. So all you did was put distance between your two pursers and you.

“Well, not like there’s going to be good hiding spots in a forest anyways.”

Figuring you should at least try to hide, you look around again. The only things you saw were grass, trees, and rocks. There were some flowers scattered about, but those were probably the worst place you could choose to hide.

Either of your pursuers could idly pluck a flower off the ground while they meticulously searched for you. Mesprit would be meticulous at least. You imagined that Azelf wouldn’t be as invested in the game as Mesprit was, so she wouldn’t try as hard.

Even more of a reason to avoid the flowers, you mused. Mesprit would be super disappointed if she lost her game just because her sister happened to pluck a flower you hid under.

“Just gotta pick the tall grass or the rocks. ...Unless”

- -

Back at the starting point, the two sister’s finished counting at the same time. Mesprit uncovered and opened her eyes, immediately floating into the air and began searching the area. Azelf uncovered her eyes as well, but stayed on the ground and watched her sister search with a smile.

“Do you really think he tried to hide nearby?” She asked as she kicked her legs.

“It’s unlikely he is, but I’d rather be safe than sorry.” Mesprit said, pushing a small stone aside to look behind it.

“So what’s your plan for finding him? Once we get close enough, we should be able to sense him so-”

“You better not be cheating Azelf.” Mesprit interrupted. “If you’re properly subduing your powers, you shouldn’t be able to sense him unless you’re almost directly on top of him.”

“What’s the matter? Think I’m gonna cheat?”

“Can you blame me? I didn’t really make it clear how much you had to subdue your power.” Mesprit parted a tall growth of grass, making certain you weren’t in there.

“How do I know you’re not cheating, huh? You’ve always been a bit competitive so you could definitely try to cheat if you really wanted to.”

“As if.” Mesprit quickly breezed through a pile of leaves, scattering them around the area. “I want to enjoy this game. Cheating just to make sure I win would take all of the fun out of it.”

Azelf lazily floated into the air and stretched. Mesprit was about done checking the area, she mused, so it was time for her to start looking too.

“So, do you want to go seeking together or…”

Mesprit didn’t answer, too occupied feeling the bark of one of the forest’s trees. “Do you think the little guy can climb these trees?”

“Uh, I don’t know.” Azelf answered unhelpfully. “But if he could, I doubt he’d try it. He’d collapse from exhaustion before he got up to any branches and he’d take so long we’d find him while he’s climbing.”

“...Eh, you’re probably right.” Mesprit pushed herself away from the tree. “And no, I don’t want to go looking with you.”

“Aw, come on. It’ll be more fun if we’re together.”

“Perhaps. Or it’ll ruin the game because you’ll distract me from searching. I want to focus on the excitement of trying to find someone who’s trying to not be found. I want to sneak around this forest quietly, get down and dirty if I have to. If I’m with you, we’ll just carelessly float around and maybe casually stumble on him. I want to snatch victory! Not… stumble upon it.”

“Okay!” Azelf shrugged happily. “But you better work hard, or I’m gonna be the one to snatch victory.”

Mesprit smirked eagerly. “Oh yeah? You wanna bet on it?”

“Nope.”

Mesprit collapsed comically onto the ground, her competitive spirit completely deflated by her sister’s casual denial. Pulling herself back up, she noticed that Azelf had already left. The giantess silently pumped her fist. She was still going to win this!

- -

You groaned as your body collapsed onto the ground again. Finally getting the message that this wouldn’t work, you rested on the ground.

“Stupid tree.” You mumbled embarrassed. “I thought I could climb you a bit and get a better view but…”

You shook your head. That was a pretty dumb idea. It was unlikely that there was some hidden burrow or hole you could’ve seen and chosen to hide in. And even if there had been, going into it would be a very bad idea.

With nothing better to choose from, you crawled over to a tall patch of grass and flattened yourself on the ground. Now you could only wait.

- -


Mesprit floated excitedly through the forest. She had been searching for the little human for a while now and hadn’t found a clue of where he could be. She was confident that she could still win Azelf didn’t really care about finding the human like she did, so she wouldn’t be trying as hard.

Mesprit had to admit, having Azelf as competition did make the game more exciting. It was already fun blindly searching for the human, but knowing someone else was looking for him to made Mesprit-

Mesprit perked at the sound of some rustling leaves. She quickly turned to face the source and saw a figure quickly duck behind a tree! She immediately recognized two problems with the situation. She was able to see the figure who made the noise… and they were the same size as her.

Az, I told you that I wanted to seek separately, what are you doing here?

Knowing the jig was up, Azelf came out from behind the tree.

Man, and I was doing so well trailing you too.

What are you doing here Az? I thought we agreed to search separately?

Azelf floated down and plucked a flower off the ground, twirling it idly in her hand.

Nah. We agreed that you wanted to search alone. I didn’t say I'd respect that.

Mesprit just sighed.

You’re going to keep tailing me, even if I ask you not to, aren’t you?

Azelf silently nodded her head and continued to happily twirl her flower.

Getting the response she expected, Mesprit huffed and fell to the ground.

If you’re going to be like that, I’ll just chill here. I know you’ll get bored and-

Then there was a noise, and Mesprit instantly stopped talking. She knew that she had just heard something. And it wasn’t Azelf this time. This one was close, really close. She waited for a moment, waiting to see if she’d hear the sound again, but she didn’t.

Turning over on her stomach, Mesprit looked around. There was something around here, it had just made a noise. And the fact that it hadn’t made a noise again, gave away the fact that it was hiding.

A devious smirk spread over Mesprit’s face as she spotted a tall patch of grass.

With as much stealth as she could muster, Mesprit crawled along the ground on her stomach. This was what she was waiting for. The exhilarating chance to pounce on her quarry! She knew that the little human was in there. She just had -

With an eager shout, Mesprit lunged through the bush, grabbing hold of something she couldn't see. Filled with a sense of joy and accomplishment, she lifted into the air with her quarry hugged tightly against her chest.

Oh! Looks like you caught him!
1551311231212.title: Mesprit’s Victory

choices: "... Let's just go to sleep. We have a big day ahead of us."
"... I think I'll have a cuddle session! Get ready, human!"
Azelf interrupted,  wanting to talk about something
15513112312121.content:
Even though she couldn't see you, Mesprit could feel you squirming in her grip, trying to free yourself; the legendary's response to this was of course to tighten the already tight grip she held you in, giggling joyfully.

"Ack! Me-Mesprit!" you protested, feeling the air being slowly squeezed out of your lungs,
"Let go!"

Mesprit adopted a mischievous smile and snickered.

"As you wish." she said, opening her arms and letting you fall towards the lake!

Azelf seemed flabbergasted.

"Wait, did you just-?" she looked at an indefinite spot, trying to locate you; a hard task, given that she was still holding her powers back.

As for you, you screamed as you felt the air bellowing from below hitting your almost weightless body while gravity dragged you towards the surface of the lake.

However, you never hit the water.

Before you could hit the lake, Mesprit fluttered beneath you, who ended up landing on top of her head; the mischievous legendary giggled as she felt an enormous amount of fear coming from you.

Of course, she felt a little guilty, but as Azelf had mentioned earlier, it can be fun to be scared sometimes.

"M-Mesprit!" you yelled once you had recovered enough to allow yourself to be angry.

"Sheesh, don't get so worked up! It was just a prank!" the giantess chided playfully, picking you from her head, beginning to focus on making you visible again,
"How many times do I have to say it? I will never do anything to hurt you, human." she reassured, adopting that familiar gentle look in her golden eyes; either because she was messing with your emotions or because that look was genuinely soothing, you began feeling calmer.

However, the look on Mesprit's face was soon replaced by a grin the moment you became visible again.

"That being said, I won!" she happily said, lifting her free hand and rising two fingers; what you assumed was just a cute victory pose was, as you soon discovered, just Mesprit reminding you of what she had won,
"That's two cuddle sessions!"

You sighed.

"Aw, what is there to be sour about? Are you a sore loser?" the legendary teased.

Before you could reply, Azelf floated closer.

"Hey, what's that supposed to mean?... I did not know the winner would get a reward." she stated, puffing her cheeks out in annoyance, a pout on her face,
"I want a rematch!"

Sensing her sister's frustration, Mesprit giggled.

"Sorry, Az, I don't think that's possible." she said; then, noticing Azelf's curious expression, Mesprit motioned to the sun, which was very close to setting; looking at it as well, you were reminded how high in the sky it had been back when Mew showed up. Time literally flew by without you noticing.

"We should quit for today," Mesprit continued, putting on a more serious expression,
"While I'd like to continue too, it's getting dark, and I'm not risking the human getting lost." she said firmly. Then, as Azelf groaned her disappointment, Mesprit's face re-adopted a smile as she eyed you,
"As for you, human..."

Noticing that you were getting closer to Mesprit's face, you sighed.

"Really, Mesprit? Right now?" you asked, resigned to the fact that you were going to have to let her cuddle you. It wasn't actually bad, you guessed, but it was embarrassing, and slightly humiliating as well.

The legendary stopped, adopting a cute smile.

"No." she replied, her head moving much closer to you as she began whispering,
"I won't do anything... for now. I'd much rather enjoy cuddling you when you least expect it, savoring your desperation as I cuddle you until you can no longer breath and beg for me to stop."

You noted that you were backing away from Mesprit.

You knew she was just being playful, but that was super creepy! And... oddly specific?

"Mes-"

"Hey, what are you two whispering about?" Azelf suddenly chimed, fluttering beside her sibling.

Said sibling looked at you with a playful smirk, feeling your embarrassment as you yelled,

"Nothing!"

"Oooh, he's shy!" the blue giantess teased, grabbing a hold of you; before you had time to react, you found yourself being embraced to the chest of the legendary, who was eyeing you cheerfully,
"That's adorable!"

You blushed furiously.

"Um... Mesprit?"

The Being of Emotion shrugged.

"See? I'm not the only one who thinks you're cute." she said, though you noted her eyes glowing as she sweetly added,
"Hang on, will ya?"

That said, the pink-headed legendary darted forward, pushing Azelf with such strength that she was forced to let go of you, who hovered in mid-air, held by a psychic grip that slowly returned you to Mesprit's hands.

"Ow... sis, that hurt!" Azelf whined, rubbing her chest; then, in a teasing tone, she added,
"I mean, I get that you're jealous, but c'mon!"

Mesprit's cheeks flared up.

"I am not-"

"Starving? 'Cause I sure am!" Azelf quickly interrupted, giggling.

She knew better than to prolonging a conversation like that; she pushed Mesprit's wrong buttons, she was going to be unable to feel mad at her for what she would do.

Mesprit stared at her sister for a couple seconds, before sighing.

"Let's eat." she agreed, before looking at you,
"You have more snacks, right?"

Azelf's eyes lit at the mention.

--

"Aw man! That's exactly why I love human food, it's just so... tasty!" Azelf exclaimed contentedly, swallowing the last bite of a chocolate bar that was taken from your bag.
"I'm starting to wish Mew shrunk you around my lake!"

Mesprit, who was sitting in front of Azelf, glared,

"Azelf!"

"What? I would've protected him, too!" Azelf retorted, before looking at you, who were sitting in between the two gigantic legendaries, with a smile,
"As long as you kept giving me snacks, anyway."

You sighed, then laughed quietly to yourself.

"Well, I don't about that. You guys ate everything I had." you informed.

Azelf let out a horrified gasp; Mesprit sighed.

"And that's exactly why you need to stick with me." she said, placing her two tails in front of you and motioning you to get on, which you did; Mesprit's tails left the ground and brought you in front of the legendary's smiling face as she sat with her arms and legs crossed.

"Heh. I'm not gonna complain." you joked, making Mesprit giggle,
"So... what now? Do we go to sleep?" you asked, becoming suddenly serious as your mind settled on the task that awaited you tomorrow,
"I mean... we're going to start searching for Mew tomorrow, right?"

The giantess nodded.

"Yup. Who knows, maybe we'll be lucky enough to find her right away," she commented.

"Then I'd be so lucky I'd have a hard time believing it."

"Aw, but that'd mean we'd have to split up! And I'm having so much fun, too!" Mesprit fake whined; then, with a smile, she continued,
"But, as for now..."
15513112312121.title: Game over

choices: The night passed uneventfully
You woke up, finding Mesprit awake as well
You woke up, finding Azelf awake as well
155131123121211.content:
"Let's just go to sleep." Mesprit suggested with a sweet sparkle in her golden eyes,
"We have a big day ahead of us."

You laughed quietly, perking the interest of the giantess.

"What's so funny?"

"Nothing," you replied, still chuckling,
"I just figured you'd be up for more games, that's all."

Mesprit's smile became wider.

"Don't get me wrong, I would simply love that. I'm not even remotely sleepy - I've been asleep for so long!" she exclaimed, before declaring in an almost motherly tone,
"But, we need to get you big again, and you need your sleep, so I'm gonna have to pass."

You were surprised by how quick the change from excited kid to caring mother had been.

Mesprit sensed it and giggled quietly.

Nothing could be hidden from her: emotions always let her know the truth.

Gently, the legendary placed a hand in front of the tail you were on; you wordlessly stepped on and were successively brought up in front of the giantess' chest.

"And with you asleep, I'm going to have nothing better to do than sleeping as well." she added with a slight pout, reverting to the 'kid phase'.

It was then that a certain other legendary butted in,

"Riiight. Because protecting your lake is a real bore, eh sis?" Azelf teased, receiving a slap in the back of her head from the tail you had just left.

"Ah, I'm a splendid guardian!" Mesprit replied with a pout, which you thought was adorable,
"And you're not one to talk, Azelf. You, your lake and the Pokemon there nearly got obliterated!"

Azelf lost her smile, gaining a deep blush to replace it; on her blue face, it didn't go very unnoticed.

"... Good night."

Azelf hovered a few inches from the ground and gradually rose higher in the air... before pointing to the lake, diving underneath the surface at full speed!

You breathlessly watched the blue legendary disappear underwater, then turned to Mesprit, who smiled upon seeing your stunned expression.

"C'mon, little guy, you didn't really think we'd sleep out here, did ya? We know better than to get caught by one of your kind who decided to take a walk around here and happened to stumble into me... us." she playfully chided, hovering in the air herself. Then, she started giggling,
"If you'd like some advice, human, hold your breath."

You looked at her, then glanced at the lake. Then back at her, back at the lake: it was getting closer. Back at Mesprit, back at the lake; it was Mesprit who was getting closer to the surface.

Your heart filled itself with terror - no no no, this wasn't going to happen, she wouldn't-!

Before you even registered it, Mesprit rose far higher than Azelf had done before. Had it been solely her, it wouldn't be necessary, but her little passenger couldn't breathe very well underwater. Or, more specifically, he couldn't breathe at all.

She needed speed.

A wave of terror coming from the human hit her, causing her to smirk.

"Don't worry, this'll be over before you can even say... well, not like you'll be able to say anything, really." she giggled.

Your skin adopted a very unhealthy shade of white.

Too terrified to even speak, firmly held in Mesprit's hand, you could only watch as the legendary darted downwards, towards the lake.

She dove.

You didn't even feel the impact with the water; you just felt the cool breeze getting replaced by cold water.

Sadly, you hadn't had any time to hold your breath like Mesprit suggested.

Luckily for you, as soon as it began, it ended; the legendary swam at crazy speed beneath her lake, deeper and deeper, until she reached the bottom, and by extension, her destination: a large underwater cavern, which she entered without hesitation.

Mysteriously, the inside had no water, and was filled with breathable air instead. That, and a certain blue legendary who was laying on the floor, still awake and apparently waiting.

"Weren't you going to sleep?" Mesprit questioned as she hovered closer to her sibling, who looked at her, deadpan.

"I was just worried you might drown the human, Mes."

"Yeah, right." the Being of Emotion huffed,
"He's fine."

You were definitely not fine; pale, soaked to the bone and still utterly terrified, you were greedily refilling your lungs with air.

It took you a while before you were finally able to express your disappointment by yelling at Mesprit to never do such thing again.

Adorable.

The pink-headed legendary just giggled.

"Sorry. I just thought you may have appreciated a bath." she replied innocently,
"I'll just carry you in my mouth when we get back up in the morning."

What little color your face had regained drained again.

Azelf frowned.

"Sis stop. You're traumatizing him." she spoke; Mesprit, who had begun petting you in a comforting manner, removed her gaze from you to shoot her sister a glare.

"Said the Pokemon who made him faint when she first met him," she recalled,
"And the Pokemon who told that stupid story to scare him."

"That was an accident," Azelf promptly replied,
"And stories don't drown people, y'know."

Mesprit was about to retort, but was interrupted when she heard you sigh.

"Can we just go to sleep, please?" you begged.

The mix of still fresh fear and annoyance Mesprit felt from you made her smile sweetly, reassuringly.

"You're right. Sorry, little guy," she apologized in a cute manner, bringing you to her cheek for an unofficial round of cuddling; after a minute or two, she felt that you had calmed down, though the annoyance remained, mixed this time with embarrassment.

Mesprit giggled.

"I'd say we put you through enough stuff for today." she said sweetly,
"Let's get you to bed."

Your 'bed', as you found out a couple minutes later, was located in between the two titanesses, and it was made using two tails, one from each of the legendary, intertwined with one another.

Apparently, the two sisters thought it would be cute; you were honestly so tired that you couldn't bring yourself to care.

The moment you laid down, you closed your eyes and fell asleep almost immediately.
155131123121211.title: Night beneath Lake Verity

choices: You two successfully steal some food.
The guard Pokemon finds you!
Mesprit is outside, and she’s angry!
1551311231212113.content:
Some time later, you begin to slowly wake up from your comfortable slumber. Being wrapped in the two legendaries’ tails was surprisingly comfortable. Even though you were in an underwater cavern with hardly anything separating you from the cold floor, you still managed to stay warm. Perhaps your "bed" was being heated by the two who wrapped you up in the first place?

The comforting warmth somehow encouraged you to wake up rather than fall back asleep. For some reason the cavern wasn’t illuminated like it was when you first arrived. You could hardly see anything. From some undistinguishable direction, you could hear the sound of gently cascading water. All there was to see was a gentle darkness.

And two strikingly golden eyes staring right at you!

Surprise, with a large hint of terror, coursed through your body! But you were unable to gasp, shout, or even jolt in surprise. Your emotions were perfectly normal, but your body didn’t seem to have the energy or will to move!

Wait a second… the will to move.

“Aze…” As soon as you begin to whisper the legendary’s name, your vocal cords simply give up.

A different, more invasive warmth washes over your body. As the new sensation enveloped your body, you noticed your eyes were adjusting to the dark. Except they were adjusting a little too well. Everything was pitch black before, but now everything was illuminated like there was a star-filled night sky overhead. It was still dark, but there was no way this was natural.

Figuring you knew who did this, you look back at Azelf to see her holding a finger in front of her lips. The message was obvious; shush.

“Human, don’t wake up Mesprit okay? I want you to think what you want to say, not actually say it.” She instructed you.

Verbally you sighed, a bit irritated with how having to use just your thoughts to communicate. You imagine it will be difficult.

“It won’t be hard, just try.”

You glared at Azelf, making her smile and giggle.

“Sorry! This will be kind of hard for both of us.”

“Please tell me that you’re helping me see in the dark and I’m not mutating or something.”

“Huh. Not what I expected. I thought you’d be like ‘Okay. What do you want?’.” Azelf did a poor imitation of you. “But yes, I am helping you see. You are not mutating.”

“Okay, good. Now what do you want?”

Azelf brought her finger down from her face and smirked.

“You and I have a mission.” She said vaguely.

“I need more details than that. Actually, can I just say no right away?” You snarked.

“Aw, come on! This is important and I’m trying to be inclusive. I could do this without you, but I want you to come along. You’re a vital source of information.” Azelf suddenly adopted a serious expression.

Seeing Azelf’s serious expression made you concerned for a moment. The entire time you’ve known her she’d never made such a serious expression. Except for when she was trying to scare you, but the way she was talking didn’t sound the same. You decided… what was the harm of helping out.

“Alright, what’s our mission?”

Azelf held her serious expression for a bit longer before it melted into an adorable giggle.

“I’ll tell you when we get outside. But I’ll have to put you in mouth because I have to move quietly. So you might be stuck in there for a while, sorry!”

You felt a psychic grip take hold of you and Azelf’s tail removed itself you. Before you could protest, Azelf lifted you towards her and opened her mouth. Her humid breath washed over you as you passed into her maw. She set you down on her tongue gently and closed her mouth, trapping you in its strangely comfortable warmth.

“Azelf, do you really have to do this? Can’t you just hold me?” You grumbled, figuring that Mesprit couldn’t hear you from within her sister’s mouth.

“Yeah, I sort of do. I don’t want my little buddy to drown.” Azelf noted cutely. “And don’t worry, I won’t swallow you. Human food tastes good, but humans… not so much.”

Silence settled between you two as Azelf made her way to the entrance of the underwater cavern.

“Do you want to know how I know humans don’t taste good?” She asked suspiciously.

“Azelf, I’m not getting fooled again. You got me the first time, but you aren’t going to fool me easily again. Plus, asking that makes you sound super suspicious.”

Azelf huffed, blasting you with a bit of her breath.

“Okay, fine. You won’t hear any more scary stories from me. It’s probably best for us to focus on our mission anyways.”

Nodding in agreement, you remained quiet as Azelf dove into the waters of Lake Verity once again. You wondered what sort of mission Azelf had for the two of you.

-

Back on the shores of Lake Verity, Azelf stretched her arms and looked around for a certain object. Realizing she should let you out, the thought of pretending to swallow you briefly entered her head before disappearing. You wouldn’t fall for it, and she couldn’t get a laugh out of your fear like Mesprit could. So she simply spat you out into her waiting paws.

Getting released from Azelf’s mouth was, thankfully, very simple. You landed safely and without too much movement in Azelf’s paws. You immediately noticed that your ability to see in the dark had been restored, and that you were completely dry. Which made you pretty happy, being coated in a Pokemon’s saliva hardly seemed any fun.

Unfortunately, there was a problem that immediately grabbed your attention.

“Holy-! It’s cold out here!” You groaned.

“Yep.” Azelf agreed cheerfully. “It’s like the middle of the night so it gets pretty cold. I’d imagine it’s extra bad for someone your size.”

“Can’t you… help me with that? I mean you can make me see in the dark, so surely you can warm me up.”

Azelf, who was searching for something else rather than looking at you, spoke, “Well… I could, but I need that as leverage to make a deal with you.”

“Can’t you just help me? It’s too late for me to say no to your mission.”

Azelf smiled, still keeping her eyes off you.

“Oh, you catch on quick. Don’t worry, I won’t let you freeze. I’m just giving you a choice to be manageably warm, or nice and cozy.”

“Azelf, just tell me what you want.”

“Okay. So right now… all around me is a nice cozy aura of warmth. It’s not on my hands because… reasons.” Azelf giggled awkwardly, “I could give some of it to you and hold you away from me, but it won’t be as warm that way and-”

“Are you saying you want to cuddle?” You interrupt the legendary, shocked.

“Well… yeah, that’s totally what I want. It’s okay if you’re embarrassed, it’ll just be a warm hug for now. I don’t want to make you nerv-”

“What is up with you, Mesprit, and cuddling?” You interrupt again. “Am I like, cursed by Mew to have Pokémon want to cuddle me?”

Azelf snickered quietly, though you were still able to hear it.

“What’s so funny?”

“Oh nothing. It’s just hearing you say that made me think of another legendary I know. A certain wish granter who pretends to be granting people’s wishes but really-”

“Is this another one of your stories?”

“Jeeze.” Azelf rolled her eyes and finally looked at you. “Would you quit interrupting me?”

“Oh! Um… sorry. I guess I just, I mean you’re-”

Getting a taste of your own medicine, Azelf interrupts you with a sharp, “Hey!”.

Before you could jump out of your skin, Azelf paws rushed to her chest, bringing you with them. The moment you were softly embraced into the legendary’s chest, you felt the biting cold get replaced by a comforting warmth. The pleasant warmth was only challenged by the red of your embarrassed cheeks.

“It’s okay, I was just messin’ with you.” Azelf finished her sentence.

“Azelf! You startled me! That’s not cool!”

“Hm, neither is cuddling you.” Azelf deflected your protests, “Don’t really see why Mesprit seems to like it so much. You’re enjoying it though, so I’ll keep doing it I guess.”

You felt your blush get worse. Did it look like you were enjoying this? It certainly felt nice to be cuddled by these legendaries, especially when it helped you escape the cold, but you didn't want to look like some pet.

"It's just that you feel really warm is all." You insisted defensively, "Now what's this mission you want my help with? What information could I possibly give a legendary?"

"You are going to be my shopping list."

"Your... shopping list?" You ask, very confused. "Wait, what are you doing with my bag?"

You just noticed your bag getting levitated behind the legendary, who simply giggled excitedly.

"There's a town nearby with a lot of stores. I bet one of them has lots of tasty human food in it, and you can give me suggestions for new stuff to try!" Azelf sounded pumped.

"So we're going to steal some food?"

"It's for a good cause. You don't want to be munching on berries all the time right? Right. Let's go!"
1551311231212113.title: An Adventure with Azelf

choices: Mesprit begrudgingly agreed to come along
Mesprit refused, but let you go with Azelf anyway
Mesprit refused and took you back!
15513112312121133.content:
You crossed your arms, smirking.

"You do know that lots of the food we humans make contain berries, right?" you informed Azelf, imagining her reaction; Azelf, who was already getting ready to fly away from Lake Verity and most likely to Twinleaf Town, halted to stare down at you, trying to determine if you were lying or not.

She decided you were not, and her look became one of amazement.

"... Really?"

You nodded your head. Azelf's eyes began sparkling.

"And... do you know how to make food with them?" she asked with a little bit of anxiety in her voice, nearly beginning to drool at the thought.

She looked like a kid with no money staring at candy from outside the shop, which was why you felt slightly bad when you had to tell her that you weren't that good of a chef.

"And plus, even if I knew how to 'make food with them', I still wouldn't be able to cook at this size." you explained to a horrified Azelf.

"Aw, man..." she whined dejectedly. She retrieved her cheerfulness almost immediately though,
"Oh well! We can still steal the food though!"

You stared at her with the same amazement she had been staring at you with earlier - was she just faking being sad? You didn't think so, what a fast change of mood! And you couldn't believe how casual she could be about stealing!

You sighed, figuring that Azelf couldn't care much about buying things. She was a Legendary, a Lake Guardian, could speak human language perfectly, but she was ultimately a Pokemon.

And Pokemon weren't really used to pay for their meals.

"Whatever." you gave in, the giantess cuddling you to her chest starting to move again,
"Wait."

"Oh, you've gotta be-" Azelf paused, stopped and looked at you; the annoyance on her face was real this time,
"Dude, we're never going to get this done!"

You smiled.

"The night is still young, Azelf," you replied, surprising yourself discovering that you didn't mind the idea of stealing as much as you would have, were you normal-sized. You had one doubt though,
"I just wanted to know why you wanted to bring me along."

The blue giantess let her head hang to the side.

"Weren't you listening before? I want you to be my shopping list." she repeated. You saw quieting down, before opening her mouth again and hesitate: even in the dark you could see her cheeks growing red with embarrassment,
"And... my sister's been with you for longer than me, so I... just wanted to spend a little time with ya, too." she admitted.

You stared at her for a few moments, then smiled.

Suddenly, you enjoyed being cuddled a lot more.

"Okay," you said,
"Let's do this."

Azelf too smiled again as she began moving... only to stop once more, this time on her own.

She had just felt an enormous amount of power coming from the lake; what she said next wasn't something you expected to come out of a Lake Guardian's mouth,

"Ah, crap..."

With a mighty roar, the water of the lake behind the legendary exploded into an enormous splash as a second legendary revealed herself.

Mesprit was furious and, the moment she laid eyes on her sister, a second roar erupted, this time from her mouth.

"AZE-" the scream was interrupted as Mesprit suddenly hung her arms; below her, Azelf huffed, holding you a little bit more tightly against her chest.

"Before physically assaulting me, care to let me explain?" she spoke.

Mesprit looked at her sister, irritated, feeling like doing just as Azelf suggested, but also feeling like doing absolutely nothing.

"... Didn't we promise we'd never use our powers on each other?" she replied with another question.

"Pft. Because we've totally kept that promise, didn't we sis?" Azelf replied sarcastically,
"And I've had enough of being smacked for today, thank you."

You watched in silence as the two legendaries argued.

Mesprit suddenly found herself able to move again and, albeit still quite angry, she forcibly calmed down. Too bad she couldn't use her powers on herself, though she mentally noted to use them on Azelf in the near future, next time she annoyed her.

Azelf's sister floated down, arms crossed, until she was hovering right in front of her; Mesprit briefly looked at you, her gaze becoming much softer for a moment, before she looked back at her sibling.

"Okay, explain." she said, holding out an arm,
"Explain to me what you're doing out here in the middle of the night with the human!"

Azelf explained herself in just a minute, but it was enough to make Mesprit's mouth hang open; you were still very surprised by how casual she could be about stealing.

"Let me get this right - you were bringing the human to steal food from that town nearby!?"

Azelf nodded her head.

"Yup." she confirmed,
"Now, if you'll excuse us, we'll be on our way. You don't want to eat berries for our whole journey, right?"

Mesprit looked away.

"Well, no b- wait, what journey?"

Azelf blinked.

"The one to find Mew to help the human, duh."

Mesprit's mouth hung open once more. Then, feeling gratitude emanating from you, she looked at you, noticing you staring at her sister with a huge smile.

You had more than one reason to feel happy.

Azelf had just proclaimed she'd come along, too! That meant Mew would practically forced to give you back your size!

"Thanks, Azelf!" you exclaimed happily, causing the giant legendary to look at you, smiling.

"Aw, don't mention it. Did you really think I'd abandon you? Ha!" she replied, moving her hands to bring you to her cheek, beginning to nuzzle you,
"Though, if you really want to thank me, you're seriously gonna have to help me get food."

You gave her cheek a hug.

"Of course."

Mesprit watched the scene without talking.

Her sister... her sister would come along... the fun she would've had with the human, cut in half.

And plus, they had the nerve to cuddle right in front of her!

Just as she was about to voice her disappointment, Azelf looked at her and said,

"Well, since we're all here... why don't you come too, sis?"
15513112312121133.title: Interrupted adventure

choices: You two shop uninterrupted.
Mesprit shows up after all. What could she want?
The guard Pokémon finds Azelf while you're shopping!
155131123121211332.content:
“I’m not gonna waste my time stealing food like you two!” Mesprit responded sharply. “I have to be rested if I’m going to track Mew. Helping the human isn’t a game, Az, I’m taking this seriously.”

Azelf looked at her sister skeptically.

“Weren’t you the one playing a game with him when I got here?” She asked. “And don’t try to act like you’re so above this. You’re the worst of the three of us with just having to eat berries all the time!”

“Nu-uh! You’re the one that steals humans’ food when they leave it out at night near your lake!”

"Hey, they’re on my property so that’s fair game. Besides, leaving food out just attracts other wild, potentially dangerous, Pokémon.”

“Hmm! Whatever, just get the food quickly. I don’t want the human up too late and being tired for the trip.” Mesprit noted, suddenly not caring about her sister’s future theft.

“Of course I won’t take long. Humans who own stores always come in early before sunrise so I gotta work quick anyways, right?” Azelf finished her sentence by looking down at you.

There was a brief silence before you realized Azelf’s question was directed towards you.

“Oh! Um, yeah, I guess. Everything around here is kind of slow though, so store owners probably won’t open for a while.”

Mesprit focused on you intently as you spoke, but didn’t hear a word you said. Instead, she was bitterly contemplating the fact that Azelf was joining you two on her hunt for Mew. Why did she have to come along? Now Mew would think that she needed Azelf’s help to find her. Which wasn’t going to be the case! She’d find Mew so fast the pink puffball’s head would spin. Plus, now that Mesprit couldn’t have you all to herself, she had no reason to slack off and play.

“I’m going back to sleep.” Mesprit huffed, lowering herself into the water. “You better be back quick! And no playing without me!” Realizing what she had just said, Mesprit quickly ducked most of her head under the lake, trying to hide her embarrassed blush.

Thankfully for her, you didn’t seem to notice and Azelf had her thoughts on other things.

“Alright, we’ll be back soon. Did you want me to pick up anything for you?” She asked casually.

“No, I don’t want you stealing for me.”

“Are you sure? I don’t want to hear you complaining about what I got later.”

“Yes, I’m sure. Get going already!”

“Are you certain that you’re sure?” Azelf asked, surprisingly not joking around.

“Yes, I am certain that I am sure! ...Just don’t get anything spicy.” Mesprit muttered quickly

“Knew it.” Azelf smiled. “Okay, I won’t get anything spicy. See you later!”

With that out of the way, Azelf turned her back to Mesprit and flew off with you hugged against her chest. Your bag floated behind you two, getting dragged along with the legendary’s psychic powers. Mesprit watched you two from the water for a while before submerging and heading back to the cavern.

“I shouldn’t have said anything.” Mesprit thought as she swam, “Now she’s definitely going to bring back something spicy.”

- - -

“So, why shouldn’t I get anything from behind doors inside the store? I don’t really get it.” Azelf said, genuinely confused.

Hearing Azelf’s confusion made you smile. “You don’t want to take any of those because that stuff is frozen. They’re kept behind doors so they can stay cool. If you took them out, they’d melt before the sun rises.” You explained to her like you were talking to a child.

“Oooooh, I get it! If the food melts, it won’t be any good.” The legendary concluded proudly. “...But I could eat some tonight while we’re shopping…”

Hearing this made you chuckle. Would having something sweet keep Azelf up all night? Probably not, but the way she was acting made you think that it was possible. You still couldn’t believe that you were going to steal food with a legendary Pokémon! Part of you felt bad for stealing food, but most of you didn’t really care. After all, Azelf was the one actually stealing the food. You were just going to give some suggestions and enjoy whatever she took with her.

“Okay, we’re almost there. Are you ready?” Azelf asked, lifting you up in front of her face.

“Yep, I don’t really know what sort of food you like, so I’ll help you avoid bringing back anything spicy for Mesprit.”

“Okay.” Azelf nodded. “But, just so you know, I love sweet stuff. So tell me about anything super sweet so I can grab it!”

“Heh, I will.”

“Cool. Now, be quiet for a sec, I gotta be careful getting inside.” Azelf said as she hugged you against herself once more.

Listening to Azelf’s request, you decide to play along and keep quiet for now. You were still hugged comfortably against the friendly Pokémon’s chest, so you had no reason to complain. Looking out into the night, you realize that Azelf had taken you to Sandgem town. That made sense, you supposed. Your home town of Twinleaf was pretty small and didn’t have a convenience store. Sandgem was also where you occasionally go shopping.

In a startlingly display of speed, Azelf floated down into the small town. As you two rapidly descended, you felt a vaguely familiar tingly sensation washing over your body. Your magical night vision didn’t seem to change, so you assumed that Azelf had just made the two of you invisible. After you two landed into the town, Azelf remained silent but playfully ruffled your hair with a paw. You indignantly tried to shake the offending appendage off, but you were only freed when Azelf was done.

Azelf floated through the streets of Sandgem for some time, moving slowly and looking around carefully. You were surprised to see the usually excitable legendary acting so cautious. It made sense that she was being careful, you supposed. A legendary Pokémon being seen casually floating through a town would cause quite a bit of gossip. You figured that none of the lake trio would want to draw attention to themselves. Especially in a town that hosted a lab owned by a man as serious as Professor Rowan.

Eventually, Azelf gasped happily and turned a corner, bringing you along with her. She had finally found a store that held all of the coveted human food. From what you could tell, it was just a medium sized convenience store. It was plenty big enough to give Azelf a plethora of choices to satisfy her hunger and curiosity.

“Ooooh. That’s a big one.” You heard Azelf’s voice in your head.

At first you thought Azelf was talking about the store. But, after looking more closely, you realized that there was a figure by the store. Laying on the ground outside was a large Luxray, apparently the store’s vigilant guardian.

“What’s the matter?” You sent your thoughts to the legendary. “Scared?”

“Scared? Ha. That’s cute coming from you.” Azelf ruffled your head again. “I just didn’t expect such a big guard Pokémon in such a small town. Not that it really matters. Now let’s go inside!”

Not waiting for your response, Azelf casually floated forward. Even though you had just teased Azelf about being scared of the Luxray, you got really nervous as you floated towards the giant electric type. Imagining being caught by a Pokémon like that at your current size, made your heart skip a beat. Mesprit and Azelf were both really sweet and, more importantly, could communicate with you. Luxray on the other hand… well, there was a reason their natural ability was Intimidate.

Thankfully, Azelf’s lack of concern was justified as you two floated effortlessly over the sleeping electric Pokémon. You flinched briefly as Azelf continued to float towards the window, but relaxed the moment you two harmlessly phased through it. Straining your neck slightly to look to the left, you noticed that your bag had also been brought inside.

“Okay, we’re in.” You said out loud. “So what kind of stuff did you have in mind?”

The only answer you got was silence.

“Azelf?” You tilted your head up to look at your current guardian. The legendary had an absolutely mesmerized look on her face.

“Oh my- wow! There’s so much food in here!” Azelf laughed joyfully, hugging you a bit more tightly. “There’s gotta be so much good stuff in here! Let’s get shopping! I bet you’ll have a ton of good suggestions!”
155131123121211332.title: A Trip to the Store

choices: Azelf got back to the lake without issues
The guard Pokemon woke up as Azelf was leaving!
1551311231212113321.content:
You shuddered slightly.

"Keep it down!" you chided in a whisper,
"There's a guard Pokemon sleeping out there remember?"

Azelf shot you a smug look.

"Yeah, and?" she spoke with a smile,
"You worry too much. If the Pokemon out there does wake up, I'll just knock 'em out. It's that simple,"

"Bully." you muttered, causing the legendary giantess to look at you with an amused smile.

"Hey, I could do worse, y'know. Like when-"

"'You won’t hear any more scary stories from me', eh Azelf?" you reminded her in a poor imitation of the legendary, who pouted, but quickly lost her upset expression as she giggled.
"You're right, I forgot." she admitted.

You smiled, extremely grateful that she was so friendly; you doubted many legendaries would accept being teased by humans.

"Anyway, we're wasting time. Come on, we just gotta grab some food and then get out." she said with a serious expression that didn't really fit her character. Still, it was adorable.

"Alright," you replied, still hardly believing you were really going through with this,
"Lots of sweet stuff, right?"

At the perspective, Azelf's expression faded instantly as she nodded her head ecstatically.

"Come on, tell me where to go." she ordered.

You nodded your head.

"First off, look around. You should be able to find snacks somewhere," you instructed. Azelf gave a small nod and, with your bag following her around like a loyal Lillipup, she began hovering around; she silently fluttered among various kinds of Pokemon items, Pokeballs and generic stuff until she finally stopped when she found the food section.

"Here we are," you murmured, able to see in the dark thanks to Azelf's aid. With gleaming eyes, the blue giantess looked around, carefully studying the various foods, looking around for anything sweet.

"Yummy..." you heard her whispering dreamily. You wouldn't be surprised if she started drooling all of a sudden; expectantly, the golden-eyed legendary shifted her gaze onto you,
"Okay, this is where you come in, buddy. What do I grab?"

You looked around as well and sighed. Were you really going to have eat sweets for as long as you were tiny?

"Great, I'm gonna be small and fat..." you mumbled to yourself, finally meeting Azelf's gaze,
"Let's start with something not sweet, okay? I don't wanna eat sweets all the time."

Azelf looked horrified.

"But why wouldn't you want that!?"

Jeez, she was just like a little kid.

"It's not healthy." you simply replied. The giantess contemplated you for a couple moments, then shrugged,
"Whatever. You can just eat berries with Mesprit." she said; the look you sent her made the legendary sigh,
"Fine. Jeez, I was just joking, don't look at me like that!" she complained, looking away from you, moving her gaze to her surroundings,
"So, what do I have to grab for you?"

Grateful, you sent her smile.

--

Some time later, the bag was nearly filled with food and, mercifully, not all of it were sweets... which still took a good percentage, though.

Azelf was on an entirely different line of thinking.

"Um, there's still some space left.
That means we can grab more things!" she happily chimed, her gaze going from the bag's contents to you,
"So, what do you suggest, shopping list?" she chuckled.

"Don't call me that!" you protested indignantly with the sole effect of making Azelf laugh harder, consequently making you even more indignant.

With a sigh, you looked around, scanning the shelves, trying to find something that Azelf hadn't already taken and stuffed within the bag... and, by the way, she wasn't kidding about the marshmallows earlier: she had really grabbed two bags of them, along of course with sweet crackers and chocolate.

"You're taking to long." Azel scolded,
"We need to get out of here before the sunrise, remember? Or rather, before even that."

"Pft, we weren't in here that long, Azelf," you retorted, still scanning your surroundings, until your eyes finally fell on some plastic bags containing brown objects. You stared at them in silence, surprised; Azelf noticed and, following your gaze, she spotted the bags as well.

"What are these?" she asked, fluttering closer to get a better look.

"Lava Cookies..." you murmured, impressed,
"They're a Hoenn treat. I didn't think I'd ever find any in Sinnoh."

"Are they good?" the legendary holding you in her embrace asked curiously.

You smiled.

"Why don't you see for yourself?... Just, don't leave traces, okay?"

Azelf nodded quietly and suddenly let go of you; you hovered in the air, held by a Psychic grasp as she casually grabbed a cookie and carefully ripped the plastic from around it before giving a bite.

Almost immediately, Azelf's eyes began sparkling and, just as quickly, the cookie was gone, embarked on a one-way journey to the gluttonous legendary's stomach.

"That was great!" she squealed, satisfied, tossing the empty wrapper in your bag, before proceeding to do the same with a bunch of cookies.

"Okay, I think that's enough," you commented, seeing how the bag was now filled.
"For now," Azelf added happily, grabbing a hold of you once,
"You're a wonderful shopping list." she praised, ruffling your hair once more.

"Stop calling me that." you repeated as you were once again trapped in her warm embrace.

The legendary sent you a smile.

"Let's get out of here."
1551311231212113321.title: Azelf's heist

choices: Uxie tried to convince Mesprit to let her find Mew right away
Uxie decided she'd help Mesprit and you find Mew
You woke up, interrupting the two
1551311232.content:
The disturbance Mesprit felt... this much power, she was sure she knew who it belonged to.

In fact, upon reaching the location where she sensed you were, Mesprit wasn't very surprised to find...

"U-Uxie?"

It was, in fact, Mesprit's yellow-headed sibling; on her paw, the tiny victim of Mew Mesprit had found before. But what caused the legendary's heart to start racing was seeing Uxie with her eyes open as she examined the small human.

Upon noticing her sibling, Uxie rose her head, her eyelids closing to hide her eyes, carefully avoiding making eye contact. She didn't want to erase anyone's memories by mistake, but hers was such an interesting find that she felt the need to examine it better; the little human had fainted, anyway, so there was no real danger... unless, of course, he didn't wake up all of a sudden and happened to look at Uxie right in the eyes.

But then, she got interrupted.

"Hello, Mesprit." she greeted with a wave of her free paw. Then, she noticed the expression on Mesprit's face,
"Um... is something bothering you?"

Mesprit was, in fact, staring daggers at her.

"Uxie, what have you done to this human!?" she yelled angrily, causing a startled Uxie to float back.

"I-I did absolutely nothing!" she defended, rising her free paw,
"He was already this small, I simply sensed him and picked him up," she explained, calming down a little,
"This small one lost consciousness the moment he saw me, I assume out of surprise or fear... and he was concealing his appearance, for some reason. I turned him back."

Mesprit listened, then huffed loudly.

"I already knew two of those things." she revealed, annoyed
"But why erase his memories?"

Uxie tilted her head, confused. Then, she remembered she had been staring at the unconscious human with her eyes open.

"I did no such thing." she calmly explained,
"He had already fainted when I picked him up. I was merely taking a better look at him."

Mesprit knew that her sister wasn't one to use her power on random humans for no apparent reason, yet she still felt the need to check; a quick scan of Uxie's emotions revealed no guilt, shame or nervousness whatsoever.

Upon realizing that she had been jumping to conclusions, Mesprit blushed.

"... Sorry sis." she meekly apologized.

"It's alright." Uxie replied, hovering closer to her pink-headed sibling, holding you up,
"Now, you mentioned that you were aware of this unnaturally tiny human, correct?"

Mesprit rose her head and nodded, gently picking your unconscious self from Uxie's hands.

"Yeah," she replied, wondering how much fear you must have felt to lose consciousness; she would have certainly felt it too, if she wasn't limiting her powers back then,
"I'm actually taking care of him." she admitted.

"... What?"

Mesprit pouted, remembering what she was doing before Uxie showed up. And she had almost finished counting, too! All that effort had been a complete waste of her time!

"Aw, we were in the middle of game, and you ruined it!" she complained. Then, Mesprit remembered herself wondering why Uxie was here, so far from her own lake,
"... Why are you even here, Ux?"

It was Uxie's turn to blush as she floated back, her fingers clasping together.

Admittedly, Mesprit wasn't the only one to jump to conclusions, sometimes.

"Well... I sensed that you were awake and thought I'd come to check..." she explained.

Mesprit felt an indescribable amount of embarrassment coming from her sister.

"... You totally thought I was under attack or something, didn't you?"

"What!? No!" Uxie exclaimed, looking to the side, her blush extending,
"But I did think that your awakening was kind of sudden..." she murmured.

Mesprit giggled.

Uxie decided that this was a good moment to move on.

"Now, it's my turn to ask questions," she spoke, floating closer to her sibling, pointing a finger to you,
"What does it mean that you are taking care of this human? Why is he so small?"

Mesprit sighed, holding out a paw, gesturing for Uxie to follow as she began floating back to Lake Verity with you on her hand.

"I don't know all the details myself, since I was asleep, " she began explaining,
"But, it was Mew who did this. She shrunk this human to this size."

"... Mew?" Uxie parroted back, perplexed,
"Why would Mew be here?"

"Sis, I just told you I have no idea!" Mesprit retorted,
"According to what the human said, Mew just appeared and shrunk him. It was some sort of prank or challenge... at least, it's what we believe."

Uxie halted in mid-air.

"But, that's... unacceptable!" she yelled all of a sudden; Mesprit sensed a certain level of irritation growing within her and couldn't stop herself from giggling. Uxie had always been terrible at hiding her emotions.
"We're supposed to lay low, and she just... goes ahead and plays pranks on humans! It's like she doesn't even care about the consequences!"

Mesprit became serious all of a sudden, remembering feeling a similar level of frustration when she heard your tale straight for you. Her reasons, however, were entirely different.

"Not only that," she chimed, frowning,
"Who does she think she is, pranking people 'round my lake?"

Uxie didn't reply, and for several seconds she remained in silence; then, she spoke,

"... I'm going to locate her, then we can solve this-"

"No, wait!" Mesprit interrupted, placing her free hand on Uxie's shoulder.

It was a mystery how you were able to sleep throughout the entire conversation.
