"I promised this human I'd help him find Mew, and that's exactly what I'm going to do," Mesprit said, adopting a determined smile, just like before,
"However, just like I told this human... I'll let Mew roam free for the next day. Then, I'll start chasing her."

Uxie was perplexed.

"... Why?" was the only thing she could utter.

Mesprit's grin became almost creepy.

"Because, it'll be more challenging this way." she bluntly admitted.

Uxie became silent once more.

She didn't even know where to start. So, she chose a physical way to show how she was feeling: her open palm met her forehead.

"... That sounds exactly like the kind of selfish thing you'd do." she said in the end, causing her pink-headed sibling to pout.

"Think what you like." Mesprit simply replied, turning her back to Uxie, grumbling to herself,
"You try to have a little fun and suddenly you're selfish."

Uxie sighed and shook her head.

"Oh, sis..."
1551311232.title: Misunderstood meeting

choices: Go find your partner.
Try to find a nearby trainer.
Head straight for Rustboro.
1552.content:
Still reeling from what had just transpired, you couldn’t believe how rotten your luck had become! Not too long ago, you earned your first gym badge with the help of your only partner. After that, you got to spend a few relaxing days in Rustboro city to celebrate your first win.

Roxanne, Rustboro’s gym leader, was even kind enough to let you attend a few of her advanced courses at the Pokemon school. The courses you attended were all about the Hoen region’s gym leaders. Who they were, what types they used, and what cities they all lived in. She even briefly discussed the time of years all the gym leaders were always taking time off. With all of that extra information, you thought you could have planned out a pretty good journey.

But all of those good results and generosity were wasted because of your unfortunate encounter with a legendary Pokemon. And that wasn’t something you ever thought would be considered unfortunate. Most people would kill for a chance to meet a legendary Pokemon, let alone get some pictures with one. Then again, they didn’t know that meeting a legendary apparently ended with them being shrunk and challenged to find the same ultra rare Pokemon again.

You let out an angry huff of breath, trying to calm yourself down a bit. There was no use in being angry right now. Well, there was a good reason for your anger, but it was pointless to dwell on it. It wouldn’t help you find Mew, and it could distract you so much that you wouldn’t even notice any danger before it struck. You had to focus on what you should do.

A bit calmer now, you take some time to go over what you knew.

Right now you were on the outskirts of Rustboro city, near the large lake that acted as a sort of gate to the city. You remember how cool the extensive walkway over the lake seemed when you first came to Rustboro; and that double battle that you managed to win with only your one partner.

Speaking of your partner, you recalled they told you they were going to stay by the shore of the lake while you slept. You briefly wondered if having your partner with you might have stopped this from happening. Maybe Mew wouldn’t have been as eager to play with you if you had them with you. It’s not like your partner could necessarily fight off Mew, but you assumed Mew wouldn’t like being seen by any sort of group. She probably preferred individuals so she could do stuff like she did to you.

You couldn’t remember anything else especially important about where you were. You had no reason to count how many people were around before you fell asleep. But, you guessed it was safe to say that there was no one too close by. Otherwise, they would have spotted Mew and scared her away. Of course, someone could have shown up by now without you knowing. The grass around you was so tall that it prevented you from seeing very far away. So being concerned about other people right now was pretty much irrelevant.

The same thing went for wild Pokemon. If one found you without your partner, you probably had no choice but to deal with it yourself. But there was even less of a chance for you to see a wild Pokemon before it found you. So neither of those things were something you had to consider.

All you could do was decide between going to find your partner or going back to Rustboror. Both options had their pros, cons, and dangers.

Going back to Rustboro was probably immediately safer, but the long term danger was greater. You believed the city was slightly closer to you than the lake. That was good because you’d be out in the wild less and less likely to run into a wild Pokemon. You were also more generally visible in a city than tucked away in grass.

The problem was that you had no idea who you should go to for help there. The only person that came to mind was Roxanne, who had been exceptionally nice to you. She probably would be a big help, but the problem was getting to her. The only places you knew she could be were her gym and the school, which were both far inside the city. Getting to either of them would mean having to get past a lot of people and who knows what else.

Which led you to your other option of going to the lake and finding your partner. You knew that you could one hundred percent trust your partner to help you, and they were a lot closer than the gym and school! Yet… that meant you had to be out in the wild for longer. The chances of running into a wild Pokemon was a lot higher and the limited vision was very worrying.

You could try to find a trainer wandering around nearby. Their presence would probably scare away or at least distract any wild Pokemon. But they could also miss you completely and crush you by accident. Then again, avoiding being crushed by one person would be a lot easier than avoiding an entire city full of people.

It was a tough decision, but you had to choose quickly...
1552.title: Alone in Open Space

choices: Mawile is incredibly concerned.
Mawile is just confused.
Mawile seems… rather smug?
15521.content:
Even though you had spent a long time sorting out your options and going over how difficult of a decision this would be, you made your choice pretty quickly. The moment you thought about making a decision, only one of your options seemed to be the right one. Finding your Pokemon partner just felt like the best choice.

“Guess I didn’t have to waste time thinking things over.” You manage to laugh, in spite of your grim situation.

You start walking in a direction before stopping dead in your tracks. You had to make sure that you were actually heading towards the lake. The “tall” grass was still cutting off most of your view, so you couldn’t really see for yourself. There wasn’t an easy way to figure that out, so you just had to try something to improve your chances.

After a moment of thought you come up with an idea. You quickly wet your finger and try holding it up high in the air, hoping you could feel the direction of the wind. Just as quickly as you brought it up, you brought your finger down and shook it dry. Figuring out what direction the wind was blowing was pointless. The two things didn’t have any correlation and wouldn’t help you find the lake.

Maybe you could try to smell for it? Like the ocean?

No, the lake didn’t really have a distinct smell. You were just desperate for a way to guarantee that you would go to the lake. But, you didn’t have a way to make sure so you just had to take a chance. So with a sigh you start heading, you assumed, south.

“It’s alright, once I get to her, everything will be fine.” You tried to assure yourself.

Hanging on to whatever confidence you could muster, you kept moving forward. Even though you were doing your best to stay calm, you were constantly on edge. The grass around you encumbered your vision a lot more than you were comfortable with. Every time you moved to push aside more grass, it felt like your heart stopped. At any moment you could part the grass and come face to face with a wild Pokemon, which could easily be the end of you.

You knew that a Pokemon could always wander up and find you, but you weren’t as worried about that. If that could happen, you’d probably hear it rustling the grass before you found it… or it found you. At least then you’d have some way to avoid it or at least be prepared to face a giant Pokemon. Even if ending up in the gullet of a Tailow or some other Pokemon was inevitable, you would prefer for it to not be a sudden surprise.Of course you could also get poisoned to death or paralyzed by a giant Shroomish.

You weren’t a fan of the grim thoughts you were having, but they were the only things that popped into your head right now. At any moment something you didn’t notice could pop out and-

Parting another tuft of grass, you instinctively scream when you see something unfamiliar. Your scream quickly dies out though, since what you saw was actually good. You had found the lake! And what’s more, you could see your partner too!

“Ha, I knew I’d be fine the whole time.” You lie to yourself. “Nothing can catch me by surprise.”

You are immediately proven wrong as a Zigzagoon comes zooming out of some of the tall grass nearby, causing you to scream and fall. Thankfully the creature hadn’t noticed you and simply ran off somewhere, but you still felt the sting of embarrassment.

“Agh. ...I just gotta get Mawile’s attention and then I won’t have to worry anymore.” You mumble, scratching at your head.

You had never been so happy to see Mawile before. Even though she was still far away from you, just seeing her made everything feel alright. She was your faithful partner, and you had known her for awhile before you two even started the gym challenge.

You two didn’t have some sappy story about how she hatched from an egg that you raised since you were a kid. In fact, you two started out on less than stellar standings. She was a Pokemon with a bit of a reputation around your hometown. A feisty Mawile with a little scar on her left ear who was way too eager to fight. It wasn’t uncommon for the people working outside to find KOed Pokemon because of her.

She was just as willing to mess with humans as she was wild Pokemon. She stole stuff from the local market a lot and would sometimes go around town checking to see if people’s homes were locked. They always were, but everyone guessed that Mawile probably would have stolen from any place that wasn’t.

People from outside of town were some of the most frequent victims. It became a monthly bet for the whole town: how many travelers would show up without their backpack or luggage because of her? She was a regular old trouble maker, but she was also good enough to become your partner.

You happened to be a frequent victim of hers. She never really harmed a human, at least not too much, but she was still able to take stuff from you a lot. Mostly food, which you never felt too bad about losing. But sometimes she’d take something a bit more important like a coat or an umbrella, that kind of bothered you. But she was so intimidating you just couldn’t stop yourself from giving her what she wanted. You heard that some Pokemon had that sort of ability “Intimidate” or something like that. Mawile’s ability must’ve been “Intimidate EX” you used to think.

One day though, all of that caught up to her. She must have stolen one to many backpacks or something, because a bunch of Pokemon hunters showed up at your home town. Well… hunters sounds worse than what they were. They were just a special division of Pokemon rangers who dealt with troublesome Pokemon. You always thought they were meant for natural disasters, not a local bully.

Anyways, the rangers ended up making short work of her. A few days after they showed up, Mawile was in town under ranger supervision. The first time they got her, they put her in a big cage so they could report back to their headquarters. But she ended up escaping by pulling some of the bars apart; the cage was meant for much bigger Pokemon after all. But they snatched her again real quick, put her in handcuffs; which looked strangely hilarious; and kept her under supervision.

A couple of days later, everyone in town was told that Mawile was going to be shipped away. She had caused enough trouble in the area and was going to be relocated somewhere more open with a lower population count. She would only be kept in town one more day for a checkup at the Pokemon Center, which was open for people to watch for some reason.

Strangely, you felt compelled to go and see Mawile off for the last time. She had never been that bad, so you sort of liked her... in a vitriolic way. You watched her whole check up, done by the rangers’ own doctor instead of the local nurse. You were surprised when she actually behaved the whole time. But you realized quickly that it was because she seemed depressed. Her usual fire was replaced by bored submission.

For some reason that hit you hard.

Not really sure what you were thinking, you ended up talking to the Pokemon rangers that night. You discussed the possibility of you… becoming Mawile’s trainer. They were blunt and asked why you would want that. You simply said that you felt attached to her. The rangers laughed, but agreed to let you ask if she’d be your partner. They also made you sign a waiver, saying that you would be responsible for Mawile’s misbehavior from now on. It might’ve been meant to scare you away, but it didn’t work.

It all ended up working out. Mawile became a real, genuinely great partner. She caused minor amounts of trouble at first, and you two always butted heads, but you and her ended up enjoying each other’s company. She’s dropped her overall aggression and no longer openly steals things. You could still remember how she reacted when you asked her to be your partner. She was-

“M-Mawile?”

Huh?

Just like that, you were woken from your dream-like reminiscing state. Towering in front of you was the partner who’s past you had been happily thinking about. She looked down at you with an almost unreadable expression, though you could see a bit of confusion.

Honestly, you were a bit confused as well. Had you really already made your way over to Mawile.Last time you looked the walk out in the open should have taken you a while. But, apparently, you did the whole thing while fondly thinking about the past!

“H-hey Mawile.” You call up to her awkwardly. “It’s me… your partner. Ahaha, I sort of just wandered up to you like this without realizing.” You spoke, unsure what to say right now.

Mawile’s mouth closed and opened again, still processing what she was looking at. Without saying anything, she gently grabbed you in one of her hands and raised you off the ground. She continued to stare at you silently, struggling to make any progress in understanding.

As you two stare at each other for a while, you slowly begin to recognize a change in her expression. Soon, you were able to figure out what exactly Mawile was feeling.
15521.title: The Past of a Partner

choices: Mawile decides to relax.
A trainer appears, thinking Mawile is wild.
Some Pokemon appear and cause trouble.
155213.content:
Very quickly, Mawile’s unreadable expression of confusion turned into a look of smug amusement. Coyly, she put a hand under her chin and muttered her name under her breath. Apparently, Mawile was entertained by your little predicament rather than concerned. Part of you totally expected this, Mawile and you did have a sort of vitriolic relationship, even as partner and trainer. But, even though it was hard to spot, you could still see a gleam of concern in Mawile’s eyes that made it clear you were safe with her.

“Hey Boss, you look different. Did you change something while you were gone?” Mawile asked sarcastically.

“You are totally enjoying this, aren’t you?” You ask Mawile with a laugh.

Mawile shook her free hand slightly.

“Just a little huh?” You say skeptically. “Then why are you trying not to laugh?”

“Mawile?” The giantess asked, a corner of her mouth clearly twitching upward.

“I can’t always understand what you’re saying, but I can read your expressions. Just admit that you like this.”

“Well… it’s not exactly something I’ll complain about.” Mawile let her poorly hidden smile make itself known.

“I knew it. I just hope you don’t enjoy this too much.”

“I’ll try not to look as pleased as I really am all the time.”

Realizing it would probably be better for you, Mawile let go of her grip around you and left you standing on her open palm. She chuckled at the sight, but it quickly became a resigned sigh.

“Maw… Mawile, wile?” Your partner seemed curious.

“You want to know what happened to me? Well, I’m glad to see some outward concern for once.” You smile slyly.

Mawile gave you a serious look and used her free hand to flick you in the arm. You knew that she was trying to be gentle, but the hit still stung. But, all she was trying to do was tell you to be serious, so you couldn’t be mad.

“Okay, I’ll be serious. This might sound a little weird, but it's the truth and you’ll have to believe me. Got it?”

Mawile nodded her head and uttered her name quietly.

“Good. Now, it didn’t happen that long ago. I was minding my own business when…”

- - - - - -

“And the last thing I did was come back here to get your attention.” You concluded your explanation. You went over everything that happened before you met with Mawile. There wasn’t that much to tell, but you did your best to remember everything because any of it could be important.

Mawile, for her part, remained quiet and serious the whole time. Though she sort of smiled when you told her you had taken selfies with the legendary Pokémon. Other than that, she was completely attentive and you noticed her fingers occasionally curling closer to you. You wanted to assume that it was her naturally reacting protectively, but considering her you also could chalk it up to just a bit of nerves.

Noticing you were finished, Mawile sighed wearily. “So that pink puff ball did this to you? Why couldn’t she have gotten someone other than Boss?”

You noticed Mawile thinking to herself and speak up. “Hey, Mawile!”

The giant Pokemon quickly turned to look at you again. “Mawile?”

“Sorry to interrupt your thoughts, but I just wanted your attention on me.”

Mawile just gave you a confused look, her scarred ear drooping slightly. “Wile?”

“Uh… I don’t really have a reason I guess. I just feel like anything could happen to me. I’m just paranoid that a Taillow or something will gobble me out of your hand.”

Mawile’s fingers curled closer again but went back to normal almost instantly. Your partner looked at you warmly, a confident smile on her face. Muttering her name, she raised her other hand and clenched it into a fist. You recognized the message instantly. Mawile would beat the crap out of anyone who even tried to touch you.

Embarrassed, you scratch your cheek with a finger and laugh. “That’s… really good to hear Mawile, thanks.”

Mawile let her fist loosen and confidently leaned back. “Did you expect anything else from me?”

“Just one thing…” You begin seriously, making Mawile look concerned.

“Let’s make sure you don’t beat up the people trying to help me.” You smiled slyly at your giant partner.

“Maw!” Mawile groaned and rolled her eyes.

Things were almost like normal between you two.
155213.title: A Smug Partner

choices: Plusle and Minun run away!
Plusle and Minun try to take you back!
A trainer comes by everyone!
1552133.content:
While you and Mawile discussed what you should do next and bantered, two figures watched you from the shadows of the trees nearby. The pair looked at Mawile with mystified and amused expressions.

“Hey, you’re seeing what I’m seeing, right?” One figure asked.

“Of course I am but… I can’t believe it! That is the Mawile we know, right?”

“Yep, with that scar on her ear and the way she holds herself , it’s obvious. Now, do you see what she's holding?”

“Um…”The shadowy figured leaned forward. “I can’t make it out very well but it looks like a doll. It’s super small though.”

“Ha! A doll!” The other figure spoke, astounded. “I would never believe it if I wasn't seeing it as we spoke.”

“Yeah, me neither.”

“You know what I’m thinking, right?”

“Yeah I am. But… are you sure? That could end pretty badly.”

“Ah we’ll be fine! Are you ready? We cannot miss this chance!” The shadowy figure bounced with anticipation.

“Yeah, why not?” The other agreed casually. “We’ll probably regret this later but what the heck.”

- - -

“Alright Mawile, now we need to figure out what to do next.” You told her once you stopped laughing.

“Mawile.” Your partner said simply, pointing to Rustboro with the thumb of her free hand.

“Exactly. Now the first thing I thought of was going to the Pokémon Center. But then I thought what about Rox-aaaaaaahhhh!”

Before you could even register what happened, you felt something grab hold of your leg and start carrying you through the air. Whatever it was that grabbed you was incredibly fast, so much so that the world around you whipped by in a blur. Your only dangers were getting sick and whiplash.

- - -

Mawile was focusing intently on you as you stood on her paw, too preoccupied with figuring out what to do next to make fun of you right now. One moment you were talking to her and the next, something snatched you out of her paw! And another thing tried to push her over! All it managed to do was nudge her a little but whatever it was quickly followed the thing that had taken you.

“Hey!” Mawile shouted, sounding more irritated than angry. “What’s the big idea!? Give him back to me before I kick your-”

Realizing that the two figures hadn’t stopped running, Mawile stopped talking and instead ran after the duo.

“When I get you two, you’re gonna wish you pissed off a herd of Tauros instead of me!”

- - -

After who knows how long of being violently shaken by whatever had grabbed you, everything finally stopped moving. Stopped moving physically at least. Your head, which was miraculously still attached to the rest of your body, was still spinning.

Thankfully, whatever had grabbed you wasn’t running anymore and they seemed to have settled into a spot. Things kept getting better as you stopped being held by just your leg and were gripped firmly but relatively gently between what felt like two paws. As long as you weren’t about to be thrown down a Pokémon’s gullet, things were marginally improving for you.

Since you weren’t getting tossed down a gullet, your head was slowly able to recover until the headache and blurry vision went away. You desperately wanted to rub your eyes, but the paws held your arms tightly at your side.

Understandably nervous, but well aware that you would have to eventually, you looked at whatever had just kidnapped you. To your surprise, you hadn’t been taken by one Pokémon, but a team of two! Even more surprising, you actually recognized these two troublemakers!

Believe it or not, your hometown had more troublemaking Pokémon than just Mawile. You had problems remembering all of them, but Plusle and Minun were two that you remembered very distinctly. After all, they were by far the most ‘popular’ of your town’s resident Pokémon.

These two were a very different type of troublemaker than Mawile was. They didn’t threaten to beat people up and try to establish themselves as the tough ones. They simply couldn’t. They didn’t sneak around town, testing doors to see if they were unlocked, or trying to take stuff from street stalls. They didn’t have to. Plusle and Minun didn’t try to make trouble. They just were trouble.

They were, for lack of a better term, brats. The two of them were adorable, and the town loved them for that. And Plusle and Minun were well aware of that. So they used their cuteness to get things, whatever they wanted. They always got free food, even though they were wild Pokémon who would never pay back the person in any way. People would knit or craft them cute stuff that they’d wear for a while before it disappeared forever. The two of them were given more stuff than most wild Pokémon would even dream of.

Mawile took stuff, Plusle and Minun were given stuff and expected to keep receiving more.

Admittedly, this was all mostly harmless. It wasn’t that different from how many people treated their Snubbull, Furfrou, or other stereotypically spoiled Pokémon. But those cases were usually one person spoiling one Pokémon. Plusle and Minun were being spoiled by a whole town. So the two of them were… less cute when someone was alone with them.

You were well aware of that. You always seemed to end up alone with them.

At first, the two of them would still act cute like they always did. But since they were used to being adored by so many people, your attention alone usually wasn’t enough. You always had something ready for them, especially after meeting them alone became a normal thing, but they were never satisfied. Give them a bit of petting and nice words, and they’ll quickly get bored and skamper off… or start going through your bag while it’s still on your back. You try to give them a gift, like a blanket or something, and they’ll look it over. If they like it, they’ll treat it like any other gift, use it for a bit and then throw it out. If they don’t like it, one would distract you by acting appreciative while the other threw it away somewhere.

The only thing that consistently made them happy was sweets. They enjoyed getting any kind of treat, even simple things like sweet berries. They couldn’t always be bothered to be super appreciative, but it kept them under control. Even that didn’t please them forever, they expected you to mix up the variety of gifts after all. And if you had a few visits without anything… they’d give you a shock and be on their way.

They didn’t have as much of an impact as Mawile did, but they were just as troublesome as she was. To you they were, at least. Especially now that they were giant enough to whip you around like a rag doll while running from Mawile!

You were going to call to them and ask why they had taken you, or why they had left your hometown in the first place, but you were when the two of them and you were rocked by a massive tremor!

- - -

“You two rats get down here, or I’ll punch this tree down!” Mawile shouted up to the two Pokémon after leaving a noticeable crack in the tree’s stump.

“As if!” Plusle said tauntingly from above. “And if you try punching this tree down, we’ll just hop to the next one. There’s plenty to chose from.”

Minun, the one who was holding you snickered mischievously.

Mawile clenched a fist angrily and glared at the duo. “Give him back to me. If you play nice, I’ll let you walk away without consequence. The rest of that town ain’t here to keep you safe.”

“Oh, I’m so scared. That’d be a lot more threatening coming from a Pokémon who didn’t play with dolls.”

Plusle and Minun both pulled an eye down and stuck out their tongues.

“I don’t have a stinkin’ doll! You just stole my trainer, and you do not mess with the boss while I’m around!” Mawile wasn’t shouting anymore, but anyone who understood her could hear the threatening undertone of her voice.

“Ha! Don’t lie to us. A human that small? Don’t be ridiculous! You’re just mad we’re playing with your toy.”

Knowing how to play along, Minun held you out in front of her face, using one paw to hold an arm each. Tauntingly, she started swaying you back and forth and rocking you up and down. Which made you very uncomfortable and embarrassed.

“Q-quit that! You’re gonna hurt ‘im.”

"Aww, don't be sad. We'll give you your doll back once we're-"

"Gah!" Minun's screaming interrupted Plusle's taunting, just in time for her to see you dropping from the tree branches.

"Minun, what are you doing? We could've taunted her more and-"

"T-that wasn't a doll!" Minun muttered, shocked and sounding a little guilty. "I-it was her trainer. The guy who always tried to give us stuff and... and I just dropped him!"

Anxiously, the pair got on their knees and looked over the edge of the large branch. Both their hearts raced with anticipation and dread, Minun's going much faster than Plusle's.

To their relief, you had been safely caught by Mawile below... who looked really angry.

"You... idiots! I'm going to destroy you! I'm gonna make all of you red, Plusle! And when I'm done with you Minun, you'll be black and blue instead of white and blue!"

"Um... I'm more of a cream." Minun pointed out meekly.
1552133.title: Add Some Trouble, Subtract the Peace

choices: Umbreon suggested they carried you to Town to figure something out
Espeon suggested they chased Mew. Perhaps she was still nearby!
Both seemed just as clueless as you were...
1553.content:
You sat there in absolute disbelief for a while, your mind trying to process what had just happened: a Mew, an extremely rare and powerful, not-for-nothing legendary Pokemon showed up and things led to this, to you being shrunken down while the legendary left you be.

What were you even supposed to do now? You were completely powerless to stop anything that fate decided to throw your way! Heck, you couldn't even see past these blades of grass you were surrounded by!

And worst of all, you were alone...

You perked up at the last thought, which you discarded as incorrect: you weren't exactly alone, you reminded yourself as a small wave of relief washed over you.

You remembered your two Pokemon come with you, and they just happened to hate being confined in their Pokeballs, which was why you kept them out all the time; they weren't around back when Mew showed up and shrunk you, but they must have been nearby.

So, without hesitation, you decided to go find them to get their attention and, possibly, help. You were sure they'd help you; after all, both were especially fond of you.

'They've got to be...' you thought to yourself as you traveled through the forest of grass, trying to find a way out.

"Come on, come on..." you mumbled, pushing blade after blade out of the way so that you could pass, wondering where your partners were.

Hopefully, you would find them before the sun set; you had recently met and challenged Morty, the gym leader of Ecruteak Town; in a conversation with him after you won, he told you that ghost-type Pokemon had a tendency to show themselves around town at night.

After that conversation, you tried to avoid move during nighttime. Unlike one of your Pokemon, but she could handle ghosts by herself without issue, you thought with sudden pride.

You snapped back to reality - you had to focus.

Luckily, as you pushed away a few more blades of grass, you noted that you had finally managed to get out of the patch of grass you were in. And not too far, much to your relief, were your loyal Pokemon, seemingly sleeping next to each other.

Just seeing their figures took you back in time: finding an Eevee was somewhat rare, but finding two at the same time proved that you were particularly... well, maybe more than you had been now.

You had captured them both, making them your partners in battle, and you always did your best to treat them as well as you could; in return, they did their best in battle and never complained about how they were treated.

Over the time, they both became very attached to you; so much in fact that one of them eventually evolved into an Espeon one day.

The only Eevee you had left was pretty envious, but you comforted her, telling that she would evolve at some point as well, though, when you said that, you never expected it to happen that same night, when your other Eevee evolved into Umbreon.

The evolution of your two Eevee made you feel joyous. Not because they grew stronger, faster and tougher, but because Eevee only evolved into Espeon or Umbreon when they were extremely happy, and that proved that your two former Eevee truly loved you.

You let out a somewhat nostalgic sigh, before shaking your head to rid it of such thoughts: this was no time to lose yourself in the past.

You began moving again and hastily made your way to Umbreon, who was napping with her head in her paws and her tail hanging. She liked sleeping during the day, but became very active during the dark hours.

No wonder, given her type.

She also became very serious ever since she evolved, though she still cared deeply about you, and that was why you chose to head to her; Espeon, despite caring for you as well, was much more playful than her dark-type counterpart was when it came to you.

Moving swiftly, you positioned yourself right in front of Umbreon's muzzle, feeling her warm breath blowing from her nostrils and into you.

"Umbreon! Wake up!" you called, getting no reply.

You tried several more times, until you eventually saw her ears twitching and Umbreon herself rising her head.

The black-furred giantess turned to the side to let out a deep yawn, before pointing her red eyes in front of her.

Immediately, Umbreon became alert as she saw you standing before her at two inches or less tall.

"U-Umb?"

You smiled nervously.

"Hey, Umbreon..."

"Um, umbreon!?" she exclaimed in confusion.

You sighed, easily figuring out what she was asking, and began explaining; when you finished telling her about your encounter with Mew, Umbreon turned to the still sleeping Espeon.

"Espy, wake up!" she called, getting no reply, which triggered Umbreon to drive her hind left leg into the psychic-type's side.

You weren't surprised, the two of them always had some kind of rivalry, especially since they evolved.

"Ow!" Espeon yelled as she rose, fully awake, shooting Umbreon a glare,
"What's the big idea!?"

In response, Umbreon pointed her paw to you,
"Um."

Following Umbreon's paw, Espeon gazed down and spotted you, adopting the same look of confusion and shock the dark-type had when she first discovered you.

"Esp, espeon!?"

Once more you sighed and once more you began telling about your encounter with Mew.

At the end of your tale, Espeon looked at you skeptically.

"Seriously? Are you sure you didn't just hit your head when you laid down?" she said smugly.

"How do you explain his size then?" Umbreon chimed in, leading Espeon to sigh,
"I can't." she admitted.

Umbreon smirked briefly, before returning serious.

"Well, we certainly can't leave him like that."

"And here I though I was the psychic." Espeon sneered, causing Umbreon to sigh,
"Espy, this is serious! We've got to do something!" she chided.
"What are we supposed to do?" the psychic-type retorted, before looking down in disappointment,
"I'm... I'm not even sure I could grow him again: my Psychic is no match against Mew's..."

This led Umbreon to look down as well.

In the meantime, while the two behemoths chatted among themselves, you watched them saying their own names over and over while trying to think of something.

But what could you even do?

You couldn't figure anything out, but you certainly couldn't stay here forever...

Feeling observed, you suddenly looked up: Espeon and Umbreon were staring at you.

You wondered if, perhaps, the two had thought of something.
1553.title: Light and Dark

choices: You told them to enter the cave. Might as well check inside
You told them to move on. Mew probably wasn't in there, anyway
Just then, Espeon sensed something. Mew, perhaps?
15532.content:
"So? What do you think we should do?" you wondered.

Umbreon sighed.

"Um, umbreon." she cried, sounding resigned. Espeon glared her way,
"Espeon!" she chided, her volume far too high for your sensible hearing to bear; you shuddered.

You didn't know what your two faithful Pokemon were telling each other, but Umbreon suddenly looked hesitant.

"... U-Um?"

Espeon nodded, before she looked back down at you; after a moment, you began hearing a familiar voice speaking within your mind,

'We need to find Mew.'

You flinched upon hearing Espeon's voice in your head as she spoke to you through telepathy; she had done it many times ever since she evolved. You recalled having jumped the first time she developed the skill, deciding to use you as a test dummy.

"Easier said than done, Espeon..." you muttered.

"That's not the only issue," Umbreon chimed, earning a look from Espeon,
"Mew's infinitely stronger than we are. Even if we did find her, what could we do? Kneel and beg?"

Espeon sighed. Both you and Umbreon had solid points.

"Then, what do you suggest, Umbreon?" she asked.

The dark-type glanced down, remaining silent for a moment.

There must have been something to do, something that could help you that didn't imply hunting Mew down. Sadly, if that something existed, Umbreon had no idea what it was.

"I don't know..." she eventually admitted, sighing deeply, before looking at you in a concerned manner; a small smile, a rare expression for Umbreon, appeared on her face,
"Um, umbre," she spoke in a comforting manner.

'We're gonna help you, someway,' Espeon helpfully translated, before growing a smile herself. Okay, perhaps she was guilty of having been somewhat mischievous to you in the past, even as an Eevee, but she still cared a great deal about you.

You only had the time to smile back, before Espeon's tail reached you, coiling around your waist and lifting you off the ground and up to the psychic-type's head, where you were dropped ankle-deep in a sea of silky purple fur.

You were glad you had your Pokemon on your side; they were going to help, no matter what. You quickly became serious again though, there would be plenty of time to be thankful later, when you were hopefully back to your original stature.

"Thanks, girls," you said, looking in between the dark-type and the psychic-type, before your gaze ultimately settled on the latter,
"So, have you got a plan? 'Cause I certainly don't." you said in a dejected tone.

Espeon looked up.

'Well, yeah... well, it's more of an idea,' she replied telepathically,
'We're going to try Mew around here."

That didn't sound like a plan at all, though you refrained yourself from pointing that out.

"... And if she's not?" you said out loud.

Espeon quieted down, suggesting that she had no idea; Umbreon hastily placed a paw onto her shoulder,

"We'll think of something." she barked, causing Espeon to look at her and nod.
"Right. Now, let's go."

With that being said, both Pokemon began moving, trotting alongside each other... in a completely random direction.

"W-Wait!" you shouted from Espeon's head, causing both to halt and look at you,
"Do you even know what direction Mew took?"

At the same moment, both giantesses blushed brightly.

You sighed.

"That way." you told, pointing a finger in the direction Mew previously took. Obediently, Espeon and Umbreon began moving in that direction; they silently agreed that none of them was ever going to speak about this.

While moving moderately fast, Espeon tried to sense any trace of psychic powers with her own psychic; sadly, she couldn't feel anything, which either meant Mew wasn't around or she was pretty good at concealing her presence, both of which sounded pretty plausible.

In the meantime, you were wondering how much ahead Mew was; she could fly, so that meant she had a huge headstart.

At this point, you began doubting you were really going to find her, even with the aid of your two Pokemon.

You sighed.

"How'd I even get myself into this...?" you murmured to yourself. However, the sentence didn't go unheard.

'Don't worry. We're going to find Mew. You're going back to normal, one way or another...' Espeon spoke to you.

Despite the situation, you smiled.

"Yeah... thanks."

Despite the situation, Espeon smirked.

'Oh, don't worry. There'll be plenty of time for you to thank me later.' she said.

You shoot a look at Umbreon; judging from her expression, she wasn't far from Espeon's thought process.

"Yes, Espeon. Most definitely."

--

Hours passed, yet the search was unfruitful: Mew was nowhere to be found, and not even Espeon's sharp psychic was of any help.

The sun was still high, but it wouldn't be long before it disappeared over the horizon. You gave it another hour or two without consulting your PokeGear.

"Um, breon," Umbreon spoke at some point, suggesting a small break.

Espeon registered the suggestion, but didn't listen, her eyes fixed on something ahead.

Following her gaze, Umbreon noted what her fellow teammate was staring at: a cave just beside the road.

"Umbreon, do you think...?"

"It's possible."

"Hey, what's the matter?" you butted in, noting your Pokemon acting strange; in response, Umbreon pointed her paw to the cave the two were staring at.

"I think I've read of that place on the map. Mt. Mortar or something..." you declared.

It took you a couple moments to understand what Espeon and Umbreon were thinking about.

"... You two think Mew's in there?" you asked.

A nod from both of them was your answer, before they moved their gaze from the cave to you.

"What do we do, Boss?" Umbreon asked.

Espeon instinctively shook her head, before looking at Umbreon.

"... 'Boss'? Since when you call him 'Boss'?"

Espeon was promptly ignored and looked at her own head again.

You could tell that both were awaiting orders.
15532.title: Legend hunting

155321.author_name: Just here for the poke story
choices: She says something
She changes the size of one or both your pokemon
Something else
155321.content:
"We've come this far we should check it out."

They both nodded.

As all of you entered the cave, Espeon clapped her paws together.

"I can feel her! Mews here!.... She's strong." It was rare for Espeon to be nervous.

"Stay on guard!"

"We'll try to avoid a fight, hopefully if I catch up to Mew and ask nicely, Mew will decide the game is over." Though deep down you had a feeling it wouldn't be that easy, but you had to cling onto some hope.

Espeon and Umbreon ran quickly. though it would be hard to match Mew's pace flying. Hopefully Mew either wasn't going as fast as she could, or was taking time to stop and look at the scenery, How long did she intend to keep this game going?

"The signal's getting stronger! We're getting close!"

Was Mew letting you catch up or had she been distracted? You felt excited yet nervous.


"Mew!" You called out "Mew are you there?"

All you got in response was childish giggling.

"That's her!"

Espeon and Umbreon redoubled themselves, now running as fast they could


Your pokemon weaved through the twists and turns of the cave. After several floors and a long flight of stairs up, both you're pokemon stop and pant.

"Huff... huff... I wish I was a flying type."

"Huff.. me to."

Espeon's tail suddenly spikes up and she rears back, forcing you to cling on tight to avoid being thrown off.

"She's here! Mew's here!"

Espeon ran a few, before slumping back down. Umbreon came along and all of you stopped and gasped, seeing a bright pink aura, then to you, the enormous Mew.

"Mew mew!"

"What's she saying?"

"She's congratulating you for catching up to her."

"Mew Mew?"

"Translation?"

" "oh you can understand what I'm saying?" "

"Oh hey a fellow Pyschic!" For some reason Mew actually spoke that. You had no idea how her mind worked, maybe this was part of the game. As annoyed as you were by this, you dare not risk angering her further. You drop down on your knees.

"Mighty mew, Me and my companions have travelled long and far to find you. I hope I have completed your challenge and I ask that you restore my normal size so I may some independence again."

She floats higher in the air, looking down at all of you. Your pokemon look nervous, and umbreon moves near to you. Mew seems like shes giving it some serious thought
155321.title: You told them to enter the cave. Might as well ...

choices: A Wild Pokemon comes and gets you!
You make it to the town (Santalune City)
A trainer comes over you, wanting to battle
A trainer comes over you, wanting to keep you
You make it to a castle? (Battle Chatau)
1554.content:
In retrospect, maybe you should of done something instead of just watching the legendary fly away. You wanted to respect it, since it was being friendly and playful. You’ve heard tales of Mew, and to be honest... you could of taken her.

If your first move was to whip out your Pokeball and challenge her, you could of beaten and then captured Mew.

You were after all, one of the best trainers in the world. You’ve travelled the land with your Pokemon. All of them being top level defeating Gym Leaders and Elite Fours everywhere you went. You have travelled to every region, and your Pokemon reflected on that strength.

Right now you were in Kalos, trying to catch a Flabebe. You’ve heard of their sizes, and you were interested in. Guess you were about that size right now.

You went into a sitting position, looking at the new world. You really should of tried catching her.

Wait... maybe you still can. Your Flygon, it’s a fast Pokemon! Of course it should be able to catch up to Mew.

With a smile you found that your Pokeball shrunk with you, so you unlatch it from your belt and you begin to toss it.

“Flygon, come on out!” You shout to your Pokemon. However, another problem rose.

Your Pokemon shrunk too!” Flygon was a big Pokemon, but now it was nothing but an insect compared to everything else.

Flygon looked around for a couple of seconds, as it was confused and you felt bad.

“Flygon, I... return!” You say panicking. How strong would your Pokemon be now. It’s like they all have been reversed Dynamaxed. This is not good, and you imagine it will be the same with all your Pokemon!
 Your Dusknoir, your Tyranitar, Your Nidoqueen. Every Pokemon of yours would be so weak!

So chasing Mew it out of the option, as she has crippled your team. Might as well go over and try to get back to town. Will not be that hard, considering you didn’t go out too far. Not wanting to paralyse your Pokemon, you want to keep them i your Pokeball until you have to bring them out. Looking ahead though, you could see a Flabebe.

It was taller then you, and it didn’t even notice you. That is a major problem.

You walk out of the tall grass, walking over to the dirt path as it seemed to stretch on for years. How small can you really be! You were not happy about this, but there was nothing you could really do anymore!

Just walk down the path, until you see anything.

“Swirl!” A Pokemon said getting you to freeze. You turn your head, seeing a Swirlix near you, and even worse it was making it’s way to you.

It was such a little Pokemon, but the giant Kalos region Pokemon intimidated you more then it should. Not like you were gonna just let it come near. A bit concerned you brought out a Pokeball.

“E-Electivire, go!” You shout, sending your strongest electric type. As he landed onto the ground, he was shrunk and was looking at a giant ball of a Pokemon. Towering over him as he was intimidated. Electivire was never intimidated!

Didn’t help that the giant Swirlix had it’s tongue out and was wagging it around a bit playfully. It is gonna try to eat your Pokemon.

“Electivire!” You shout to him. “Ignore the size difference, just use Thunder!”

He listened, sending a powerful lightning blast. One so powerful that normal size it could take down a Wailord in one hit, at this size though.

It struck Swirlix, and it didn’t care at all! This first evolution, which hasn’t been trained is tanking Electivire’s most powerful attack. This is not good. Your eyes wide open as you start to get concerned. The Swirlix moved forward, and you acted quick.

“R-Return Electivire!” You shout and return him to the Pokeball, just in time for the Pokemon to stomp it’s foot down where your Pokemon would of been. Retreating your Pokemon as you look to the Pokemon with new fear. It was literally invincible, at least to you!

When you were big, you had company with Red and Cynthia, at this size though. You couldn’t even beat a bug catcher! You had to run, running away from the Pokemon as you try to get away. You turned your head, seeing if you were gonna get any reaction from the Pokemon.

The Swirlix looked at you, and went along it’s day. It wasn’t even bothering with you, that’s how insignificant you are.

Regardless, you were taking it. Making your way across as you breathed a sigh of relief.

What the hell are you gonna do?

-

You just kept walking down the street, just kept walking without much interest. You were small, and your Pokemon was useless. You just keep trying to talk to yourself, trying to convince that you were not truly useless. Maybe that Swirlix had an ability that helped it resist Electivire, or maybe it was a much higher level than you thought. Anything that can convince you that maybe it wasn’t so bad.

So you walk around and try to get around, down the road. It was an empty road, with the lake on one side, and tall grass on the other. You would eventually see a Pokemon, but you made sure not to dwell on that and even increase your speed to get away.

You don’t want to get another encounter like that Swirlix. That Swirlix... it was so weak. Any other way, you would of beaten it but not hear. Worst thing is, you don’t even know what a Human would look like, and how they would treat you.

You were so small, if they wanted they could kidnap you. Not like your Pokemon will be able to save you.

It was a sad notion to think about. Eventually you walked down the road some more until _______________
1554.title: Not The Very Best Anymore

choices: You somehow win! She keeps her promise
You lose, you are her pet now.
You win, and she gets angry. However another girl saves you
15543.content:
https://i.pinimg.com/originals/e9/c6/3a/...

Eventually you walked around, until finally you heard some sounds behind. You were so close to the city, you ignored what was happening behind you and just kept on walking. This turned out to be a major problem, cause something was behind you. At least it wasn’t a Pokemon you suppose.

As you walk forward, the booms keep getting louder and louder until finally you saw a giant shoe slam to your side. You freaked out and jumped, falling to the side as you could not believe it. That shoe was matched with another one on the other side, stepping down next to you.

“Huh...” A voice said, as you turn your body. It was... a young schoolgirl! Brown skin, brown hair and a a giant body that scared you. You looked up to her, barely being able to look up at her. You even look under her skirt, even if you did not mean to.

She was so big, and she was looking down. “A little guy?” She questioned as you nodded your head.

“Y-Yes I am... little girl.”

hEaring your voice, she giggled finding it a bit funny. “I’m not little, you’re little! Wait... have I seen you before.” She said as turned her head.

You don’t think you’ve ever met her, so you were not going to answer. It would seem that she actually knew.

“Wait a second, I do! I’ve seen you on TV!” She said happily. She moved her hand around and reached down for you. You back up but all she did was put her finger on your head. “Although you were not so big, were you?” She questioned.

“No, I was bigger! A Pokemon shrunk me.” You say putting her finger off your head. She laughed and giggled about it, her eyes on you as you go walking away. She had her eye down onto you, when suddenly she smiled. Standing tall, she moved her foot around and blocked your way.

Her giant shoe almost stomping you as you look up. She seemed so much more intimidating standing up like that.

“Hey, wanna have a Pokemon battle!” She said happily.

She was a trainer? Normally, you would wipe the floor with this kid, but you were not really sure you should do that. Not with your Pokemon in their weakened forms.

“I’m good.” You say to her about to walk.

“W-Wait a second.” She said taking steps around and getting in front of you. She got in front making sure you were not going to be able to do anything as she was in front of you. You couldn’t pass him.

“Come on, I wanna see how good I am against the best in the world!” She said.

“Well, my Pokemon are pretty weak at the moment. Shrunken with me. We can do it later, okay?”

“What, scared?” She said, a playful smile on her face as she looked down to you. She wore a smile as she brought her shoe forward and knocked you back. The School girl giving you quite the hit as you fell onto your back.

“H-Hey!”

“Come on, face me.” She said happily, kicking you around with her shoe. She did this a couple more times, toying with you and laughing above as you try to get away. She didn’t let you though, as she toyed with you.

“Fine!” You shout to her as she wore a smile.

“Great! This is gonna be fun!” She taking a couple of steps back and getting away. You look to her for a couple of seconds, not really sure if you were gonna be okay with this.

“Go, Fletchling!” She said sending her Pokeball out. You saw a giant fire bird come down, towering over you like a Molstres as you look up to it. If this Pokemon wanted to, it could even swallow you.

“Fletch?” It said ready. It was a simple Pokemon, one that beginners would have. This is not good. If you lose to this thing, it’s gonna be embarssing.

“Electivire! Come on out!” You shout giving it out. Tossing it forward as it fell right down. Youe Electric type there, as it stared at the giant Bird, as well as the giant Girl.

“Wow, that’s Electivire! It looks so cute down there! I just wanna put it in a cage and make it run around there. Hehehe.” She laughed as you swallowed your fear. Electivire thrown off.

“W-Whatever, let’s go!” you shout to her. You had the type advantage, a higher level. Maybe you can do this, against this intimidating, but weak bird.

The school girl you were facing, wore a smile as she wanted some fun. “Hey, that idea before gives me an... idea. How about we make a bet!” She said as you look at her, fear in your eyes. “If you win, I’ll... I don’t know carry you to that town you were walking to. If I win though, you gotta be my pet!”

“W-What! No!”

“Come on, you are one of the best in the world, no way you can lose.”

“No!” You shout, not getting goated into this one. She looked at you for a couple of seconds, until finally she just rolled her eyes about it.

“Whatever, you are taking it anyway. Whether you like it or not!” She said as she wore a smile.

“Okay, ready for battle!” She said getting ready.

You have to stick close to the battle, so you were in danger. Otherwise you won’t be able to tell your Pokemon. You swallow your fear, as you look at her for a couple of seconds until you swallow your fear. “Electivire! We got to win this! It’s just a bird, a big one yes... but we can beat this Flying Type.”

“Electivire!” it said, hearing your words and getting excited about it. He was getting his courage back, and you suppose that was really good.

15551.content:
Your eyes wide open, seeing the giant Pokemon that just left you. Well... at least you met Mew, no one well every believe you yet. She wants you to go find her? Does she realise the problems that arrises with you. And today of all days. This was suppose to be your day of triumph. The day where you took your first step into greatness. Now, well now you were the size of a Joltik.

You grew up in Viridian City, and despite all your aspirations, you were constantly pushed away from the Trainer life and into the store owning life by your family. You didn’t really want to, you wanted to explore! You wanted go around catching Pokemon, doing battles. You wanted to be a Pokemon Trainer. You were a teenager, so you were past the general age for starting trainers.

Until of course, then even it came along.

You first saw it on a flyer. The Pokemon Challenge of the ages. Pokemon Extravaganza! It was a nice idea.

All the Pokemon left over by breeding, all of them were being handed out to Rookies. Not only does this mean the Pokemon get homes, but they can easily provide Pokemon for all of them. T

All the regions in the world, coming together for an ultimate competition. Much like each region, it has Gym Leaders as you have to beat. Each of one type, as instead of badges you will get coloured ribbons. Once you have all the colours, prevent it to a Champion of any region, and you can challenge them.

It was just the thing you needed. So you got excited as you ran over almost as soon as it happened. Waiting all month for the even to actually start. Today was the day, and looking at your clock... it was going to start in five minutes. Now you have shrunk, and you can’t even do it. It would be far too dangerous.

-
1 Month Ago.

“Hey! I’m not late am I!” You shout, running up to the desk where it was happening.

“Uh, of course not sir. In fact you are our first one of the day. Would you like to register for Extravengza?” The woman behind the desk said. She questioned as you nodded your head.

“Yes, my name is (Your Name)” You say to her as she smiled. Pulling out the paperwork as you eagerly signed, getting your breath back as you literally ran over.

“Now, do you have prior experience?”

“N-No. I thought this was for rookies?” You question her.

“Well, it is however we do expect some expert trainers to try. Don’t worry though, they will all follow the same rules as you. Although, i’m a bit shocked. Aren’t you a bit old to start now.”

“Well, better then never.” You say back to her as she couldn’t agree more. Now that you have signed everything, she gave you what you needed. A Pokedex, five spare Pokeballs, canned food that will last, A ribbon box and a drink bottle. She then gave you a passport.

“As you know, each region only has eight Gym leaders, so you will have to travel to get all. This passport will get you a free ride to any other region.”

“Woah. Awesome.” You say with the biggest smile.

“Good, now you can pick your first Pokemon!” She said happily. You followed her as she went into the room. Since you were the first one, it was giant. Over a thousand balls all laid out as you followed her. “Quite the pick you get. Now you won’t be able to bring your Pokemon out until the event starts, a lock is on it. To make sure no cheating.”

“Got it.” You say back to her as you walk around. So many Pokeballs. However in a few seconds you already picked. Grabbing the ball and pulling it up.

“You got your choice? That was quick. I suppose they all are the same to us. Each one has a different Pokemon in it. From any region as well!”

“Something about this ball, I don’t know I guess you could it called to me.” You say to the Pokemon that was in your palm.

“Well, that’s a good sign!”

“Yeah... I suppose it is.” You say flashing her a smile.

-

Now holding the shrunken Pokeball in you, you start thinking about what to do. You could go back home, get yelled at by your parents and chances are never be able to leave again. Or... you can have your dream.

Sure you were small, but it was not like you were in a vegetable state. You can still do this, you can still win! Shrunken to a small state or not, you will not be stopped!

Plus, you got to find Mew. You two are still in a game after all, and you play to win. Moving around and looking inside of your bag. Everything was still there. You don’t really have a problem. Well except for your ribbon case, gonna have to get a normal size replacement.

As the timer counted down on your Pokenav, you got excited.

Not only are you going to find out who your Pokemon was and who you will journey with, you will also hopefully see them normal size.

You think about your plan. Now, you should train your Pokemon first, make them strong for the first gym badge. You might have to journey depending on the Type Advantage, but you can do that. Of course, since they all came from abandoned eggs at Daycare, they were gonna be a baby Pokemon. Not to mention very weak.

A normal trainer would be able to carry their Pokemon back to the centre in case, but you can’t. Not to mention you can’t use your points. Normally recover 20hp. however it shrunk down with you, so it would be 2hp.

*Beep Beep*

As the beeping started, so did the event. Now was the moment. Tossing your Pokeball, your first Pokemon came out.

Thankfully, it was normal size as it was a giant _____________
15551.title: The Greatest Compition In The World

choices: Train you up some more!
Go catch another Pokemon!
Just sit here, let's talk
155511.content:
Teddiursa: https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/thumb...

As the giant Pokemon came out, it took shape. Morphing around the light as the Pokeball came back to you. You catch it and look up, eager to see who you your partner was.

A brown body came out. Standing on two feet, with two arms. Claws on the tip of every limb. The body was large, a couple of feet so you were around doll size to it. Only a couple of inches to regular humans. Finally you looked up to the top. Seeing large round ears, and probably the most adorable face you have ever seen.

You just stared at it for a long time, admiring your Pokemon. While on the other end, your Pokemon moved it's hands around. Stretching it's arms out giving out an adorable.

"Teddiursa!" It said with a smile. Seems like really liked being out.

So your Pokemon was a Teddiursa
A normal type, found in Johto and evolves into Ursaring. Also seems to be a female.

Grabbing your shrunken Pokedex you look her up.

"Teddiursa, the Little Bear Pokemon." And at this you had to chuckle. "This Pokemon likes to lick it's palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts it's own honey by blending fruits and pollen." You got to admit, that sounded even more adorable.

"Teddiursa?" It questioned. Tilting it's large head from side to side as you at the Pokemon. Was it looking for the trainer that brought her out. Well now was the moment of truth. You've already accepted the Normal type as your Pokemon, but was she going to accept you as her trainer. You were small, tiny and let's face it the weakest trainer in the world. They want a strong trainer and you are not one.

Well... Better go for it. "D-Down here!" You shout to the giant searching bear. She heard, her ears twitching as the giant Pokemon heard. She tilted her large head down. Looking down at you as those big eyes look over you.

Right between her legs a small human stood. The young Pokemon surely did not expect this. "H-Hello!" You shout to it. "I guess I uh... I'm your Pokemon Trainer Teddiursa!"

You shout this as you have to wait for the reaction. The Pokemon looked down, almost like she was thinking about it. Until finally something happened.

The bear smiled, a huge and giant smile! Her eyes shining as she seemed to like you.

"Teddi!" She cheered. Reaching her arms down to you. You of course was startled but let do it. She reached down and picked you up. Her claws not actually sharp when handling you. She brought you up and right to her stomach. Before you could even question what was happening, you got hugged into her plus stomach.

Hugging you as tight as she can as she loved it. She was loving this. You turn your gaze up to her, to see her happily look down at you.

This was the biggest bear hug you have ever gotten. So safe to say she was really glad with you.

"So... Are you okay with having me as your Trainer? You question the normal type. It rose you up to it's face. Holding you with two arms out.

"Ursa!" She chimed happily, as she then brought you back to her chest. "Teddi! Teddiursa!"

"Hehe. I'll take that as a Yes." You say. You are so glad that Teddiursa likes you. Now you can start your journey. As a Normal type, there was not many weaknesses she had besides fighting. She had a stalemate with ghost types, and rock types resisted her.

Which is a real problem considering the Kanto first gym leader was rock. Maybe skip Brock and go for Misty? Or maybe go to another region, you always wanted to explore.

Regardless, now that you had Teddiursa the sky was the limit.

"Teddiursa? She spoke. Funnily enough you forgot the bear was holding you. Just kind of accepted it. She looked down to you with a curious yet adorable look.

"Are you wondering how I got like this?" You say as she nods. "Well I met Mew and she did this." To this she just looked more confused. "Right... Newborn Pokemon. Well there was this powerful and playful Pokemon who shrunk me down to this size. I can get big, if I find it again."

And with this, she gave out a little adorable giggle. "Anyway enough about that. Let's start this adventure! Let's see what moves you know?"

Looking at the Pokedex it informed you. "You know Scratch and Fake Tears. Not bad not bad. As well level up you should be able to know more. So uh... You wanna put me somewhere else Teddiursa. I can walk on own."

Although you said that and you could, the answer was an extreme no. In fact it was the opposite as Teddiursa hugged you even more into her chest. Her warm fur behind you.

"Teddiursa." She pouted down to you.

"I-I guess you can hug me here. But if we run into a battle you gotta put me down."

"Teddi!” She cheered agreeing to the deal. At least your Pokemon really like you.

Now thinking about your future, you should probably train Teddiursa up. She’s not that high level, and facing wild Pokemon was a good start. Then again, you could catch another Pokemon. A Nidoran in the nearby route could be good. Getting a Nidoking or a Nidoqueen is something you want.

And finally, you could spend your time with teddiursa, bonding with her. Plus, well you have recently shrunken down, maybe it would be best to not just jump in there at full speed.

A smile on your face as you decide what you are going to do. Teddiursa was awaiting patiently. She didn’t care which option you went with, she just wanted to spend her time with you. She found you so adorable, and she can’t think of another trainer she would want.

“Okay Teddiursa... let’s ___________”
155511.title: Not So Little Bear

choices: You catch Nidoran!
She breaks out, the battle continues
She breaks out, and a Nidorina comes for little sister!
1555112.content:
Nidoran: https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/8/81/...

“Let’s get one more Pokemon!” You say to her happily, as she wore a smile back to you. Both of you very happy as she walked around. You knew where you were, since you lived here so you just told the bear where to go. She seemed very happy about holding you, and that was something you were a real fan of.

It’s not going to be easy, but catching a second Pokemon is key. That way, at least they can train together when not facing other trainers or wild Pokemon.

You were not going to lie though, you were a bit concerned. As soon as you saw a trainer in the distance, you asked Teddiursa to avoid them. You were just concerned, even though you know for a fact that you would have to deal with giants eventually. Just gonna try to delay it though.

Eventually you two got to the route. The route to the Victory Road of Kanto. Excited, you tell her to go into the grass. Both of you moving in, as you wore a smile as you look over to her.

“Okay, let’s catch you a friend!”

“Teddi!” She chimed back excitedly, pretty much running. Still holding you of course.

“Now let’s see, Rattata, Pidgey, Nidoran and Mankey. I think those are all the Pokemon here. I just hope we catch one without much trouble.” You say to her as she just walks.

When suddenly, you heard something moving around the ground.

“It’s a Pokemon Teddiursa, quick we don’t want to to startle it a-”

It just came out. You thought it would be more concerned considering a trainer was near but... it hasn’t seen you. Useful, but a bit heartbreaking. It must assume that Teddiursa was just a wild Pokemon like itself.

What Pokemon? It was a Nidoran Female! This was one of the Pokemon you wanted.

“Okay Teddiursa, put me down and...” You pause, when you realise that she will not really be able to hear you from a distance, and in the midst of battle. “Okay how about... in your ear?”

You questioned about it, as she wore a smile. She knew what she wanted to do, as she swung you around. It was so fast, and you felt yourself tucked in. You could see barely anything, but still at least you could see the battle and Teddiursa could hear you.

“Ready... get as close as you can, and then send out a Scratch!”

She kept walking, getting closer until finally she acted. Nidoran didn’t expect anything, as she swung her hand around and slashed the Pokemon. Nidoran fell over from the hit. It was a critical! However it was still going.


Nidoran stood up, and rammed into Teddiursa.

“Dodge it!” You say to your Pokemon, however she took the hit. Being sent back by a Tackle and being hit hard. She fell onto her back, feeling hurt.

“Teddi!” She whined.

“Sorry, i’ll try to be better next time. Get up, cause she is coming!” Nidoran was, running her way. As fast as she can, but thankfully Teddiursa dodged out of the way as she leaped. You still in the ear and trying to look at what to do.

“Okay, Fake Tears isn’t going to work, so what I want you to do is sidestep the next Tackle. Can you do it Teddiursa?”

“Of course I can!” She shouted back, as Teddiursa moved forward. Getting ready and waiting for Nidoran, it happened at the perfect time. Dodging to the side and giving it a Scratch.

“That’s it Teddiursa You are a natural!” you shouted with a big smile on your face. Very happy about what you were seeing.

However Nidoran got up once again, and lowered it’s head.

Someone who have seen this before. “Teddiursa! She’s sending out a Poison Sting! Make sure to move to the side!”

As you said this, she moved to the side. Walking to the side as she breathed a sigh of relief.

“It’s fast, but easy to dodge. Watch out more are coming!” You shout to Teddiursa as she listened. She really seemed to perfected the sidestep, as that was all she was doing. Dodging to the side again and again but she wasn’t getting closer and Nidoran wasn’t stopping.

“You got to move forward, instead of stepping to the side, step forward as well!” She said with a smile, as that started to happen. Slowly but surely, the distance between was becoming smaller and smaller.

Until finally she acted. A smile on her face as you yell.

“Scratch!” At the top of your lungs. It was a powerful hit as Teddiursa attacked. Nidoran was left with a powerful hit, falling the side and unable to move even if she wanted.

You wore a smile yourself, very happy about how it ended. The Nidoran’s eyes were X’d out, so it was over at the moment.

“That was amazing, now it’s my turn. Bring me out please!?”

She listened as Teddiursa pulled you out. She was a bit hurt, but she also level up due to the intense battle. This was making you happy about it. Teddiursa levelled up, and you were going to get a second Pokemon.

Opening the Pokeball, you tossed it as far as you can. Going far until it hit the Nidoran. The giant Pokemon retracted into the small ball as it came back to you.

You wore a smile on your face, happy about it as you look at the ball in your hand. This has got to work, you have got to get another Pokemon. The strength of the trainer doesn’t matter, it’s the strength of the Pokemon.

You sit down as the Pokeball shook a bit. It usually takes three shakes for it to catch a Pokemon. That was the first one, and the second one just came out as well!

Okay, one more and you’ve officially caught your first Pokemon! You could start preparing, you just need it to be confirmed!
1555112.title: Teddiursa's First Pokemon Battle

choices: A standard Bug Trainer!
A horde of Kakuna!
W-Was that Bugsy!
15551121.content:
And finally, the third shake happened and you found that it was good! It was more than good if anything, as you just caught your second Pokemon!

“Yes, we got a companion Teddiursa! We just got one!” She smiled and cheered about this as well, swinging you around and bringing you over to her chest. She pinned you against it, making sure you were getting a huge barehug.

Which if you were going to be honest, you think it’s the only way she can do it. She was so happy about it, and wore a smile. Eventually you got pulled out of the hug and placed onto the ground.

You can’t help but be eager about this, as you moved your hands around. Looking at the ball.

“Ready to meet her? She is going to be nicer this time.” You say as she nods.

“Teddiursa!” She cheered, as it finally started. You moved your hand around and tossed out the Pokeball. It went flying out and you see the giant Poison type in front of you. She was massive and towering if you were going to be honest. You try to stand tall as you look up to her.

~
“I’ve... been caught.” She said with a sigh, looking to the bear. “And by you?”

“Yep! Welcome to the team! I’m Teddiursa, and this is my trainer!” Your bear cheered as you were letting them talk. Nidoran was confused though, looking around she saw no trainer? “No, down there silly!”

Nidoran looked down, and to say she was disappointed was obvious.

~

“Hi there, i’m your trainer!” you say up to her with a smile. “I know i’m not very... big, but don’t worry. I’m gonna try as hard as I can!” You say as you can tell she was not that happy about it. She just looked down, her expression not changing much.

It wasn’t changing, until finally she rose her paw. You saw it hover over you as it was the thing you could expect the least. It came right down onto you, pushing you onto your back as she pinned you under it.

“W-Woah!”

~

“Not cool, let our cute little trainer go!” Teddiursa whined.

“He’s not much of a trainer, he’s nothing but a little toy!” She said as she could not care less about it. If anything, she was a bit disappointed about the fact that she would have to listen and obey you from now on.

“Not true he’s a great trainer, let him go!”

“Fine...”

~

Nidoran took her paw off of you, as you breathed a sigh of relief. Whatever Teddiursa said was appreciated. You look around for a couple of seconds, until your eyes went over to Nidoran.

“Look I know, you are disappointed like I said, but don’t worry. I’m gonna make you one of the strongest Pokemon! Make you happy, don’t worry!”

You say this up to her happily, as she didn’t really pay much attention. Now you personally were at a problem. Do you recall these Pokemon back into their balls? Or what else can you do?

“Well... I think i’m gonna keep you out, if you don’t want to travel you can go in your ball if you want Nidoran?”


“Teddi!” Your first Pokemon cheered, as she swung you around. She swung you around into a massive hug, holding you as tight as she can. She can’t help but enjoy it.

While Nidoran, if she was going to be honest knew that it was really nice. Not forcing her into a ball, sure... that brief moment she was in there didn’t seem so bad, but she would rather be out.

“Okay... so now that I got a team, we can train! Since you probably know these Pokemon Nidoran, we can go to a different route. Move around town and all.” You say with a smile as she listened. The group of you start moving, moving forward as all three of you go.

-

The trip over to Viridian Forest was a bit boring, but you were getting hugged to Teddiursa. Thankfully less trainers around, as you entered the forest. It was a lot more dense than the routes surrounding.

You knew this place pretty good. You remember running over here when you were a kid, playing and messing around playfully. It had Beedrills, but that was not really a problem if you didn’t start a fight with them.

So you knew this place at the moment. Looking around for a couple of seconds at the entranced.

“Now from trainers i’ve heard passing. Preying on Metapods and Kakunas is a good way to get easy couple levels with starting Pokemon.

So you three move over, and you got to admit, not as much bug Pokemon as you remember. Suppose since there was so much trainers these days with the whole Extravaganza, there was little of Pokemon in the wild.

You wait and relax, rolling into the fur of your Pokemon.

~

“How are you happy about this?” Nidoran questioned. “I mean, he’s not fit for a trainer.”

“No, but he’s cute.” Teddiursa with a big smile. Both of them relaxing about it. Nidoran of course was a bit angry about being caught, but it could of been much worse. At least you seemed like a sort of nice trainer. If not a bit small. “So what are we going to do?”

“He wants to beat Pokemon with us. Get us stronger and face other trainers. Don’t you know anything about humans.”

“N-Not really?” Teddiursa said back. “I was born from an egg not to long ago. Then I was in the ball for a while, and finally out with him. He said he was going to be my trainer, and I was glad.”

“Oh, so you’ve never been a wild Pokemon?” Nidoran questioned, the two Pokemon having a good conversation. Until you chimed in.

~

“H-Hey! I see something, let’s start!” you say to them as Nidoran and Teddiursa looked as well, seeing ________
15551121.title: Nidoran Added To The Team

choices: You lost, no more challenging me
You need protection, luckily for you I got a glass jar with your name on it!
I was thinking... since you lost, you should pay a losers fee
155511213.content:
Bugsy: https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/6/6b/...

Heracross: https://img.pokemondb.net/artwork/large/...

It was a boy, with high shorts, sneakers and a bug catchers net around his back. He also had lavender hair, as you knew who this boy was.

You have looked it up for a while, all the Gym Leaders. You could spot most of them instantly, and this giant boy was no different. A giant human, that’s something you haven’t dealt with yet.

Plus he’s a gym leader, it’s not like you could beat him at the moment. You were not going to lie though, you were really excited to do this. Wearing a smile on your face as tell Teddiursa.

“Hey, take me over to him! Can you?”

“Teddi!” Your Pokemon nodded as they went open. You were not really sure what he was doing, but he was feeling up a tree in the forest looking over it.

He did this for a long while, until he looked around, noticing two Pokemon walking his way. The bug catcher talking.

“A Teddiursa? Nidoran makes sense but Teddiursa is only in Johto?” He questioned.

“Hi there!” You shout as he listened. He looked down at the chest, seeing a little boy waving.

“W-Woah! look at you, you are as big as a Joltik!” He laughed with a smile. Bugsy got onto a knee, bringing his face close to you as you froze. He was so big, and if anything a bit intimidating. Still he was a Gym Leader, he was a good guy. “My name is Bugsy. I’m guessing these are your Pokemon?”

“Yep, my name is (Your Name). I became a trainer due to the Extravengenza! Came here to train on some Metapod and Kakuna.” You say back to him, as he wore a smile.

“Yeah, trainers tend to do that. But... really? A trainer at that size, isn’t there more proper things to do?”

“It’s fine. I wanna do this.” You say back to him, as the boy smiled.

“Oh, well I can’t stop that. Here, can I hold you?” He questioned. You were a bit thrown off, and Teddiursa hugged you even closer. Getting the giant boy to laugh. “Hehe, guess not.”

“Sorry, Teddiursa is a bit protective. Anyway, let’s have a Pokemon battle!”

This time it was his turn to be thrown off about it. He can’t believe you wanted a battle. “Uh... that might not be good, a Pokemon battle this early. Maybe you should train your Pokemon first, okay little guy.”

He talked down to you, even though you think you are older than this boy. Still you didn’t speak up about it.

“I-I guess, it’s just, seeing a bug gym leader here. This is my chance isn’t it?”

“Yeah, there are only a couple of bug trainers, compared to let’s say Water or rock type gym leaders. Still be careful okay.” Bugsy said with a smile. “Plus, since we have no need to stay in our Gym, it’s gonna cause more trouble.”

“O-Oh yeah, I didn’t think about it really.”
