choices: She let's you win
She still doesn't feel confident about you
155511213212111113111231.content:
Nosepass: https://cdn.bulbagarden.net/upload/8/89/...

Okay so you have bet one of Roxanne’s Pokemon, only one more to go. You just need to do this. Nidoran and her double kick was really effective. However you are sure you can’t surprise her again.

“You bet one, but let’s see how you go against my signature Pokemon. Go, Nosepass!” She shouted, sending it forward. You see the Pokemon come out, and... well you have never seen anything like it. It’s obviously a rock type, but a Hoean one.

“Nosepass...”

“That’s right.” Roxanne shouted.

You move your hands around and reach for your Pokedex and pulling it out. Listening to it.

“Nosepass, the compass Pokemon. It moves less than an inch a year, but when it’s in a jam, it will spin and drill down into the ground in a split second.”

“Wow, well i’m still gonna beat it! Nidoran, charge with a Double Kick once again!”

“Nido!” She said happily, running it’s way.

“Harden!” Roxanne said, as to your surprise. That was all the Pokemon did. One hit, followed by another to Nosepass. The kicks although super effective barely moved the Pokemon. Nidoran was close.

“Now, Rock Tomb!” She ordered.

“Jump Nidoran, that’s how we get away!” You shout as well, as your Pokemon jumped. The rocks shoot out of the ground, only for you to be shocked. The rocks easily caught the Pokemon. Entrapping her. The rocks were like pillars, that’s how they reached your giant Pokemon.

“No! Nidoran!”

“Tackle!” Roxanne yelled, as the Nosepass collided with the rock. Not only did this cause a rock slide, Nidoran was in the middle.

“Nidoran!” You shout to her, as you look in the middle of the battle field.

“Nidoran is unable to battle, the winner is Nosepass!”

Oh no. “Return Nidoran.” You say calling your Pokemon back to he ball. “You did great, we will finish this.”

“This is for your own good. If you can’t get pass me, you can’t continue your journey.”

“That’s just it, I am gonna get pass you! Go Teddiursa!” You send out your Bear as she stood ready. The two Pokemon.

“Fine, then let’s finish this. Rock Tomb!”

“Teddiursa, run around.” You shout as your Pokemon sprinted. Clearly, jumping high wasn’t gonna do it. She realised it as well, as you switched up your strategy.

“Keep the rock tomb up, don’t let her stop!”

“Teddiursa, run towards Nosepass.” You shout to your Pokemon. With the rocks shooting behind her still, she turned over there.

As this was happening, Roxanne thinks she knows your plan. Lay in attacks slowly but surely. Dodging the rocks all of it. That’s some faith you have in your Pokemon.

As the two Pokemon got close, Roxanne acted. “Tackle!” Her Pokemon stopped the rock pillars and charged.

“Slow... it’s slow. Teddiursa jump over the Pokemon. Get behind it!” you yell at your Pokemon, as she listened. Jumping and getting behind. “Now Tackle Nosepass yourself, push it into the rock.”

“Teddi!” She said, hitting the Pokemon with a shoulder. The Nosepass collided with the rock, as it did more damage than a normal tackle would.

“Now, tackle on the rock above and get out of there!”

“Teddi!” She yelled, moving and slamming into the rocks. Teddiursa got out of there, but Nosepass didn’t. It jumped to the side as Roxanne looked at her Pokemon, in the pile of rocks.

“I got to admit, you do have a trainers instinct. Not just anyone can think of that strategy from just watching it once. However... if you think that can beat Nosepass.”

“Nose!” It chimed, as you guess that didn’t work. You see it move out of the rocks. Bruised but still standing.

“Rock Throw!”

“Teddiursa, dodge it.” Which she had no problem with. Jumping left and right as you try to think of something you can do. The Nosepass kept throwing rocks.

“W-Wait a second!” You shout to her. “Teddiursa, get close.”

“Teddi!” Your Pokemon chimed, running close.

“Amazing, your Pokemon has complete faith in you?” She questioned. She can’t help but be confused. “Hold a rock, throw it when it gets close.”

 Nosepass did just that, as Teddiursa got closer. “Nose...” He said, finally throwing it forward. Teddiursa thankfully barely sidestepped it as it got ahead.

“Tackle!” You shout as your Pokemon charged into the rock.

Roxanne expected more, however she wasn’t gonna just let the poor move go free. “Rock Tomb, under it’s feet!”

“Jump up on Nosepass!” You yell as Teddiursa did just that, on top of the rock.

“W-What?” Roxanne chimed as the rocks got shot up. A pillar, but this time, both Teddiursa and Nosepass was on it.

“Jump down Teddiursa, and then tackle the rock again!”

“Ur-Sa!  She said leaping off of Nosepass. Roxanne knew what you were trying to do, but she also knew that Nosepass was far too slow to get down as well. Teddiursa charged her shoulder into the rock, and brought it down once again. Knocking it down as well as Nosepass.

However... due to it’s weight, the fall was much worse for the rock type. A dust cloud came up when Nosepass smashed into the ground. Teddiursa still standing ready for the fight.

As this was happening, you were hoping that was it. You can’t see much from your vantage point.

However... you heard the officiator.

“Nosepass is unable to battle, the winner is Teddiursa! With that, the battle goes to (Your Name)!” And at this, you loved it.

“We won! We won!” You chimed, jumping around happily.

“Teddi?”

“Teddiursa! We won, we won our first gym battle!”

“Teddi? Te... Teddiursa!” She yelled happily, running over to you and dropping down. Not crushing you, but pulling you into a big bear hug. One you just had to reply. You proved it, you proved you can beat a gym leader, even at the size you were at!

As for Roxanne, she was left stunned. That was a smart move, and with strong Pokemon. She can’t even deny it.

You were a trainer.
155511213212111113111231.title: Battling The Rock

choices: Roselia
Shroomish
Treecko!
1555112132121111131112311.content:
“We won! Nidoran we won! Teddiursa we won!”

“Teddi!”

“Nido.” Your Pokemon said, both of them smiling as they see their tiny trainer jumping around with excitement. Of course, they would rather go around and go to their food. They went and took many bites. Both of them eating pellets and even drinking.

“Hehe, okay I will let you eat.” You say turning back to Roxanne. The group of you were all in a waiting room. It was just you and Roxanne, as she smiled down.

She brought her hand down to you, and grabbed you. Roxanne grabbing you and lifting you up to her hand. She places you onto the table in front.

“Well, I have to admit. You impressed me, to the point where I can’t deny it. You are a good trainer, so you can keep going.”

“Darn right I can! Did you hear that guys!” You say beyond happy about. “Okay, I will let you girls eat.”

“When was the last time you fed them?”

You pause before thinking. “When was the last time?”

“You don’t even remember! You need to take better care of your Pokemon Mister!” She said, pointing her finger at you.

“I know, uh... yes miss.” You say to her.

“Pokemon aren’t playthings, they are partners. Treat them as such.” Roxanne said. “That is what we tell the children.” She said as you calmed down. You calmed down with her as the both of you look at each other.

“Right, i’ll do better by them. Now... I think I might deserve a reward.”

Roxanne looked at you, before sighing. She pulled out the Rock Ribbon! One of the 18 Ribbons. She gave it to you as you held the large ribbon.

“Do you have a case?” She questioned raising her eyebrow. You showed it, as you pull the shrunken one of your bag with a nervous laugh. “Well, how will you carry the ribbons?” She said, a bit annoyed at how unprepared you were.

“Uh... Teddiursa! Over here!” You say to your Pokemon. The bear had her mouth full of food. “Oh her arm?”

“It will have to do for now.” Roxanne said. Leaning her way over and tying it on her arm. It would seem she was very happy about it, only to go back to your food.

“Now do you have a Pokenav?”

“Oh right I do!” You say to her with a laugh, pulling it out. You totally forgot.

“If you want to become a trainer, you gotta remember these things better!” Roxanne said.

“Hey, I was good enough to get the rock ribbon an-” You didn’t finish those words as she pushed you with her finger.

“You also can’t talk that way to people bigger than you! You won’t know how they will react. Act better.”

“Right, right I will.” You say to her as you guess this was happening. “Anyway, why did you want me to pull this out?”

“Put my number in. Call me if anything goes wrong.” She said as you did just that. You can make calls with this thing, man it is pretty funny how you forgot. “And check your map.”

“Right...” You say going to it.

“Now I recommend-”

“I think I will go to Route 115, then Meteor Falls, and to Lavaridge Town! That’s the plan.” You say as you look up to her. “Not good?”

“Can’t you pick something a bit more... safer?” She said as you shake your head.

“Nah, I will be fine!” You say to her with a smile. “Do you know the Gym Leader?”

“Flannery, she’s a fire type Gym Leader.” Roxanne said. “Fine, you can go. I stand by my statement though, if you have a problem call me.”

“Got it! Thank you so much for doing this for me. You are the best.” And with that, you get going. You get going and move your way away. You move your way away, going down to your Pokemon.

“Return!” You shout to both of them. You then turn around to see the Gym Leader. “Hope we get to meet again.”

“I do too.” Roxanne said down to you, moving onto her knees. “Just be careful. It’s not gonna be an easy trek up there.”

“I have faith in my Pokemon.” You say to her, as she had to smile as well.

“And they have faith in you. Good luck, i’m... rooting for you.”

“You are? Really?” You question, a bit excited about it.

“Everyone loves an underdog story. Good luck.” And with that Roxanne stood tall. Very tall, she waved at you as you slowly made your way out of the building. She would rather keep you safe, but she’s not gonna blame you. You wanted to be a trainer, like many others.

-

“Katie!” You shout to her, seeing the girl not so far away. She looked back at you for a couple of seconds, very happy about it.

“Hey, how’s it going! How did it went!” She said. The both of you were on the edge of town. Right towards the routes.

“Ready? I won!” You shout to her. The giant girl a bit shocked. “Y-You won?”

“Yep, kicked butt with them. It was pretty nice if I was going to be honest.” You say to her. “You are gonna love facing her. She’s a nice Gym Leader.”

“You know,” Katie said. “I am a bit against the idea of playing catch up to someone your size.”

“What, we rivals?” You chuckle to her. “Well i’m going up to Lavaridge Town. Want me to wait for you and we can go together.”

“A fire Gym Leader. I have an Ice Pokemon and a Grass Pokemon. I don’t think that’s for me. If you can go to the gym by yourself, you can make this?”

“You know it!” You say back to her with a laugh as it is about to start. “wait Grass Type? What Pokemon did you catch?”

Katie liked you being interested. “I got a _________”
1555112132121111131112311.title: Leaving Rustboro

choices: A horde of Zubat's!
A trainer
Someone else
15551121321211111311123111.content:
“A Roselia! Really... not familiar with it, can I see it.”

“Nope!” Katie said with a laugh, standing tall. You don’t think she was trying to intimidate you at the moment, but it was kind of working. “Gotta keep it a secret from my Rival. Good luck. Next time we see each other, i’m winning.”

“You wish giant girl.” You say back to her. “W-Wait a second, let’s exchange numbers!”

“You have a Pokenav. Since when?”

“Since uh... always. Kind of forgot.” You say as she laughed.

The two of you swapped numbers, as finally she looked down. “Well there we go, see you later! Call me if you need help.”

“Why does everyone think I can’t handle myself?”

“Cause you can’t tiny.” She said tapping you with her finger. She then walked over you, proceeding into the city. “See ya!”

“Bye Katie!” You say waving back at her, as you proceed to leave the other way.

“Nidoran, Teddiursa. Come on out!” You shout sending your Pokemon out. “Do you two uh... think you can give me a ride?” You say nervously.

Both of them laughing about it.

-

So you three walked your way through Route 115. Besides the occasional Pokemon battle with a Zangoose it went good. You three got closer to Meteor Falls as you were left stunned.

“Wow, it’s so big. Meteor Falls? I wonder why it’s called that?” You say to them. “We can camp in there, under shelter.”

“Teddi!” Teddiursa said with a big smile. The three of you walked up. It was a weird landscape, one side of you was the beach, the other side was a mountain.

But it was the beach you were more interested in. You say something that made you smile. “Nidoran, there is a Pokemon at the beach!”

Nidoran listened and went down there. Being slightly faster than Teddiursa she got to the shore quick. Just as the Pokemon went back.

“Darn, it must of swam out.” You say as you step off. Moving down onto the sand as Teddiursa came back. “Do you two see anything?”

Your Pokemon of course looked as well. Neither of them seeing something. Until finally you saw it.

“H-Hey! I see it. It’s a... Magikarp?” Now you would be disappointed if it was one. It was on the surface far out. You took a long look at it though. It had the same shape, but a different colour. “Wait no... it’s the Hoenn version.”

Both of your Pokemon looked at you confused as you pulled out your Pokedex.

“Feebas, the Fish Pokemon. Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokemon’s marvellous vitality has made it a subject of research.”

“Wow, These ones evolve into Milotic!” you say looking at the fish. It was staring back at the three of you. You don’t think Feebas sees you as a trainer, and probably only sees your Pokemon. “Milotic is said to be one of the most beautiful Pokemon in the world. Aw, it would be nice to have one.”

“Nido?”

“Yeah you are right. She is far too far away.” You say to them. “Well, guess that’s that. Let’s keep going.”

“Teddi! Teddi!” Your Pokemon said seeing that you wanted it.

“No point, it would just swim out. Come on, maybe we can see a cool Pokemon in Meteor Falls.” You say climbing onto Nidoran. The three of you leaving.

~

“H-He just called me beautiful.”

~

As the three of you went ahead and into Meteor Falls, it just got dark. Although their was lumanite lights in the cave. You think it’s from crystals or something like that.

“Wow, this place is pretty! Let’s see how far we can go until we get tired.” You say to your Pokemon. They seemed to listen as they came with you.

“A Fire Gym Leader next. There should be no resistance or anything like that, so the both of you will have an easy match. We should probably level up near the town. You two okay with that?”

“Ran!” Nidoran said. At you on it’s back.

“You don’t wanna do that. Nidoran, you gotta. You might be too weak and you might lose.” You say as she disagreed. “How about if you do, we will have a rest after that.”

Nidoran listened to her master, until finally she nodded her way. “Nido.” She said with a nod as you were glad about it.

After a lot of walking in, you three came across a stream in the cave. “Wow, look at that.” You say getting off Nidoran. “I wonder how it tastes.” You move ahead and get close. Taking sips as your had to admit.

“Wow, I don’t know what minerals are in, but it tastes so nice!” You say to your Pokemon. “It seems good to drink.”

Of course, your word was all Teddiursa needed as she came and kneeled right next to her. Scooping water in her mouth as she gave out a very satisfied “Teddiursa!”

Nidoran of course wasn’t so sure, but if you two are then it must be good. She came onto your other side and began shovelling water in it’s mouth. Licking it up as you wore a big smile on your face.

You were kind of glad about how it went down.

As you two kept having it, you see Teddiursa and Nidoran perk up. Moving and going behind. You of course didn’t give a reaction as you looked at them.

“What’s up girls? Is there something wrong?” You question to her. They just kept looking, as you realised something. “Right you girls have bigger ears, is there something coming.”

At this, you just had to get away. Standing by them and fiddling for your microphone. You pull it out as you were ready for battle.
 What’s coming, was it a Pokemon, was it another trainer that was coming. You were paused, thinking about what was happening.

Teddiursa and Nidoran were ready to protect their little trainer, when suddenly it came. They saw _________
15551121321211111311123111.title: To Meteor Falls!

choices: She ignores you and prepares to fight
She runs away like you told her to
15551123.content:
Suddenly, the ball breaks open and the wild Pokemon emerges. She immediately glares at you, and you gulp. You hadn't expected her to break out, seeing as she took a lot of damage during the fight.

You hear heavy steps behind you, and then feel two giant fuzzy paws wrap around you. You're brought back up to the chest of your starter, who embraces you tightly and growls at the Nidoran. In response, the rodent rears up and lets out a cry towards the sky, much louder than any noise she made before.

You don't know why she made that cry, but you have a bad feeling about it. Perhaps she was calling for help? What if she has a whole family nearby? There's no way you and your starter could take on more than one Pokemon right now.

You soon see some movement in the bushes behind the Nidoran. Seconds later, a Nidorina appears, running on all fours. She's twice the size of the Nidoran, and even bigger than Teddiursa. The new Pokemon stops next to the Nidoran, then stands up and roars at you and Teddiursa. It hurts your ears, and you wince. Meanwhile, the Nidoran runs behind the Nidorina and chatters rapidly. You get the impression that these two are sisters, and the younger one called to the older one for aid. And now the older one is here, ready to beat you and your starter up.

You can't let that happen, but the only way to avoid that fate is to run. There's no way you can win a fight against this new Pokemon. Not only is Teddiursa currently injured from the previous fight, this Nidorina is bigger, stronger, and surely more experienced. This is a fight you can't win.

So, you tell your starter to run away. She looks down at you with a surprised expression, but you're sure you're making the right choice. You repeat your order and wait to see what Teddiursa does.
15551123.title: Nidorina joins the fight

choices: Teddiursa strikes back!
Teddiursa can’t fight anymore...
155511231.content:
To your dismay, the cub growls and shakes her head, then gently sets you down on the ground. She steps over you, moving towards the new Pokemon.

“What are you doing?” you shout. “Get back here! We need to run!”

Your starter ignores you. She raises her claws, stomps the ground, and roars at Nidorina. It was supposed to be intimidating, but it sounds utterly adorable, and you can’t help but grin. However, Nidorina replies with a much louder and more frightening roar, making both you and your Pokemon step back in fear.

Nidorina takes advantage of this distraction to charge. You run to the side to get away from the impending fight, while your starter stays in place and tries to guard herself. Unfortunately, the attack is too powerful. She’s headbutted and thrown into the air, landing heavily a short distance away. Nidorina then uses Poison Sting to launch needles at her. The cub cries out in pain and tries to get back up. Meanwhile, Nidorina looks at Nidoran and points at Teddiursa. Nidoran nods, then rushes in and tackles the helpless Teddiursa, who continues to struggle and cry out.

You can’t bear to watch any more. You need to help your friend! You rush towards the fight, even though it’s surely a crazy thing to do, considering you’re so much smaller than either combatant.

You don’t get far, though. You feel the ground shake, and before you know it, a huge blue paw has descended on you. Three stubby fingers, each tipped with a sharp claw, wrap around you in a vice-like grip. You scream and squirm uselessly as you’re picked up and brought to the face of Nidorina. Her huge red eyes stare into your soul, and you freeze in terror.

Meanwhile, Teddiursa is still getting attacked by Nidoran. Nidorina looks over and watches with a satisfied expression as her little sister gets her revenge. Now that her intimidating gaze is elsewhere, you regain your composure and try to squirm out of her grip, but it’s no use. You soon give up, and simply watch as your starter is tackled repeatedly. It’s heartbreaking, especially because there’s nothing you can do to help. The best you can do is try to encourage her.

“Teddiursa!” you shout. “Please don’t give up! Fight back! I believe in you! You can—augh!”

You cry out as Nidorina squeezes you painfully, forcing you to be quiet. You fall silent and continue to watch the fight. Hopefully Teddiursa received some encouragement from your words, and gets the second wind required to fight off her attacker.
155511231.title: Teddiursa stands her ground

choices: She nods and releases you. She forgives you for attacking her sister.
She bares her fangs and growls. She doesn't forgive you.
1555112312.content:
Unfortunately, Teddiursa is just too injured and weak to fight anymore. After a few more tackles from Nidoran, your starter stops moving. You can tell she’s still breathing, but she’s clearly unconscious.

“No...” you murmur. “Teddiursa...”

In contrast to your despair, Nidoran cries out in happiness, and Nidorina joins her with a triumphant roar. The younger sister happily hops over to her sibling, but then she gasps as she notices that her sister caught you. She rears up on her hind legs to get a closer look at the tiny human in her sister’s clutches, and she quickly adopts an amazed expression. Nidorina smiles and holds you out to the younger Pokemon, who sniffs at you and examines you closely.

Meanwhile, you’ve lost the motivation to do anything except stare back at Nidoran. It seems like all hope is lost. Your starter was easily defeated in her very first battle, and you’ve been snatched up by a giant wild Pokemon, leaving you at her mercy—and the mercy of her little sister. There’s a very real possibility that these Pokemon will take the opportunity to eat you, or torture you, or both, especially since you attacked the younger sister and tried to catch her. It all feels hopeless.

But then, you look at the unconscious form of Teddiursa lying nearby, and feel some sudden courage well up in you. What would she think if she saw you acting depressed like this? You can’t give up. You’re a trainer now, and your Pokemon partner relies on you to be a good, brave leader. You have to keep fighting, both for yourself, and for Teddiursa.

You look back and forth between the two giant Pokemon and finally speak up. “Hey!” you shout, though your voice shakes. “I... I’m very sorry for attacking you, Nidoran. I’m a new trainer, and Teddiursa just joined me, and I simply wanted us to become stronger by battling you a bit. I was also hoping you’d like to join us. We didn’t want to hurt you or anything. So, please... both of you, can you please let me go and help my friend?”

The two rodents’ ears twitch as you talk. They clearly hear you, and they also understand you, as they start contemplating what you said. They talk quietly to each other in their own language for a bit, then Nidorina looks down at you.
1555112312.title: Teddiursa is defeated

choices: Give yourself the courage and get her attention.
Stay hide, you don't know if she'll help you or not...
Actually, Kubfu is aware about what happened and she looking right at you!
15552.content:
You can't believe what just happened to you, you got shrunk by Mew! And what worst, Mew leaves you like that. It seems she challenges you to find her if you want to returned at your normal size. But how you suppose to find her at your new tiny size? You must be inbetween of 1 or 2 inches right now! Plus you have no pokemon!

First you just arrived in isle of Armor yesterday, you planned to participate to the dojo trial but sadly it already begins and the second trial just over. So you just watching the final trial... But at least Mustard has been generous to give you the student uniform which you wearing this right now. After having see the young boy trainer named Victor who seems to be around of your age received a legendary pokemon named Kubfu from Mustard for passing the final trial, you decide to stay in this island hoping to not miss the next trial later...

But first you need to catch your first pokemon and well... you end up to be shrunk by Mew.

You currently in the field of honor and "Oh my Arceus". How are you going to find Mew in your new giant world? It seems the only option you have its making your way toward the master dojo and get help from someone and it also means you have to avoid the wild pokemons who wandering in this place.

That right, at your new size, all the normal sized pokemon would be like dynamaxed compared to you and speaking of dynamax, you don't want to imagined how big would be a *real* dynamaxed pokemon, it would be... oh god... lets not thinking about it.

Suddenly loud footstep approached! Quickly you hide behind the large rock as the shadow looming above you. You look at the giant figure that towering you and you recognize it.

The giant figure is none other than a legendary pokemon Kubfu itself!

First you think it was the same Kubfu from early, but no it a difference one. Because you remember the Kubfu that Victor have received is a male. But this one who is standing right in front of you is a female!

You were amaze and intimated in same times by how big she is compared to you. But you don't know if you should try to get help from her, because you can't tell if she's domestic or wild.

What happen next?

A: You decided to get her attention hoping she'll help you.

B: You decided to not get her attention and stay hide hoping to be spotted.

C: You stay hide but Kubfu already know that you're shrunk and hiding behind the rock, because she saw everything and she's looking right at you! Will she help you or she have other plan in her mind?
15552.title: Shrunk in the isle of Armor

choices: Sylveon looked concerned. She was going to help you!
Sylveon smiled. Seems she liked this 'new' you...
15553.content:
After Mew flew out of sight, you sat in silence for a while, trying to process what just happened.

You were shrunken down and left behind like some toy the legendary Mew had gotten bored of. You recalled her last words, 'come find me'. Was it a challenge? Some kind of trial? Or just a stupid game?

Whatever the case, it was unlikely for you to win... at least, if you were alone...

You perked up at the last thought, which you discarded as incorrect: you weren't alone, you reminded yourself as a small wave of relief washed over you.

You remembered your Pokemon partner coming with you. She was just sleeping nearby when Mew appeared and shrunk you, but now the tasks of getting out of this forest of grass and finding her seemed impossible, given your current stature.

Still, you couldn't just sit still and wait for either your partner to wonder where you were or for some other Pokemon to show up and turn you into a meal without even thinking twice.

So, getting up, you began running across this forest.

You had to get to your Pokemon, fast.

You ran as fast as you could, forced to push the blades out of the way so that you could pass while wondering where your partner was.

Hopefully, she was still in the same spot as before.

Luckily for you, it wasn't a terribly long time until you finally emerged from the grass; And not too far away, curled up in her own patch of grass, was a white and pink Pokemon with four ribbons messily scattered around her as their owner slept with her head in her pink paws.

Your Sylveon was resting peacefully, blissfully unaware of your predicament or anything else around her.

You sighed, figuring that you had to get her attention and, eventually, help.

It sounded pretty simple, at least.

Hastily, you made your way to the sleeping giantess and reached her paws, grimly noting that you weren't any bigger than a paw alone.

You shook your head, you'd take care of your size later. First things first, you had to wake Sylveon up.

You decided to simply call out to her and hope she could hear you, despite your reduced stature, though you guessed her ears were going to be a 'big' help.

You mentally groaned at your thought process as you proceeded to call to Sylveon,

"Sylveon, wake up," you spoke, getting no response or reaction. Nothing at all, not even a twitch of her ears.

"Sylveon, wake up. C'mon girl, I need you!" you called again, getting the same response as before.

You kept trying a few more times, getting absolutely nowhere. At some point, your mind went to Mew as you wondered how far she had gotten while you were pointlessly trying to wake up your Sylveon.

It was no use: the fairy-type was in deep sleep and couldn't hear you at all.

You groaned, figuring you'd have to wake her up the 'manual' way. And that meant you had to climb all the way up to her head and try to wake her up there; you guessed that, if you got closer to her ears, then she'd be able to hear you!

So you moved to one of her paws and jumped on top of it, putting your hands against the side of Sylveon's furry head as you got ready to climb; her fur was silky smooth, and it was going to be your ticket to her head.

So, with a little push upwards, you began your climb to the top, while your now giant Pokemon kept snoring quietly.

It took you a couple minutes to reach the top of the pink and white giantess' head; the fur, you noted as you stood up, reached your knees.

"Better than being stuck in some grass..." you mused to yourself as you looked around your Pokemon's head; aside from the large white, pink and blue bow, Sylveon's equally colored ears were there, on each side of you, standing tall like towers, looming over you. You just had to pick one.

You chose her left ear and moved in front of it. Then, carefully low as to not irritate Sylveon's delicate hearing, you began speaking within her ear,

"Sylveon, wake up. I need you," you said, beginning to stroke the side of her ear gently, hoping she'd feel you.

She definitely did, because she began moaning in her sleep. Certainly a better result than the one you got back on the ground.

You kept stroking Sylveon's fine fur while pleading for her to wake up until she finally did; her eyes opened slowly, the ribbons rose from the ground and she heard the voice of her master in her ears. Yet, as she glanced around, she saw no one.

As for you, you took notice that your Pokemon had finally woken up, so you sighed in her ear,

"On your head, girl."

Sylveon hesitated a moment. Then, slowly, a ribbon crawled to her left ear; absentmindedly, you began petting it, allowing its owner to locate you and wrap the ribbon around your waist. After that, you were brought in front of Sylveon's blue eyes; seeing her white pupils widening in surprise, you began chuckling nervously.

"Hehe, hello Syl..." you muttered as you began explaining why you were so small.

You began by telling her of your encounter with Mew while Sylveon herself listened carefully.

However, it was long before the end of your tale that you noticed how Sylveon was reacting to the situation.
15553.title: Pixie partner

choices: You hear something nearby (Wild Pokemon)
You hear something nearby (Pokemon Trainer)
Nothing happened and you managed to escape the jungle afterwards
15554.content:
Okay, let's explain here for a bit.

First of all, you were exploring the vast Lush Jungle in order to fetch some ingredients for some cuisine at the Tide Song Hotel as you worked as one of the chefs there. This is the last place you ever wanted to go because you did not like having to walk all over the place were wild Pokemon go around and attack you. Sadly, you forgot to bring one of your Pokemon with you but then again, you didn't expected to be one of the unfortunate gatherer to be sent here in all place; you still have some pokeballs with you, but that's still not enough to make you safe. After taking a quick nap from all that walking, you managed to find something that you never expected to find: Mew! And then, another unexpected turn of events: You have been shrunk!

Now back to the present, you are now totally defense and there's no way you can protect yourself now. Mew have told you to find her, but how could do that in this condition?

You could try to find a Pokemon and catch it while it's not looking, but way too dangerous. You don't have any clear idea what to do so you are gonna just walk among the giant plants to avoid getting seen by any Pokemon that wants to eat you or trainer that wants to catch you. You went and walk through a series of bushes, beginning your trek across this great jungle.

It wasn't very easy to walk through the bushes as you have to move away the branches and twigs that keep blocking your path. You are not sure how are you going to escape as you couldn't quite remember where the exit was. You did know that there was a clearing nearby so you hope that you could get there and get a better idea on where to go.

Good news, you have found the clearing that you have been previously as the large rock in the center makes it recognizable. Bad news, the grass are much taller here than you expected. While it can protect you from being spotted, the taller grass is where wild Pokemon can be spotted. With much effort, you tried to walk across this dangerous spot.

What happens next?
15554.title: Lost In The Wilderness

choices: Yes and sees that you are a person
Yes and thinks you are a Pokemon
No and walked pass you
155542.content:
You walked across the very tall grass strands, hoping for nothing bad happens to you. You couldn't see what's in front of you but you can see where the rock is and that's where you will be using for directions. The giant rock serves as a clue on what spot you are standing. A few minutes later, you managed to get near the jungle pathway meaning that you are now leaving this clearing and possibly closer to the exit. However you stop right in your tracks; you could've sworn you heard something beyond the darkness in front of you, but it was too soft to make it out.

You stood there; listening real carefully at what sounded like a series of booms which gets louder as it gets closer. You quickly figured out that it sounded like someone is coming, most likely a Pokemon trainer. You look ahead and can make out a figure walking down the jungle path.

The person appears to be a young girl with short black hair under a large red hat. She wears a yellow floral shirt with a tied-up ribbon on the hem, green shorts that were very short to the point it reveals nearly her entire legs, and a pair of red-black sneakers with no socks. With that red bag she's holding with on her shoulder, you can easily tell that this is indeed, a Pokemon trainer. However, you realize that you have seen this girl before back at the hotel. While both of you never meet face to face, you did saw her talking to another girl at the hotel lobby before leaving. You will never expected to come across her yet again and right now, you don't think you could face her very easily due to your size. Because of that, you don't think you are going to get her attention out of fear that she could mistake you for a Pokemon and try to catch you. Speaking of which, you can see her face looking down among the grass, searching for some Pokemon to capture. You stand still at the very spot and hope that she wouldn't find you.

Of course, you also kinda want her to see you because let's face it, you are going to need some help getting out of this jungle, but that's all pure luck.

You watch as she gets closer and bigger until she is now towering over you. The worst part is that she has stopped right in front of you and begans to search below. You gulped and hope for the best.

Did she see you?
155542.title: Selene, Goddess Of The Moon

choices: Stay here and wait
Open her Pokeball
Leave her behind
1555422.content:
Because of how tall the grass strands are and how dark this jungle is, you would expect that this young trainer won't be able to see you. So with that, you slowly tiptoed as quietly as possible to escape her sight when she suddenly gasped from above. You look up and see that to your utterly surprise, is now staring down at you with her mouth wide open.

"Oh wow, is this a Pokemon?" You hear her said. You couldn't believe on what she said. The idea of being mistaken for a Pokemon has come true and now, you are in her sight. You tried to call back to her and try to tell her that you are a human being, but you saw that she has already taken her Pokeball; ready to catch you.

"I don't know what you are supposed to be, but I'm gonna catch you." She said in a slight cheerful tone.

With nothing else to get her attention now, you have choice but to run away from her as far as possible. You turn around and make a dash; forward ahead. You didn't even look back but you could hear her saying "Wait, come back!"

As you ran across the pathway with the girl running in pursuit of the strange "Pokemon" that she found, you wondered how can she see a tiny creature like you in a dark place like this. This girl seems to have some excellent sense of sight because her eyes still haven't left you. You dodge several obstacles along the way which are mainly branches, rocks, and leaves; the girl however, can easily step on them as it they were never there. You were slowly losing your breath as you ran until you can barely escape from her.

"Yes, I finally got you now." She said excitingly. But just as she was about to get closer, she did not noticed that she is walking towards a large tree root and immediately trips onto it. She rapidly flail her arms in surprise before losing her balance.

You stopped when you hear a loud noise from behind you that sounded like crashing. You look towards that direction only to realized that the giant girl is no longer chasing after you. Right in front of you, she is now laying on the ground; eyes closed. Why is she's now sleeping? It must've been the fall that impact her head to the point that was enough to knock her unconscious.

You walked towards her hand and poke it to see a response, but nothing is coming from her now. You sat down on her thumb, trying to think on what to do now.

You could try to stay here and wait until she wakes up in order to properly contact her, but you don't know how long will that take. You spotted her Pokeball that has now dropped from her hand; it could be one of her Pokemon inside so maybe you could get their help instead. Of course, maybe there's no point of reasoning from her so it would probably be best to abandon her and find someone else.

What will you do?
1555422.title: The Moon Crashes

choices: Slot 17
Slot 18
Slot 19
Slot 20
More Slots
15555.title: More Slots

choices: “I gotta report back to my chapero- er, master knight-keteer!”
“...I have idea how to help you right now.”
“I need to figure out if the others will… accept you.”
155551.content:
“What... just happened?” You groaned, sitting down.

That was certainly unexpected. You never thought you’d meet the legendary Mew in your life! Of course, you also never thought that Mew would shrink you and abandon you in the wild. If that was the price to pay for meeting Mew, it didn’t seem worth it right now.

“Maybe this is why so few people say they’ve seen Mew.” You thought, smiling a bit at the idea.

Shaking your head, you focus on the matter at hand. You had to figure out what you were going to do next. You weren’t a Pokemon trainer, so you didn’t have any partner to go find. Fortunately the Pokemon around Icirrus City were mostly docile. Probably because the gym leader, Brycen, kept everything nice and peaceful. So at least you won’t have to worry about aggressive wild Pokemon.

Of course, that didn’t mean you were safe from danger. Right now, you were tucked away in a nice dry area of forest. But you definitely remember the massive bog that surrounded Icirrus City. That thing was already dangerous and a pain to get through at normal size. At your current size, you’d probably just drown.

But you had to go and risk it. Once you got to town, you could get someone’s attention and they could take you to Brycen. You doubted he could fix you, or knew anyone who could, but he’d at least be able to arrange for you to stay somewhere. Maybe get you someone to guard you too.

But that bog was so massive and the city was already far away when you were normal size. What took you a day or two before would likely take you weeks now. You were well stocked for a long trip, but that was for normal size you. You couldn’t even see your bag now; Mew probably took it. And even if you could find it, you had no way to carry any of the massive supplies inside.

Could you even survive a trip through that bog?

You scratched your head contemplatively. Your only options really were to stay here and wait for help or risk the trip. If you could find your bag, you’d have plenty of supplies to wait here, but if you couldn’t then you’d have to scrounge stuff together and survive off the land. And there was no guarantee that help would come, or even notice you.

You had to think this through carefully…

As you sat there and debated, you thought that you could feel or hear something. At first you ignored it, but the thought kept creeping into your mind. The sensation felt so faint, but it felt so real. If you focused hard on it, it almost felt like... movement. Like something was coming to-

You instantly jumped to your feet when something massive slammed down in front of you! The object appeared to hit the ground hard, but it barely made a sound. And the grass beneath it didn’t get trampled either. It simply bent, sort of conformed to the shape of the object. It was like it was like the thing wasn’t even there!

Mostly recovered from the shock, you steady your breath and take a good look at what landed in front of you. It was… a massive blue hoof! Thinking you knew what it belonged to, you craned your neck to look up.

Sure enough, it was the legendary Pokemon Keldeo!

You couldn’t believe your eyes! You were seeing another legendary, just moments after the first one shrunk you! Not to mention, Keldeo was one that you were much more familiar with. You grew up hearing stories about Keldeo and his teachers. Most of the stories focused on Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion; but you always liked Keldeo the best. He was a trooper who worked hard to become even greater and more heroic than his teachers.

You couldn’t have stumbled into better help! All you had to do was get his attention and you’d be set. Just had to figure out how you would get his attention.

It turned out, though, that you didn’t have to. Keldeo was already scanning the ground and, before you even tried to get his attention, his eyes locked onto you. The determined look on his face morphed into a reassuring smile as your gazes met. Stepping back a little, he made enough room between you two so that he could settle down onto his front legs.

You knew that you were in a precarious situation, but you were honestly ecstatic right now. Keldeo was pretty much your favorite legendary Pokémon! And he was here, right in front of you! If you were normal size, you’d probably have gone crazy petting his mane or something. Right now, all you could do was give an admiring stare to the giant, which made him blush a little when he noticed.

But the slight embarrassment didn’t stop him from doing what he came here for.

“I knew I sensed someone in trouble nearby. You don’t have to worry anymore, I’m here to help!” He reassured you in a telepathic… feminine voice.

Wait a minute.

“Whoa! Are you a girl!?” You instinctively blurted out, a lot less tactfully than you would have liked.

Keldeo’s reassuring smile shrank into a neutral expression and she let loose a long sigh.

“Why does every human ask me that?” She rolled her eyes dismissively. “I mean, honestly, what’s so weird about me being a girl?”

You knew that it was a rhetorical question, but you figured you had to say something.

“Th-there’s nothing weird about you being a girl!” You said hastily, “It’s just that… all the stories I was told about you said that you were a boy.”

“I hear that a lot too.” She noted a bit sourly, “But why do all the stories say I’m a boy? Girls can want to be brave heroes too. ...Is it because a lot of me is blue?”

“Uh- probably?”

“Virizion never has this problem. Maybe I should ask her for tips. I shouldn’t really care about this, but-”

“I-I’m sorry if I offended you!” You interrupted Keldeo. “You’re like my favorite legendary Pokémon, so I really hope I didn’t make you angry!”

Hearing your apology made Keldeo smile and chuckle.

“Don’t worry about it. Like I said, I hear it a lot. You don’t have to lie about me being your favorite legendary.”

“It’s not a lie though. You really are awesome! The way you train under three other legendaries, trying to become stronger and more heroic than them is so cool! You’re inspiring!”

Keldeo just chuckled dismissively. “Wow, you’re really laying it on thick. But I appreciate the compliments.”

You kind of wanted to convince the legendary that she really was your favorite, just to show how much you admired her, but decided to drop it for now. If she was here to help you, then you’d have plenty of time to sing her praises later.

“So are you here to help me?”

Keldeo looked at you with a puzzled expression and tilted head.

“Um, yeah. I just told you that I sensed you needed help.”

Crap, you were looking like a dork in front of your favorite legendary! It hardly mattered, but the idea upset you. You just had to try and play it cool right now.

“R-right. I’m just really overwhelmed right now. I never thought I’d meet you. And if I did, I never thought I’d be smaller than your hooves.”

“Yes, I imagine that being so small is quite overwhelming.” Keldeo noted. “But do not fear. Your gallant musketeer is here to keep you safe and near.” She said proudly.

Now it was your turn to chuckle.

“Uh… what’s up with the rhyming?”

“It’s just… something I thought I’d try.” Keldeo sounded a bit embarrassed. “Maybe make it a catch phrase or something? Ah-I don’t know, still working on it.”

Hearing that made you smile. It really made her sound like the inexperienced rookie she apparently was. One thing about her was obvious, she was seriously eager to help people. She had come to your help some quickly, it was almost like you had never been left alone!

“So what’s the plan?”

Hearing your simple question, Keldeo giggled and said nothing. You waited patiently for her to say something, but she never did. You just stared and waited for her to tell you her plan. After some more silence, Keldeo began to silently avoid your gaze. Something was clearly wrong.

“Keldeo?”

The giantess chuckled nervously before looking at you again.

“Well…”
155551.title: A Quick Rescue by the Young Musketeer

choices: To look for Mew still
To go look for a psychic and try
You go to this Galor region
To sleep on it, let's rest for the night
1555512.content:
That was not really something you wanted to know, you wanted her to know what to do, but Keldeo was just as lost as you were. You looked at her for a couple of seconds as you had to be honest.

“That’s disappointing.” You say to her, as you eventually get yourself up. Moving onto your feet. “W-Well... maybe show me to the others? I’m sure they would know what was happening.” You say this to her as she looked at you for a couple of seconds. She wondered about it, until she got a serious look.

“No, I can do this. I will help you get your height back, I promise.” She sent you a nice smile, one that calmed you down to an impressive degree.

“You promise? I will hold you to that?” You say as she smiled.

“You can, cause I am gonna get your height back little human.” Keldeo moved over and leaned her way closer to you. Until she lowered her horn down in front of you. Welcoming this. “Let’s shake on it.”

“Wait, I can seriously touch your horn!?” You sound excited. You run over and touch your horn, as you shake it like a hand. She even lifted her horn up in the air.

“You like touching my horn. Geez, maybe I am your favourite legendary.”

“I mean... that’s what I said.” With a blush as well as a smile. “So Keldeo!” You continue excitedly. “What’s the plan.”

“I don’t know!” She said, as at least she said it with confidence. “You are good with me though, let me think on it.”

“Okay well... are you gonna show me t-”

“No.” She interrupted, as you guess you were gonna have to be glad about that answer. She smiled down to you about it, very happy it. Truth is, she thinks she can do this by herself. She won’t need her teachers helps, this is her task. So she was calling all the shots, and it fell on her back.

“Okay I guess we should look over the area if Mew is nearby, follow me.” She said as she turned her way around. She walked and headed away from you, as you followed her. You were not going to lie, this raised an instant problem. You couldn’t keep up with her hoof steps, even when you ran as fast as you could. She noticed that you were slowing, and when she looked to see you far away she calmed down. “Right that won’t work. You have too little legs.”

}“Yeah...” You say stopping right behind her and calming yourself. What were you going to do. You can’t keep up with her and you don’t want to slow down her search.{ “I guess... go ahead and look around the area. I’ll wait under that tree okay.”

“Nope, won’t do.” Keldeo said as she turned to you. Moving down and lowering her head to the ground. “Climb on.”

“W-What?”

“Climb on, i’m not leaving you alone for a second. You are staying with your favourite.” Keldeo said as she did kind of like that. Being your favourite that is. You of course go ahead and climb her. You feel a bit weird stepping on her, but it didn’t mean you hated it. You got right on top and rested down right on her head.

Well... for a second though, until she turned her head and moved it. This caused you to fall right back and down her head. You land on her back, right on her bright mane as she smiled.

“Wow.”

“Sorry, thought you would be better there. Hold on, i’m gonna be moving fast.” Keldeo said looking at you. You listen and grab the fur, as she got moving.

Keldeo was a literal saint to you in the moment, something to care for you and help you.

-

“Nothing.” Keldeo said. She saw which direction you pointed to where Mew went, and even with her speed... it was useless. She saw no legendary. Heaps of Pokemon but no legendaries. She was right now looking out into the forest on top of a hill. She could see the city not so far away. If Mew went in there, she could hide... Keldeo could not. “You okay back there?”

Gripping her fur as you could as you were giving her a thumbs up. “Y-Yeah. Riding a legendary it’s... something else.”

She smirked about this and looked forward. “Okay, chasing Mew isn’t gonna be easy.” She jumped back. “So I guess... well don’t expect this to be a quick thing.”

She got no response, as she turned her head. Laughing “Are you... seriously cuddling with my mane?”

“W-What!” you say to her. “Sorry, it’s soft.”

She wasn’t sure if you knew how much that touched her heart, but the brave Pokemon wasn’t going to show it.

“So what’s the plan?” You question her.

“Well, I could go and find a psychic, that could probably help you.”

“A psychic Pokemon?” You add. “Well, i’d be up for that.”

“We could keep looking up for Mew, but that’s gonna be hard. All we gotta do is find her though, and she will grow you.” Keldeo said as she raised a good point.

“Yeah... she forced this game on me, and I forced this on you.” You say to her.

“Don’t worry about it.” Keldeo said. “I wanna help you. Now, what else? I know, so Terrakion told me about this place overseas, that have giant Pokemon!”

“Oh right... Galor, but... how will you get there?”

“I’m a legendary, I got my ways.” She said calming you down. “So what will it be?”

“It’s up to me?” You question her. “I think it should be up to you, you are taking charge aren’t you?”

At this, she blushed. You have that much faith in her, she can’t help but smile. “W-Well... if I get a choice, I think our best course of action my little human, will be _________”
1555512.title: Staying With Keldeo

choices: Meloetta decided to give it a shot and tried to restore your size
Meloetta was clueless,  but decided to help you find Mew
Meloetta actually wanted to keep you!
155552.content:
You sat there in complete silence and disbelief for a little while, your brain trying to process what had just happened; Mew, one of the most powerful Pokemon ever, so rare that she was believed to be a myth, had appeared in front of you.

Despite the amount of power she supposedly possessed, her personality matched her looks: playful, cute and... mischievous?

You abruptly returned to reality.

That pesky pink fiend had shrunken you down to the size of a blade of grass and had took off, leaving you behind in a patch of said grass, near Undella Town!

And now you were stuck like this, tiny and alone and- and what was this sound?

"... Huh?" you left your thoughts, looking around for the source of the sound that had penetrated your ears.

It was faint, but you could distinctly hear it, probably because of your now more sensible hearing.

It was more than just a sound, it was like... a song.

Slowly, you stood up, momentarily putting your size-related issues aside to listen carefully.

Yes, someone was indeed singing a tune, though it was nothing you had ever heard before.

It was beautiful, harmonious, you would even dare to say... heavenly.

Without thinking, almost like hypnotized by the music, you began walking, following the song.

You wanted- no, you needed to find its source. You needed to know what was producing such beautiful music.

Before you even knew it, you had exited the patch of grass you had been left in by Mew and were traveling to find the source of the song, having forgotten about everything else.

You walked for a while; your new stature certainly didn't help shorten the distance, but it didn't matter to you.

The music's volume grew each step you took. Despite everything, you weren't completely enthralled by the music: you thought about turning back several times, but the desire to discover what was producing the music was too strong.

And, eventually, driven by that same desire of yours, you reached a tall tree, not that far from where you had begun your little trip.

The music came from here.

More specifically, you discovered looking up, from a Pokemon that was sitting on the lower branches, singing.

You watched the green-haired Pokemon singing, a black, fingerless hand resting on its chest and the other held in the air, its white legs hanging from the branch.

Even though most of your mind was focused on admiring the Pokemon, a small part of it was still working; you felt like you were in a dream when realization dawned on you and you discovered that you actually recognized this Pokemon.

Not only that, it was another legendary!

Meloetta!

You let out an audible gasp; the music stopped.

Two legendaries in the same day!? People would probably kill to be in your place!... Or maybe not.

You gazed back at Meloetta, only to discover that it was no longer singing, and was instead gazing back at you.

You stared at each other for a short amount of time. Then, you realized that you were still tiny and that a giant Pokemon with unknown intentions and a supposedly tremendous power had you in its sight.

However, the moment you thought about fleeing, you felt your legs leaving the ground, your body enveloped in a faint blue glow that rose you higher and higher in the air, until you reached the astonished face of the gigantic Meloetta, who pointed its glowing light blue eyes on you.

A long moment passed, until the green-haired legendary... spoke.

"... Are you a human?" it asked, perfectly understandable and in a feminine voice.

Somehow, you found yourself replying with another question,

"... Wait, you're a girl?" you asked, remembering this legendary was supposed to be genderless, like most other; despite its looks, it had never gotten close enough for people to determine its gender, but Meloetta was apparently a 'she'. And a pretty annoyed one, too, you judged from her face.

"What kind of question is that? Of course I'm a girl!" she protested, her voice now raised a bit.

You snapped to attention, realizing you had just angered a legendary.

"I-I-I'm sorry! It's just that people believe..." you paused. How were you supposed to explain to her that you initially believed she wasn't a 'she', nor a 'he'?

Apparently, Meloetta picked up on your line of thinking, because, in a less annoyed tone, she asked,

"Do I look like a boy?"

She certainly didn't. And she didn't sound like one, either.

Suddenly, you felt microscopic under her gaze.

Blushing furiously, you lowered your head.

"Sorry..." you meekly apologized.

The green-haired giantess contemplated you for a moment, before she let out a low sigh.

"It's alright," she accepted the apology; she moved a hand beneath you as the psychic grip she still had on you vanished, causing you to fall in the middle of her hand,
"You really are a human, huh? Why are you so tiny though?" she asked, her annoyance replaced by curiosity.

You were reminded of the situation you were in.

"O-Oh, that's... I woke up a while, and there was a Mew-"

"Mew?" Meloetta interrupted, wondering what would be Mew doing in Unova.

The tiny human on her hand nodded.

"Y-Yeah, Mew. She started playing with me and then... she did this to me." you concluded.

Meloetta blinked. Then, she spoke gently,

"That is... strange." she simply said.

She knew Mew didn't live in one location like most legendaries did, and instead preferred to travel around, but shrink random people? Mew was playful, mischievous even at times, but this seemed a bit too much.

"She told me to go find her, but I, uh..." you trailed off as you a thought ran through your mind; you began feeling excited as the hope that your problem could end as soon as it began settled in,
"... But you're a legendary too, right? Then maybe you know how to help me, don't you? Can't you make me big again?... Please?"

Meloetta hesitated.

She wasn't really sure she could pull a trick like that, but she couldn't just leave you like this, either.

Perhaps, she could do it... or, perhaps, there were other ways to help you.
155552.title: Musical meeting

choices: The distraction works, safely in the room!
The distraction works! But the room is locked!
The distraction doesn’t work! The two are caught!
155553.content:
Shrunk to the same extremely small size as you, most people would immediately start thinking about how they would find Mew. You, however, did not have that luxury because you were currently freezing! Without warning, the cold of Snowpoint City’s locale bore into you and sent you into a shivering spree. Just moments ago you felt comfortable enough, but somehow the cold seems to have invaded your very being.

Reflexively you wrap your arms around yourself in a vain attempt to stay warm. As you wrapped your freezing body with your equally freezing arms, you immediately figured out why you suddenly felt so cold. All of your snow gear was gone! The only thing protecting you from the cold was the clothes you wore everyday. Did Mew psychic your clothes away with you noticing? How could she expect you to find her like this!?

“F-forget finding Mew. I t-think I’m going to die before I-I can even find, ugh, anyone.” You barely mumbled to yourself.

The initial numbness of the cold wore off slightly, letting you feel the bundles of snow that were piling up on your body. You tried to swipe some of the stuff off of your back, but more quickly took its place. Your bare head now had a literal snow cap on it, and the feeling of numbness was returning to you before you even started to move.

“Why would Mew do this? D…did she even want me to find her? Or was that some kind of cruel taunt?”

Still willing to try to avoid freezing to death, you began trudging forward through the snow. The snow on the ground barely registered to you when you had all your equipment, but now the stuff was nearly up to your waste. If you tripped, you’d be falling into your coffin and the snow would bury you so deep it would be like you never existed.

“Am I really… going to… die?” You mumbled, now exhausted.

You didn’t understand how your body was losing energy so quickly. Yes, you were freezing and getting coated in snow, but surely you could last longer. You were a Pokémon trainer after all! Sure you weren’t incredible, but you’ve won several badges and traveled through all kinds of conditions. You could be proud when you called yourself a trainer.

Your freezing face managed to grow pale. You were a trainer, and you had Pokémon. How would they feel when you didn’t get back? What would they even think? Would they spend days worrying about you, before tearfully giving up? Or would they hate you, thinking you left them after all your time together? Just the idea made you start to tear up, if you had the energy to do so at least.

“I… can’t die… out here.” You thought. “Not while those two are waiting for m-!”

Your thoughts were interrupted when… something collided with your back and forced you into the snow! But instead of being shoved into an icy coffin, it felt like you were covered by an amazing heated blanket! Somehow all of the bitter cold had disappeared, replaced with a comforting warmth. Too relieved by the sudden ambush of heat, you allow your body to go limp and relax. You laid on the snowy ground in silence for a while before you heard a comforting voice.

“Glaceon…”

That soothing voice could only belong to one person, your Glaceon. That explained why you were so warm all of a sudden! Glaceon always had an ability to manipulate the cold, she had done it for you plenty of times to make your tent warmer at night. But now, at your reduced size, she seemed to have complete control over your body temperature! She just saved your life!

“Y-your so warm.” You mumble dumbly, unable to think of anything else to say.

“I thought I sensed that you were in trouble.” Glaceon muttered gently. “I’m glad I could help.”

“You really are… so warm.”

Glaceon breathed a sigh of relief as you drifted off to sleep. She wasn’t sure how you managed to sleep, but she was glad you were alive regardless. Right now, she was extra grateful that she’d gotten so good with controlling temperature. She might have never realized there was an issue if she hadn’t-

“Grace, *awch*! Where’d yo- you g*awch*?”

Grace ignored the familiar voice, working on moving you to her back without disturbing you. It took a bit of effort, and some awkward distorting of her neck and back, but she eventually managed to deposit you on her back. Grace knew that she should be super concerned about your new size, but right now she was focused on getting you somewhere naturally warm.

“*Tsknt*! Ugh, stupid cold. I feel awful.” The voice from before complained. “Grace, what are you doing?”

Grace turned around to face the voice that was behind her. The voice belonged to a Leafeon with a red shade around her nose, showing she was a bit under the weather.

“I was just-” Grace was cut off by a petite sneeze from the Leafeon. “I was just saving master from the cold.”

“What do you-*Tsknt* mean? I don’t see him, anywhere.” Leafeon noted confused.

“Take a look.” Grace said simply, turning slightly to show you resting near her neck.

Astounded, Leafeon brought her head in closer for a better look. Not believing what she saw, she blinked and shook her head, but you remained on Grace’s back.

“Oh my gosh! What happened to-*AWCH*!” The grass types exclamation of surprise was interrupted by her harshest sneeze yet.

Leafeon growled in utter rage and contempt, while Grace nonchalantly turned back to her normal position.

“Stupid stupid cold! I hate the snow, I hate it! I’m all stuffy, snotty, and gross, and I can’t even be concerned about our trainer without getting inter… interruuuu, interruuu*pft*ed!”

Grace looked at her fellow Eeveelution with a smug smile. Honestly, she was super amused by the grass Pokémon’s cold. It made her sound funny and her getting irritated was a rare sight in any other circumstance.

“Wait, Rose, I just realized something.”

“What, ugh, is it.” The Leafeon asked with a sniffle.

“This whole time I’ve known you, I thought just your ears and tail had that red tint on them. But I just realized some of your face is red too! I can’t believe it took me so long to notice!”

Rose glared at her partner, her cheeks also becoming an irritated red.

“Haha.” She laughed sarcastically. “You’re a real comedian. Keep that up and I’ll sneeze in your food.”

Grace snickered and nodded her head forward, moving with Rose back towards Snowpoint City. She hoped she wouldn’t ask too many questions, because she didn’t have answers to any of them.

- - -

“So we’re taking him back to the Pokémon Center?” Rose asked Grace as they walked through the snowy streets of Snowpoint.

“That’s the plan. I can’t keep him warm forever, we gotta get him somewhere safe and private so he can tell us what happened.”

“Okay, that makes sense. But how are we going to get inside the Center without getting attention? We’re kind of just two strays with our shrunken trainer on our back.”

“...”

“You’re telling me you didn’t think of that!?”

“Of course I did!”

"Then what *sniff* what's the plan?" Rose asked swiping a paw at her irritated nose.

"It's simple. I'm going to have you trigger the motion sensing door, and then I'm going to blast the inside with Blizzard. Everyone inside will be too startled and distracted to notice us sprint to our room!"

"That's *achoo* that's your plan?"

"Do you got a better one?" Grace asked the Leafeon sarcastically.

"No." Rose replied with a sniffle. "I guess that's what we gotta do."

"Yep, we got no choice. Let's get going."
155553.title: Frosty Warmer, Sneezing Flower

info.brief_description: You get shrunk in the Pokeworld by Mew, and you have to go find it to get your height back
info.description:
n this story, you get shrunk by Mew and you have to go on a journey to find it if you want your height back.

Rules:
300 Words minimum per chapter.
No choice chapters.
If someone says you are in 'Unova' Don't suddenly change it so you are in 'Kanto' and randomly like that.
No Anthros, although Pokephile stuff is allowed.
This is my first interactive where Both genders are allowed. To make it feel more like a world and less like a Harem.
You can use both humans, as well Pokemon in this interactive
I preserve the write to delete or edit.

Some guidelines (Don't have to follow but reccomand)
Colour the Pokemon text Like this
Msg me if you are curious or got a question
Msg a fellow writer and see if you two can work on a path. It's very nice to do.
Have fun!
If you start a slot, you can edit the characters Age, gender, hair colour, skin colour and even personality if you want.
